body:
Hi Vishwak,
I want to provide a little background here for everyone other than you 
and me:  UC Merced has chosen to expose an API that, by default, is not 
exposed in the shared Component Manager.  This API, called 
SectionManager, allows a caller to manipulate sections in sakai from any 
webapp, web service, etc.  The API is deliberately not exposed because 
we anticipate that it will either be removed in the next version of 
sakai, or it will be so radically changed that it will essentially be a 
different API.  However, UC Merced wants to populate their sections via 
webservices (if I recall), so they want to expose the API... knowing 
full well that their work in this area may be rendered obsolete in the 
next version of sakai.

OK, so with that said...

SectionManager intentionally knows nothing of sakai APIs, so that the 
tool can be dropped into sakai, or operate as a standalone tool to 
support standalone gradebook and samigo... hence, you don't see the 
usual reference to Site, SiteEdit, etc in the API.  As you know, to add 
a section you call the following method:

public CourseSection addSection(String courseUuid, String title,
String category, Integer maxEnrollments, String location,
Time startTime, Time endTime,
boolean monday, boolean tuesday, boolean wednesday, boolean 
thursday,
boolean friday, boolean saturday, boolean sunday);

The javadocs on this method are not particularly helpful, especially 
when approaching the use of the API from a "sakai perspective".  The 
"courseUuid", which is the first parameter of the method call, is in 
fact the site reference.  So you don't even need to get a SiteEdit 
object.  Just get your current context, and use the SiteService to 
obtain the site's reference.  Something like this:

public static final String getSiteReference() {
Placement placement = ToolManager.getCurrentPlacement();
String context = placement.getContext();
return SiteService.siteReference(context);
}

Hope that helps,
Josh


Vishwak Rajgopalan wrote:

> Hi,
> I have been looking at the SectionManager API and other 
> section-related API's. I noticed that the addSection() .. method 
> description mentions that this adds a section to a parent course section.
>
> What is the method that is responsible for adding sections to a site 
> ?  addSection() method seems to me that it would need that a 
> CourseSection to already exist before further sections can be added.
>
> Suppose I create a site as follows
>
>            SiteEdit siteEdit = SiteService.addSite(compositeSiteId);
>
> This returns a siteEdit object that represents a course site/project 
> site.
>
> Is there any section - related methods that I can then call on this 
> siteEdit object , so that I can begin to add sections to this 
> course/project site that I have created. The current methods in the 
> SectionManager API's do not seem to have any methods that can perform 
> this function.
>
> Any suggestions on how to go about this would be highly invaluable.
>
> Regards,
> Vishwak Rajgopalan
> UC Merced
>
>
>

-- 
Josh Holtzman
Educational Technology Services, UC Berkeley
jholtzman@berkeley.edu
510.643.7380

body:
The unicode string is corrupted within the mysql database. Here's the =20
nitty-gritty on what I've been able to discover so far:

1. When =20
org.sakaiproject.component.app.syllabus.SyllabusDataImpl.setTitle() =20
is called from the JSF code (i.e. immediately after input from the =20
form), the unicode is correct
2. But this same setTitle() method is next invoked from hibernate, =20
and this time it is garbage:

http-8080-Processor24[1] dump title
title =3D "??"
http-8080-Processor24[1] where
[1] =20
org.sakaiproject.component.app.syllabus.SyllabusDataImpl.setTitle =20
(SyllabusDataImpl.java:91)
[2] org.sakaiproject.component.app.syllabus.SyllabusDataImpl$=20
$BulkBeanByCGLIB$$a2df78fc.setPropertyValues (null)
[3] =20
net.sf.hibernate.persister.AbstractEntityPersister.setPropertyValues =20
(AbstractEntityPersister.java:215)
.
.
.

- Beth

On Dec 13, 2005, at 3:42 PM, fribeiro@ufp.pt wrote:

>
> Beth,
>
> Could you check how the string looks like inside MySQL? I've found =20
> several
> places where character encoding is not preserved, but none at =20
> database level;
> Assuming that there's a utf setting everywhere (tomcat connectors, =20
> db, apache,
> file system).
>
> There are several places where strings, titles and resource names =20
> are encoded,
> and in some places the encoding may behave as if it was only ascii; =20
> just a
> guess, from what I've found in 1.0 and 2.0. The strings are already =20
> messed
> when they reach the database. In 1.0 there was one vm template =20
> doing an
> unecessary encoding when rendering.
>
> Why only with a database and not with in-memory? there could be =20
> some place where
> encoding of ', " and other nasty db characters takes place, and =20
> only ascii
> characters are respected. So, hibernate could have something to do =20
> with that,
> or more likely the db storage manager. Alternatively, something =20
> goes wrong
> when sakai fetches the information out of the db and does the =20
> necessary
> encodings.
>
> I hope that helps; that's the direction we are investigating right =20
> now.
> Feliz
>
>
>
>
> Quoting Beth Kirschner <bkirschn@umich.edu>:
>
>> I'm looking into problems reported with the UTF-8 characters in
>> Syllabus (and Samingo), which I've reproduced in both Sakai 2.0.1/
>> mysql and Sakai 2.1/mysql. The problem does not exist with HySqlDb. I
>> have my suspicions that the problem has something to do with
>> hibernate, but I haven't had the time to completely debug the
>> problem. UTF-8 Characters entered into the Syllbus (e.g. title) are
>> rendered at question marks ("??") after the changes have been saved
>> in MySql. Has anyone else duplicated this problem and/or have any
>> insight into it's cause?
>>
>> I noticed that JIRA SAK-116  reports this problem is fixed with
>> Oracle by applying the self-described kludge of r3807, but this patch
>> does not affect the problem with MySql.
>>
>> I've included in this message a thread regarding other UTF-8 problems
>> in 2.0.1/mysql that appear to have been resolved in Sakai 2.1. In
>> case these problems have a common cause, does anyone know what was
>> done to resolve the problems mentioned below in Mike's email?
>>
>> Thanks,
>> - Beth
>>
>> On Oct 22, 2005, at 9:37 PM, Mike Osterman wrote:
>>
>>> Hi Mike,
>>>
>>> I still haven't chased down all of the Unicode gremlins in my
>>> installation. They definitely seem related to MySQL, as the same
>>> codebase works flawlessly when using the default HSQL dB.
>>>
>>> The steps I've taken to attempt to remedy the problem are:
>>> * Ensuring that Tomcat server.xml is configured for UTF-8 on all =20
>>> ports
>>> * Updated to the latest version of the 3.1.x MySQL connector
>>> * Updated to the latest version of the 4.x MySQL server for Linux
>>> (MySQL.com pre-built RPM for RHEL3)
>>> * Exported all my tables, recreated the database with the correct
>>> default charset, and then reimported the tables.
>>>
>>> UTF-8 works in many places, but the few I've found that don't and
>>> are reproducible time after time are:
>>> * Admin workspace Pages tool - when attempting to rename Pages with
>>> accented characters, edits appear to be taking until the site edit
>>> is saved (at which point I'm assuming the object in memory is saved
>>> to MySQL). The renamed pages show up truncated at the unicode
>>> character. For example, Informaci=F3n becomes Informaci.
>>> * Assignments tool - using unicode characters in attributes of an
>>> assignment results in truncated XML in the MySQL database at the
>>> location of the first instance of the unicode character. No error
>>> is displayed to the end-user, and the only error in catalina.out is
>>> the resulting SAX XML parser error when redirected from Save to the
>>> listing of assignments. The assignments are not listed in the
>>> general listing. The SAX error is generated for each record with
>>> truncated XML during the iteration of the assignment list.
>>> * Resources tool - creating a URL resource with accented characters
>>> results in an error on post. For example, creating a URL item with
>>> the title "primer=EA" will result in the message "Alert: The URL
>>> title primer=EA has been used." This can be worked around by adding
>>> the object with no accented characters, then editing the object and
>>> setting the proper accented title and updating. We experience no
>>> problems with accented characters in titles for file uploads.
>>>
>>> I've been meaning to hook up a debugger and get to the bottom of
>>> this for some time now. Hopefully I can get to it this week.
>>>
>>> Michael Osterman
>>> Developer, Emerging Technology
>>> Whitman College
>>> ostermmg@whitman.edu
>>> 509-527-5419
>>>
>>>
>>> On Oct 20, 2005, at 3:03 PM, Mike De Simone wrote:
>>>
>>>> I haven't seen any updates in a while to this in any of the
>>>> referenced issues: 1688, 2015, 1357.  Does anyone know the state
>>>> of this issue currently?
>>>>
>>>> I am unable to create folders in the resources area with, for
>>>> instance, names with Hawaiian characters in their names. Or, more
>>>> correctly, I *can* create the folder, but when I try to access it,
>>>> I get the 'Alert: The collection does not exist" error.  If I look
>>>> in the database, the characters in question appear to have been
>>>> converted to question marks.
>>>>
>>>> I am using mysql connector 3.1.10, and have the tomcat URI
>>>> encoding set up (going through Apache, which has the
>>>> AddDefaultCharset UTF-8 directive set).
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> -----------------
>>>> Mike De Simone
>>>> Director of Client Support
>>>> The rSmart Group
>>>> 602-840-7300 x106
>>>> icq: 161896611
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> -----Original Message-----
>>>> From: Mike Osterman [mailto:ostermmg@whitman.edu]
>>>> Sent: Saturday, September 17, 2005 9:47 AM
>>>> To: sakai-dev
>>>> Cc: sakai-dev
>>>> Subject: Re: UTF-8 problem on Sakai 2.0.1 with MySQL
>>>>
>>>> James,
>>>>
>>>> I can verify this identical behavior with the correct 3.1.x
>>>> connector. Assignment XML is truncated in the database and the
>>>> assignment is not listed. I get log errors as the assigment list
>>>> iterates through the record set and hits each "bad" record.
>>>>
>>>> We also have intermittent problems with the Resources tool as well
>>>> when using Unicode characters in the title, though I haven't seem
>>>> system-wide instability with the tool as a result.
>>>>
>>>> I have anecdotal evidence from pilot testers that creating the
>>>> resource with non-Unicode characters first, then editing and adding
>>>> the Unicode characters at that point, it works. I have yet to =20
>>>> verify
>>>> this behavior myself.
>>>>
>>>> Michael Osterman
>>>> Developer, Emerging Technology
>>>> Whitman College
>>>> ostermmg@whitman.edu
>>>> 509-527-5419
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> On Sep 13, 2005, at 11:27 AM, James Williamson wrote:
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>> Hi folks,
>>>>>
>>>>> We looked into this problem a bit and filed an issue report in =20
>>>>> Jira
>>>>> (SAK-2015). Below are our notes on this issue.
>>>>>
>>>>> Discovered in Assignments and Resources
>>>>> Manifestation - Assignments:
>>>>> - If a user creates an assignment with a Unicode character in the
>>>>> Title field, the assignment does not show up in the list of
>>>>> assignments
>>>>> - The catalina.out log reveals a XML parsing error.
>>>>> - The MySQL database field contains an incomplete XML file that
>>>>> ends at the point where the Unicode character was found.
>>>>>
>>>>> Manifestation - Resources:
>>>>> - If a file upload contains a foreign character in the file name,
>>>>> the Resources tool may become unstable throughout the system =20
>>>>> and be
>>>>> unavailable to all sites.
>>>>>
>>>>> Comments
>>>>> - When the form used by the "New Assignment" page is processed, it
>>>>> generates an entire XML file and stores it in the database.
>>>>> - Examples are from the from assignment_content table. Other =20
>>>>> tables
>>>>> tables may be affected as well.
>>>>>
>>>>> Example good record:
>>>>> <?xml version=3D"1.0" encoding=3D"UTF-8"?>
>>>>> <content allowattach=3D"true"
>>>>> context=3D"b32cfe66-9ecc-4cba-0043-1e0df90222c1"
>>>>> datecreated=3D"20050826171605824" groupproject=3D"true" =20
>>>>> honorpledge=3D"1"
>>>>> id=3D"54293ba9-f85d-4d17-80ca-bbdd837754aa" indivgraded=3D"false"
>>>>> instructions=3D"SMOpcsOpIGlzIGEgbsOpdyBzdHJpbmcu
>>>>> "
>>>>> instructions-html=3D"SMOpcsOpIGlzIGEgbsOpdyBzdHJpbmcu
>>>>> "
>>>>> lastmod=3D"20050826171605824" numberofattachments=3D"0"
>>>>> numberofauthors=3D"0" releasegrades=3D"false" scaled_maxgradepoint=3D=
"0"
>>>>> submissiontype=3D"3" title=3D"Foreign Title" typeofgrade=3D"1">
>>>>> <properties>
>>>>> <property enc=3D"BASE64" name=3D"CHEF:creator" value=3D"YWRtaW4=3D
>>>>> "/>
>>>>> <property enc=3D"BASE64" name=3D"CHEF:modifiedby" value=3D"YWRtaW4=3D
>>>>> "/>
>>>>> <property enc=3D"BASE64" name=3D"DAV:getlastmodified"
>>>>> value=3D"MjAwNTA4MjYxNzE2MDgxMzU=3D
>>>>> "/>
>>>>> <property enc=3D"BASE64" name=3D"DAV:creationdate"
>>>>> value=3D"MjAwNTA4MjYxNzE2MDU4MjQ=3D
>>>>> "/>
>>>>> </properties>
>>>>> </content>
>>>>>
>>>>> Example bad record:
>>>>> <?xml version=3D"1.0" encoding=3D"UTF-8"?>
>>>>> <content allowattach=3D"true"
>>>>> context=3D"b32cfe66-9ecc-4cba-0043-1e0df90222c1"
>>>>> datecreated=3D"20050826171447016" groupproject=3D"true" =20
>>>>> honorpledge=3D"1"
>>>>> id=3D"ac84f7f7-e5a2-47aa-0090-eb72fe7b073b" indivgraded=3D"false"
>>>>> instructions=3D"VGhpcyBpcyBhIGZvcmVpZ24tbMO4w7hraW5nIHDDqmPDvGNlIG9m=
=20
>>>>> IH
>>>>> TD
>>>>> qXh0Lg=3D=3D
>>>>> "
>>>>> instructions-
>>>>> html=3D"VGhpcyBpcyBhIGZvcmVpZ24tbMO4w7hraW5nIHDDqmPDvGNlIG9mIHTDqXh0=
=20
>>>>> Lg
>>>>> =3D=3D
>>>>>
>>>>>
>>>> "
>>>>
>>>>> lastmod=3D"20050826171447016" numberofattachments=3D"0"
>>>>> numberofauthors=3D"0" releasegrades=3D"false" scaled_maxgradepoint=3D=
"0"
>>>>> submissiontype=3D"3" title=3D"Foreign Titl
>>>>>
>>>>> - Note that in the "bad record" that the data is truncated at the
>>>>> point where the original field data was "Foreign Titl=E9"
>>>>> - The "instructions" and "instructions-html" data values are being
>>>>> BASE64 encoded and thus are not vulnerable to this error.
>>>>> - The "title" data is stored as-entered by the user.
>>>>> - The data from the entire "New Assignment" form is being
>>>>> serialized into XML string and then stored in the database.
>>>>> - Upon retrieval of the data for display (as when refreshing the
>>>>> screen immediately after submission), the catalina.out log file
>>>>> shows the error and the new Assignment does not display in the =20
>>>>> list
>>>>> of Assignments. There is no warning to the user.
>>>>> - The error is: "WARN: readDocumentFromString:
>>>>> org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: XML document structures must start
>>>>> and end within the same entity." and "[Fatal Error] :8:67: XML
>>>>> document structures must start and end within the same entity."
>>>>> - The character set for the MySQL table is UTF-8 and we are using
>>>>> MySQL connector 3.1.
>>>>>
>>>>> Some additional comments:
>>>>>
>>>>> - Some of the data in the XML file is automatically pulled from
>>>>> Sakai. Some of this auto-generated data stored in the "property"
>>>>> element is repeated in the parent "content" element, albeit in an
>>>>> encoded fashion. Compare, for example,
>>>>> datecreated=3D"20050826171605824" with <property enc=3D"BASE64"
>>>>> name=3D"DAV:creationdate" value=3D"MjAwNTA4MjYxNzE2MDU4MjQ=3D
>>>>> "/> .
>>>>>
>>>>> - Some user-entered data within the "content" element is encoded
>>>>> but other user-entered data also within the "content" element is
>>>>> not encoded. Compare, for example,
>>>>> instructions=3D"SMOpcsOpIGlzIGEgbsOpdyBzdHJpbmcu
>>>>> " with title=3D"Foreign Title"
>>>>>
>>>>> Best regards, and we hope this helps,
>>>>>
>>>>> Jim
>>>>>
>>>>>
>>>>> On Sep 6, 2005, at 3:19 AM, Torben Bruun wrote:
>>>>>
>>>>>
>>>>>
>>>>>> Hi,
>>>>>>
>>>>>> We're running Sakai 2.0.1 on Debian Linux with MySQL. We're =20
>>>>>> having
>>>>>> problems with Danish letters - for instance if trying to add a
>>>>>> resource containing danish letters in the URl or in the name of
>>>>>> resource.
>>>>>>
>>>>>> MySQL database is created using
>>>>>>
>>>>>> create database sakai default character set utf8;
>>>>>>
>>>>>> show variables in mysql gives
>>>>>>
>>>>>> |
>>>>>> | character_set_client            | utf8 |
>>>>>> | character_set_connection        | utf8 |
>>>>>> | character_set_database          | utf8 |
>>>>>> | character_set_results           | utf8 |
>>>>>> | character_set_server            | utf8 |
>>>>>> | character_set_system            | utf8 |
>>>>>> | character_sets_dir              | /usr/share/mysql/charsets/ |
>>>>>> | collation_connection            | utf8_general_ci |
>>>>>> | collation_database              | utf8_general_ci |
>>>>>> | collation_server                | utf8_general_ci
>>>>>>
>>>>>>
>>>>>>
>>>>>> We've applied fix for SAK-1688 conserning using setBytes instead
>>>>>> of setCharacters.
>>>>>>
>>>>>> In Tomcat server.xml we've added
>>>>>>
>>>>>> <Connector port=3D"443" maxHttpHeaderSize=3D"8192"
>>>>>> URIEncoding=3D"UTF-8" ......
>>>>>>
>>>>>> We're running Apache in front of Tomcat. Apache is set to default
>>>>>> character set utf-8.
>>>>>>
>>>>>>
>>>>>> Does anyone have an idea about , why we still get problems with
>>>>>> danish characters ?
>>>>>>
>>>>>>
>>>>>> kind regards
>>>>>>
>>>>>> Torben Bruun
>>>>>>

body:
Thanks!

This looks like the place for me to start.

yuji
----

On Tue, 13 Dec 2005, John Leasia wrote:

> Yuji,
> You can create any type of worksite you want. The Admin Sites tool has a
> field for site type - if you were to type something in there other than
> course or project, you'd then have a new type. But to have that type be
> presented as a selection in Worksite setup when you choose at the
> beginning what type of site you want to create, you need to edit the
> sakai.sitesetup.xml file (at
> /trunk/sakai/legacy/tools/src/webapp/tools/sakai.sitesetup.xml) and add
> the new type.
>
> Then you would also need to edit tool registration files to add that new
> type, so that a given tool shows up as one that can be selected to
> include in that type of site when it is created.
>
> There are some notes (just ppt slides at this point) in this
> presentation that may help.
> http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/confluence/download/attachments/9638/Configuring+Sakai+Austin.ppt
>
> Then to sort, each user in their My Workspace can use the Worksite Setup
> tool to sort their list of sites by type.
>
> There has been talk of implementing a hierarchy in Sakai that would be
> useful in navigating through sites.. I'm not sure if it would help in
> navigating through types of sites though.
>
> John
>
> Yuji Shinozaki wrote:
>
> >Thanks for the response.  But perhaps I should provide some scope to my
> >question.  I am talking more in terms of:  given an out-of-the-box
> >installation of sakai, what would I have to implement in order to:
> >
> >1. identify a worksite as being a "course" or a "collaboration" or a "hoe
> >down" or a "singles mixer" or any other arbitrary classification.
> >
> >2. sort worksites according to those classifications, hopefully with some
> >notion of hierachy.
> >
> >3. access this information in order to use it to provide navigational
> >structure or cues.
> >
> >The use case is reimplementing the site navigation so that a user can more
> >easily navigate to "My Photography course", "My research group's
> >Retigeranic Acid Synthesis discussion group", "The Chess Club", "The
> >Campus Campaign to Rename Utah" without having to scroll through a list of
> >say 30 (or 300) worksites that they are a member of.  Rather they would
> >select "My Research -> Retigeranic Acid Sythesis" or "My Clubs ->
> >Political -> Campaign to Rename Utah".
> >
> >Our focus right now is on "ad hoc" collaborations and not courses,
> >although that will follow.
> >
> >If this is not possible, should it be?
> >
> >yuji
> >----
> >
> >On Mon, 12 Dec 2005, Jim Farmer wrote:
> >
> >
> >
> >>Manchester Metropolitan is leading the development of a toolkit to
> >>provide a course service. This work can be found at
> >>http://www.jisc.ac.uk/index.cfm?name=elfref_mmu&src=alpha and
> >>http://www.elframework.org/projects/xcri. The specification is being
> >>coordinated with U.S. software firms and PESC and SIF. This will become
> >>one of the JISC services using XML, SOAP, and WSDL. Note this
> >>specification can answer the course questions, but not the collaboration
> >>questions, worksite sponsorships, or a general search of metadata which
> >>may answer "kayaking" (unless Kayak was in the name of the worksite
> >>sponsor).
> >>
> >>Someone at the University of Essex may be able to better answer your
> >>question about collaborations. They are planning work on the use of the
> >>FOAF (friend of a friend) protocol to identify "collaborations." This
> >>builds on their Chimera project http://www.essex.ac.uk/chimera/index.html.
> >>
> >>A collaboration network could be built from course enrollments
> >>(including sections and projects) and any address the user may have in
> >>their collaboration tools. Because collaboration is coming from other
> >>research, a separate collaboration service built on the Chimera work may
> >>be preferable.
> >>
> >>jim farmer
> >>
> >>
> >>Yuji Shinozaki wrote:
> >>
> >>
> >>
> >>>Is there any taxonomy of worksites?  Or any accessible meta data about
> >>>worksites that can be used to organize them?
> >>>
> >>>What I would like to be able to answer are these types of questions:
> >>>
> >>>What are my Courses?
> >>>What are my Collaborations?
> >>>What are my Courses for the Spring Term 2003?
> >>>What are my Courses this semester?
> >>>What are my Physics courses?
> >>>What are my Ad Hoc Collaborations?
> >>>What are all the worksites sponsored by the Campus Democrats?
> >>>What worksites concern Kayaking?
> >>>
> >>>I have scanned the architecture documents and can't seem to find anything
> >>>specifically addressing this question.  Please point me in the right
> >>>direction if this documentation exists.
> >>>
> >>>If this type of course meta-data does not exist, are their plans for
> >>>implementing it?
> >>>
> >>>Yuji Shinozaki	                        Computer Systems Senior Engineer
> >>>ys2n@virginia.edu			Advanced Technologies Group
> >>>(434)924-7171				Information Technology & Communication
> >>>http://www.people.virginia.edu/~ys2n    University of Virginia

body:
Hello, Everyone
It is nice to see most of you in Austin during the Sakai conference. It 
was a wonderful and successful conference.
Well, we encountered a problem to upgrade to Sakai2.1from v2.0.1. 

The procedure we did:
1. Renamed sakai-src as "sakai-src-bak".
2, DLL sakai2.1 source as sakai-src.
3. Remove .maven/repository.
4. Did "maven clean"
5. Built successful
6. start tomcat, we got this error:
(should mention 2 things: 
-   we use MySQL database and as suggested, using mysql-connector 
v3.1.12 instead of v3.1.11
-   we manually modified 
"defaultTransactionIsolationString@javax.sql.BaseDataSource = 
TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED"  )

body:
Hi Grace:

Since you didn't mention this, I had to ask: did you notice that
placeholder.properties has been deprecated, and that this setting should now
be in sakai.properties?

~Clay

2005/12/13, Grace Wang <gwang3@unlnotes.unl.edu>:
>
> Hello, Everyone
> It is nice to see most of you in Austin during the Sakai conference. It
> was a wonderful and successful conference.
> Well, we encountered a problem to upgrade to Sakai2.1from v2.0.1.
>
> The procedure we did:
> 1. Renamed sakai-src as "sakai-src-bak".
> 2, DLL sakai2.1 source as sakai-src.
> 3. Remove .maven/repository.
> 4. Did "maven clean"
> 5. Built successful
> 6. start tomcat, we got this error:
> (should mention 2 things:
> -   we use MySQL database and as suggested, using mysql-connector
> v3.1.12 instead of v3.1.11
> -   we manually modified

> TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED"  )

body:
hi,
while running script for converting sakai 2.0 tables to sakai 2.1 
tables on mysql we encountered the below error

ERROR 1005 (HY000) at line 39: Can't create table 
'./sakai_ng2/#sql-929_6190.frm' (errno: 150)


did anyone get this error while running conversion scripts?

Thanks
Murthy

What we found is Foreign Key references missing column name. But 
still we get errors while insert statements are getting executed. Do 
any one run conversion scripts on mysql? We are using mysql 4.1.14

>
>did anyone get this error while running conversion scripts?
>
>Thanks
>Murthy

body:
Beth,

Could you check how the string looks like inside MySQL? I've found several
places where character encoding is not preserved, but none at database leve=
l;
Assuming that there's a utf setting everywhere (tomcat connectors, db, apac=
he,
file system).

There are several places where strings, titles and resource names are encod=
ed,=20
and in some places the encoding may behave as if it was only ascii; just a
guess, from what I've found in 1.0 and 2.0. The strings are already messed
when they reach the database. In 1.0 there was one vm template doing an
unecessary encoding when rendering.

Why only with a database and not with in-memory? there could be some place =
where
encoding of ', " and other nasty db characters takes place, and only ascii
characters are respected. So, hibernate could have something to do with tha=
t,
or more likely the db storage manager. Alternatively, something goes wrong
when sakai fetches the information out of the db and does the necessary=20
encodings.

I hope that helps; that's the direction we are investigating right now.
Feliz




Quoting Beth Kirschner <bkirschn@umich.edu>:

> I'm looking into problems reported with the UTF-8 characters in =20
> Syllabus (and Samingo), which I've reproduced in both Sakai 2.0.1/=20
> mysql and Sakai 2.1/mysql. The problem does not exist with HySqlDb. I =20
> have my suspicions that the problem has something to do with =20
> hibernate, but I haven't had the time to completely debug the =20
> problem. UTF-8 Characters entered into the Syllbus (e.g. title) are =20
> rendered at question marks ("??") after the changes have been saved =20
> in MySql. Has anyone else duplicated this problem and/or have any =20
> insight into it's cause?
>=20
> I noticed that JIRA SAK-116  reports this problem is fixed with =20
> Oracle by applying the self-described kludge of r3807, but this patch =20
> does not affect the problem with MySql.
>=20
> I've included in this message a thread regarding other UTF-8 problems =20
> in 2.0.1/mysql that appear to have been resolved in Sakai 2.1. In =20
> case these problems have a common cause, does anyone know what was =20
> done to resolve the problems mentioned below in Mike's email?
>=20
> Thanks,
> - Beth
>=20
> On Oct 22, 2005, at 9:37 PM, Mike Osterman wrote:
>=20
> > Hi Mike,
> >
> > I still haven't chased down all of the Unicode gremlins in my =20
> > installation. They definitely seem related to MySQL, as the same =20
> > codebase works flawlessly when using the default HSQL dB.
> >
> > The steps I've taken to attempt to remedy the problem are:
> > * Ensuring that Tomcat server.xml is configured for UTF-8 on all ports
> > * Updated to the latest version of the 3.1.x MySQL connector
> > * Updated to the latest version of the 4.x MySQL server for Linux =20
> > (MySQL.com pre-built RPM for RHEL3)
> > * Exported all my tables, recreated the database with the correct =20
> > default charset, and then reimported the tables.
> >
> > UTF-8 works in many places, but the few I've found that don't and =20
> > are reproducible time after time are:
> > * Admin workspace Pages tool - when attempting to rename Pages with =20
> > accented characters, edits appear to be taking until the site edit =20
> > is saved (at which point I'm assuming the object in memory is saved =20
> > to MySQL). The renamed pages show up truncated at the unicode =20
> > character. For example, Informaci=F3n becomes Informaci.
> > * Assignments tool - using unicode characters in attributes of an =20
> > assignment results in truncated XML in the MySQL database at the =20
> > location of the first instance of the unicode character. No error =20
> > is displayed to the end-user, and the only error in catalina.out is =20
> > the resulting SAX XML parser error when redirected from Save to the =20
> > listing of assignments. The assignments are not listed in the =20
> > general listing. The SAX error is generated for each record with =20
> > truncated XML during the iteration of the assignment list.
> > * Resources tool - creating a URL resource with accented characters =20
> > results in an error on post. For example, creating a URL item with =20
> > the title "primer=EA" will result in the message "Alert: The URL =20
> > title primer=EA has been used." This can be worked around by adding =20
> > the object with no accented characters, then editing the object and =20
> > setting the proper accented title and updating. We experience no =20
> > problems with accented characters in titles for file uploads.
> >
> > I've been meaning to hook up a debugger and get to the bottom of =20
> > this for some time now. Hopefully I can get to it this week.
> >
> > Michael Osterman
> > Developer, Emerging Technology
> > Whitman College
> > ostermmg@whitman.edu
> > 509-527-5419
> >
> >
> > On Oct 20, 2005, at 3:03 PM, Mike De Simone wrote:
> >
> >> I haven't seen any updates in a while to this in any of the =20
> >> referenced issues: 1688, 2015, 1357.  Does anyone know the state =20
> >> of this issue currently?
> >>
> >> I am unable to create folders in the resources area with, for =20
> >> instance, names with Hawaiian characters in their names. Or, more =20
> >> correctly, I *can* create the folder, but when I try to access it, =20
> >> I get the 'Alert: The collection does not exist" error.  If I look =20
> >> in the database, the characters in question appear to have been =20
> >> converted to question marks.
> >>
> >> I am using mysql connector 3.1.10, and have the tomcat URI =20
> >> encoding set up (going through Apache, which has the =20
> >> AddDefaultCharset UTF-8 directive set).
> >>
> >>
> >> -----------------
> >> Mike De Simone
> >> Director of Client Support
> >> The rSmart Group
> >> 602-840-7300 x106
> >> icq: 161896611
> >>
> >>
> >> -----Original Message-----
> >> From: Mike Osterman [mailto:ostermmg@whitman.edu]
> >> Sent: Saturday, September 17, 2005 9:47 AM
> >> To: sakai-dev
> >> Cc: sakai-dev
> >> Subject: Re: UTF-8 problem on Sakai 2.0.1 with MySQL
> >>
> >> James,
> >>
> >> I can verify this identical behavior with the correct 3.1.x
> >> connector. Assignment XML is truncated in the database and the
> >> assignment is not listed. I get log errors as the assigment list
> >> iterates through the record set and hits each "bad" record.
> >>
> >> We also have intermittent problems with the Resources tool as well
> >> when using Unicode characters in the title, though I haven't seem
> >> system-wide instability with the tool as a result.
> >>
> >> I have anecdotal evidence from pilot testers that creating the
> >> resource with non-Unicode characters first, then editing and adding
> >> the Unicode characters at that point, it works. I have yet to verify
> >> this behavior myself.
> >>
> >> Michael Osterman
> >> Developer, Emerging Technology
> >> Whitman College
> >> ostermmg@whitman.edu
> >> 509-527-5419
> >>
> >>
> >> On Sep 13, 2005, at 11:27 AM, James Williamson wrote:
> >>
> >>
> >>> Hi folks,
> >>>
> >>> We looked into this problem a bit and filed an issue report in Jira
> >>> (SAK-2015). Below are our notes on this issue.
> >>>
> >>> Discovered in Assignments and Resources
> >>> Manifestation - Assignments:
> >>> - If a user creates an assignment with a Unicode character in the
> >>> Title field, the assignment does not show up in the list of
> >>> assignments
> >>> - The catalina.out log reveals a XML parsing error.
> >>> - The MySQL database field contains an incomplete XML file that
> >>> ends at the point where the Unicode character was found.
> >>>
> >>> Manifestation - Resources:
> >>> - If a file upload contains a foreign character in the file name,
> >>> the Resources tool may become unstable throughout the system and be
> >>> unavailable to all sites.
> >>>
> >>> Comments
> >>> - When the form used by the "New Assignment" page is processed, it
> >>> generates an entire XML file and stores it in the database.
> >>> - Examples are from the from assignment_content table. Other tables
> >>> tables may be affected as well.
> >>>
> >>> Example good record:
> >>> <?xml version=3D"1.0" encoding=3D"UTF-8"?>
> >>> <content allowattach=3D"true"
> >>> context=3D"b32cfe66-9ecc-4cba-0043-1e0df90222c1"
> >>> datecreated=3D"20050826171605824" groupproject=3D"true" honorpledge=
=3D"1"
> >>> id=3D"54293ba9-f85d-4d17-80ca-bbdd837754aa" indivgraded=3D"false"
> >>> instructions=3D"SMOpcsOpIGlzIGEgbsOpdyBzdHJpbmcu
> >>> "
> >>> instructions-html=3D"SMOpcsOpIGlzIGEgbsOpdyBzdHJpbmcu
> >>> "
> >>> lastmod=3D"20050826171605824" numberofattachments=3D"0"
> >>> numberofauthors=3D"0" releasegrades=3D"false" scaled_maxgradepoint=3D=
"0"
> >>> submissiontype=3D"3" title=3D"Foreign Title" typeofgrade=3D"1">
> >>> <properties>
> >>> <property enc=3D"BASE64" name=3D"CHEF:creator" value=3D"YWRtaW4=3D
> >>> "/>
> >>> <property enc=3D"BASE64" name=3D"CHEF:modifiedby" value=3D"YWRtaW4=3D
> >>> "/>
> >>> <property enc=3D"BASE64" name=3D"DAV:getlastmodified"
> >>> value=3D"MjAwNTA4MjYxNzE2MDgxMzU=3D
> >>> "/>
> >>> <property enc=3D"BASE64" name=3D"DAV:creationdate"
> >>> value=3D"MjAwNTA4MjYxNzE2MDU4MjQ=3D
> >>> "/>
> >>> </properties>
> >>> </content>
> >>>
> >>> Example bad record:
> >>> <?xml version=3D"1.0" encoding=3D"UTF-8"?>
> >>> <content allowattach=3D"true"
> >>> context=3D"b32cfe66-9ecc-4cba-0043-1e0df90222c1"
> >>> datecreated=3D"20050826171447016" groupproject=3D"true" honorpledge=
=3D"1"
> >>> id=3D"ac84f7f7-e5a2-47aa-0090-eb72fe7b073b" indivgraded=3D"false"
> >>> instructions=3D"VGhpcyBpcyBhIGZvcmVpZ24tbMO4w7hraW5nIHDDqmPDvGNlIG9mI=
H=20
> >>> TD
> >>> qXh0Lg=3D=3D
> >>> "
> >>> instructions-
> >>> html=3D"VGhpcyBpcyBhIGZvcmVpZ24tbMO4w7hraW5nIHDDqmPDvGNlIG9mIHTDqXh0L=
g=20
> >>> =3D=3D
> >>>
> >>>
> >> "
> >>
> >>> lastmod=3D"20050826171447016" numberofattachments=3D"0"
> >>> numberofauthors=3D"0" releasegrades=3D"false" scaled_maxgradepoint=3D=
"0"
> >>> submissiontype=3D"3" title=3D"Foreign Titl
> >>>
> >>> - Note that in the "bad record" that the data is truncated at the
> >>> point where the original field data was "Foreign Titl=E9"
> >>> - The "instructions" and "instructions-html" data values are being
> >>> BASE64 encoded and thus are not vulnerable to this error.
> >>> - The "title" data is stored as-entered by the user.
> >>> - The data from the entire "New Assignment" form is being
> >>> serialized into XML string and then stored in the database.
> >>> - Upon retrieval of the data for display (as when refreshing the
> >>> screen immediately after submission), the catalina.out log file
> >>> shows the error and the new Assignment does not display in the list
> >>> of Assignments. There is no warning to the user.
> >>> - The error is: "WARN: readDocumentFromString:
> >>> org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: XML document structures must start
> >>> and end within the same entity." and "[Fatal Error] :8:67: XML
> >>> document structures must start and end within the same entity."
> >>> - The character set for the MySQL table is UTF-8 and we are using
> >>> MySQL connector 3.1.
> >>>
> >>> Some additional comments:
> >>>
> >>> - Some of the data in the XML file is automatically pulled from
> >>> Sakai. Some of this auto-generated data stored in the "property"
> >>> element is repeated in the parent "content" element, albeit in an
> >>> encoded fashion. Compare, for example,
> >>> datecreated=3D"20050826171605824" with <property enc=3D"BASE64"
> >>> name=3D"DAV:creationdate" value=3D"MjAwNTA4MjYxNzE2MDU4MjQ=3D
> >>> "/> .
> >>>
> >>> - Some user-entered data within the "content" element is encoded
> >>> but other user-entered data also within the "content" element is
> >>> not encoded. Compare, for example,
> >>> instructions=3D"SMOpcsOpIGlzIGEgbsOpdyBzdHJpbmcu
> >>> " with title=3D"Foreign Title"
> >>>
> >>> Best regards, and we hope this helps,
> >>>
> >>> Jim
> >>>
> >>>
> >>> On Sep 6, 2005, at 3:19 AM, Torben Bruun wrote:
> >>>
> >>>
> >>>
> >>>> Hi,
> >>>>
> >>>> We're running Sakai 2.0.1 on Debian Linux with MySQL. We're having
> >>>> problems with Danish letters - for instance if trying to add a
> >>>> resource containing danish letters in the URl or in the name of
> >>>> resource.
> >>>>
> >>>> MySQL database is created using
> >>>>
> >>>> create database sakai default character set utf8;
> >>>>
> >>>> show variables in mysql gives
> >>>>
> >>>> |
> >>>> | character_set_client            | utf8 |
> >>>> | character_set_connection        | utf8 |
> >>>> | character_set_database          | utf8 |
> >>>> | character_set_results           | utf8 |
> >>>> | character_set_server            | utf8 |
> >>>> | character_set_system            | utf8 |
> >>>> | character_sets_dir              | /usr/share/mysql/charsets/ |
> >>>> | collation_connection            | utf8_general_ci |
> >>>> | collation_database              | utf8_general_ci |
> >>>> | collation_server                | utf8_general_ci
> >>>>
> >>>>
> >>>>
> >>>> We've applied fix for SAK-1688 conserning using setBytes instead
> >>>> of setCharacters.
> >>>>
> >>>> In Tomcat server.xml we've added
> >>>>
> >>>> <Connector port=3D"443" maxHttpHeaderSize=3D"8192"
> >>>> URIEncoding=3D"UTF-8" ......
> >>>>
> >>>> We're running Apache in front of Tomcat. Apache is set to default
> >>>> character set utf-8.
> >>>>
> >>>>
> >>>> Does anyone have an idea about , why we still get problems with
> >>>> danish characters ?
> >>>>
> >>>>
> >>>> kind regards
> >>>>
> >>>> Torben Bruun

One  point - Sakai does not know the user's password...

- Glenn

Sakai Framework Architect
University Of Michigan
ggolden@umich.edu


On Dec 13, 2005, at 6:23 PM, William Chang wrote:

>
> Hi all,
>
> I am wondering if Sakai developers considering to implement "password
> forgotten" feature like it in many other sites, e.g. Yahoo groups.  
> When
> the user click on the "Password forgotten" link, Sakai will send a  
> copy
> of the user's password to this user's email account. This feature  
> prove
> to be helpful tool for Sakai/sites administrators. It will be so much
> easier to administering a site.
>
> Anyone have any ideas where I may find some sample codes if I want to
> try to code myself?
>
> Thanks,
> William Chang

body:
Hello,

We are a group of students at the university of Massachusetts developing a
Sakai tool for a software engineering course. We are attempting to extend
the presence tool to allow instant messaging but we are somewhat confused
about virtual path mappings within Sakai.
We modify the presence tool to have links for each name that will eventually
pop a window containing a JSP page. We do not understand however where to
place our JSP files or where to define their location.
Usually we use servlet-mapping to map the tool URL in web.xml, however the
presence tool seems to be somewhat different in its implementation. Would
anyone be able to shed some light on this issue or point us towards any
relevant documentation?

Thank you very much!
-Irene Ros, Oliver Chong and Nicholas Maniskas

body:
It looks like the url@javax.sql.BaseDataSource directive in sample
sakai.properties has problem.

The original line
url@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=3Djdbc:mysql://127.0.0.1:3306/sakai?useUnicode=
=3Dtrue&characterEncoding=3DUTF-8
should be
url@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=3Djdbc:mysql://127.0.0.1:3306/sakai?useUnicode=
=3Dtrue&characterEncoding=3DUTF-8

Note '&'.

M Nakamura

2005/12/13, Beth Kirschner <bkirschn@umich.edu>:
> The unicode string is corrupted within the mysql database. Here's the
> nitty-gritty on what I've been able to discover so far:
>
> 1. When
> org.sakaiproject.component.app.syllabus.SyllabusDataImpl.setTitle()
> is called from the JSF code (i.e. immediately after input from the
> form), the unicode is correct
> 2. But this same setTitle() method is next invoked from hibernate,
> and this time it is garbage:
>
> http-8080-Processor24[1] dump title
> title =3D "??"
> http-8080-Processor24[1] where
> [1]
> org.sakaiproject.component.app.syllabus.SyllabusDataImpl.setTitle
> (SyllabusDataImpl.java:91)
> [2] org.sakaiproject.component.app.syllabus.SyllabusDataImpl$
> $BulkBeanByCGLIB$$a2df78fc.setPropertyValues (null)
> [3]
> net.sf.hibernate.persister.AbstractEntityPersister.setPropertyValues
> (AbstractEntityPersister.java:215)
> .
> .
> .
>
> - Beth
>
> On Dec 13, 2005, at 3:42 PM, fribeiro@ufp.pt wrote:
>
> >
> > Beth,
> >
> > Could you check how the string looks like inside MySQL? I've found
> > several
> > places where character encoding is not preserved, but none at
> > database level;
> > Assuming that there's a utf setting everywhere (tomcat connectors,
> > db, apache,
> > file system).
> >
> > There are several places where strings, titles and resource names
> > are encoded,
> > and in some places the encoding may behave as if it was only ascii;
> > just a
> > guess, from what I've found in 1.0 and 2.0. The strings are already
> > messed
> > when they reach the database. In 1.0 there was one vm template
> > doing an
> > unecessary encoding when rendering.
> >
> > Why only with a database and not with in-memory? there could be
> > some place where
> > encoding of ', " and other nasty db characters takes place, and
> > only ascii
> > characters are respected. So, hibernate could have something to do
> > with that,
> > or more likely the db storage manager. Alternatively, something
> > goes wrong
> > when sakai fetches the information out of the db and does the
> > necessary
> > encodings.
> >
> > I hope that helps; that's the direction we are investigating right
> > now.
> > Feliz
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > Quoting Beth Kirschner <bkirschn@umich.edu>:
> >
> >> I'm looking into problems reported with the UTF-8 characters in
> >> Syllabus (and Samingo), which I've reproduced in both Sakai 2.0.1/
> >> mysql and Sakai 2.1/mysql. The problem does not exist with HySqlDb. I
> >> have my suspicions that the problem has something to do with
> >> hibernate, but I haven't had the time to completely debug the
> >> problem. UTF-8 Characters entered into the Syllbus (e.g. title) are
> >> rendered at question marks ("??") after the changes have been saved
> >> in MySql. Has anyone else duplicated this problem and/or have any
> >> insight into it's cause?
> >>
> >> I noticed that JIRA SAK-116  reports this problem is fixed with
> >> Oracle by applying the self-described kludge of r3807, but this patch
> >> does not affect the problem with MySql.
> >>
> >> I've included in this message a thread regarding other UTF-8 problems
> >> in 2.0.1/mysql that appear to have been resolved in Sakai 2.1. In
> >> case these problems have a common cause, does anyone know what was
> >> done to resolve the problems mentioned below in Mike's email?
> >>
> >> Thanks,
> >> - Beth
> >>
> >> On Oct 22, 2005, at 9:37 PM, Mike Osterman wrote:
> >>
> >>> Hi Mike,
> >>>
> >>> I still haven't chased down all of the Unicode gremlins in my
> >>> installation. They definitely seem related to MySQL, as the same
> >>> codebase works flawlessly when using the default HSQL dB.
> >>>
> >>> The steps I've taken to attempt to remedy the problem are:
> >>> * Ensuring that Tomcat server.xml is configured for UTF-8 on all
> >>> ports
> >>> * Updated to the latest version of the 3.1.x MySQL connector
> >>> * Updated to the latest version of the 4.x MySQL server for Linux
> >>> (MySQL.com pre-built RPM for RHEL3)
> >>> * Exported all my tables, recreated the database with the correct
> >>> default charset, and then reimported the tables.
> >>>
> >>> UTF-8 works in many places, but the few I've found that don't and
> >>> are reproducible time after time are:
> >>> * Admin workspace Pages tool - when attempting to rename Pages with
> >>> accented characters, edits appear to be taking until the site edit
> >>> is saved (at which point I'm assuming the object in memory is saved
> >>> to MySQL). The renamed pages show up truncated at the unicode
> >>> character. For example, Informaci=F3n becomes Informaci.
> >>> * Assignments tool - using unicode characters in attributes of an
> >>> assignment results in truncated XML in the MySQL database at the
> >>> location of the first instance of the unicode character. No error
> >>> is displayed to the end-user, and the only error in catalina.out is
> >>> the resulting SAX XML parser error when redirected from Save to the
> >>> listing of assignments. The assignments are not listed in the
> >>> general listing. The SAX error is generated for each record with
> >>> truncated XML during the iteration of the assignment list.
> >>> * Resources tool - creating a URL resource with accented characters
> >>> results in an error on post. For example, creating a URL item with
> >>> the title "primer=EA" will result in the message "Alert: The URL
> >>> title primer=EA has been used." This can be worked around by adding
> >>> the object with no accented characters, then editing the object and
> >>> setting the proper accented title and updating. We experience no
> >>> problems with accented characters in titles for file uploads.
> >>>
> >>> I've been meaning to hook up a debugger and get to the bottom of
> >>> this for some time now. Hopefully I can get to it this week.
> >>>
> >>> Michael Osterman
> >>> Developer, Emerging Technology
> >>> Whitman College
> >>> ostermmg@whitman.edu
> >>> 509-527-5419
> >>>
> >>>
> >>> On Oct 20, 2005, at 3:03 PM, Mike De Simone wrote:
> >>>
> >>>> I haven't seen any updates in a while to this in any of the
> >>>> referenced issues: 1688, 2015, 1357.  Does anyone know the state
> >>>> of this issue currently?
> >>>>
> >>>> I am unable to create folders in the resources area with, for
> >>>> instance, names with Hawaiian characters in their names. Or, more
> >>>> correctly, I *can* create the folder, but when I try to access it,
> >>>> I get the 'Alert: The collection does not exist" error.  If I look
> >>>> in the database, the characters in question appear to have been
> >>>> converted to question marks.
> >>>>
> >>>> I am using mysql connector 3.1.10, and have the tomcat URI
> >>>> encoding set up (going through Apache, which has the
> >>>> AddDefaultCharset UTF-8 directive set).
> >>>>
> >>>>
> >>>> -----------------
> >>>> Mike De Simone
> >>>> Director of Client Support
> >>>> The rSmart Group
> >>>> 602-840-7300 x106
> >>>> icq: 161896611
> >>>>
> >>>>
> >>>> -----Original Message-----
> >>>> From: Mike Osterman [mailto:ostermmg@whitman.edu]
> >>>> Sent: Saturday, September 17, 2005 9:47 AM
> >>>> To: sakai-dev
> >>>> Cc: sakai-dev
> >>>> Subject: Re: UTF-8 problem on Sakai 2.0.1 with MySQL
> >>>>
> >>>> James,
> >>>>
> >>>> I can verify this identical behavior with the correct 3.1.x
> >>>> connector. Assignment XML is truncated in the database and the
> >>>> assignment is not listed. I get log errors as the assigment list
> >>>> iterates through the record set and hits each "bad" record.
> >>>>
> >>>> We also have intermittent problems with the Resources tool as well
> >>>> when using Unicode characters in the title, though I haven't seem
> >>>> system-wide instability with the tool as a result.
> >>>>
> >>>> I have anecdotal evidence from pilot testers that creating the
> >>>> resource with non-Unicode characters first, then editing and adding
> >>>> the Unicode characters at that point, it works. I have yet to
> >>>> verify
> >>>> this behavior myself.
> >>>>
> >>>> Michael Osterman
> >>>> Developer, Emerging Technology
> >>>> Whitman College
> >>>> ostermmg@whitman.edu
> >>>> 509-527-5419
> >>>>
> >>>>
> >>>> On Sep 13, 2005, at 11:27 AM, James Williamson wrote:
> >>>>
> >>>>
> >>>>> Hi folks,
> >>>>>
> >>>>> We looked into this problem a bit and filed an issue report in
> >>>>> Jira
> >>>>> (SAK-2015). Below are our notes on this issue.
> >>>>>
> >>>>> Discovered in Assignments and Resources
> >>>>> Manifestation - Assignments:
> >>>>> - If a user creates an assignment with a Unicode character in the
> >>>>> Title field, the assignment does not show up in the list of
> >>>>> assignments
> >>>>> - The catalina.out log reveals a XML parsing error.
> >>>>> - The MySQL database field contains an incomplete XML file that
> >>>>> ends at the point where the Unicode character was found.
> >>>>>
> >>>>> Manifestation - Resources:
> >>>>> - If a file upload contains a foreign character in the file name,
> >>>>> the Resources tool may become unstable throughout the system
> >>>>> and be
> >>>>> unavailable to all sites.
> >>>>>
> >>>>> Comments
> >>>>> - When the form used by the "New Assignment" page is processed, it
> >>>>> generates an entire XML file and stores it in the database.
> >>>>> - Examples are from the from assignment_content table. Other
> >>>>> tables
> >>>>> tables may be affected as well.
> >>>>>
> >>>>> Example good record:
> >>>>> <?xml version=3D"1.0" encoding=3D"UTF-8"?>
> >>>>> <content allowattach=3D"true"
> >>>>> context=3D"b32cfe66-9ecc-4cba-0043-1e0df90222c1"
> >>>>> datecreated=3D"20050826171605824" groupproject=3D"true"
> >>>>> honorpledge=3D"1"
> >>>>> id=3D"54293ba9-f85d-4d17-80ca-bbdd837754aa" indivgraded=3D"false"
> >>>>> instructions=3D"SMOpcsOpIGlzIGEgbsOpdyBzdHJpbmcu
> >>>>> "
> >>>>> instructions-html=3D"SMOpcsOpIGlzIGEgbsOpdyBzdHJpbmcu
> >>>>> "
> >>>>> lastmod=3D"20050826171605824" numberofattachments=3D"0"
> >>>>> numberofauthors=3D"0" releasegrades=3D"false" scaled_maxgradepoint=
=3D"0"
> >>>>> submissiontype=3D"3" title=3D"Foreign Title" typeofgrade=3D"1">
> >>>>> <properties>
> >>>>> <property enc=3D"BASE64" name=3D"CHEF:creator" value=3D"YWRtaW4=3D
> >>>>> "/>
> >>>>> <property enc=3D"BASE64" name=3D"CHEF:modifiedby" value=3D"YWRtaW4=
=3D
> >>>>> "/>
> >>>>> <property enc=3D"BASE64" name=3D"DAV:getlastmodified"
> >>>>> value=3D"MjAwNTA4MjYxNzE2MDgxMzU=3D
> >>>>> "/>
> >>>>> <property enc=3D"BASE64" name=3D"DAV:creationdate"
> >>>>> value=3D"MjAwNTA4MjYxNzE2MDU4MjQ=3D
> >>>>> "/>
> >>>>> </properties>
> >>>>> </content>
> >>>>>
> >>>>> Example bad record:
> >>>>> <?xml version=3D"1.0" encoding=3D"UTF-8"?>
> >>>>> <content allowattach=3D"true"
> >>>>> context=3D"b32cfe66-9ecc-4cba-0043-1e0df90222c1"

m
> >>>>> IH
> >>>>> TD

> >>>>> html=3D"VGhpcyBpcyBhIGZvcmVpZ24tbMO4w7hraW5nIHDDqmPDvGNlIG9mIHTDqXh=
0
> >>>>> Lg
> >>>>> =3D=3D
> >>>>>
> >>>>>
> >>>> "
> >>>>
> >>>>> lastmod=3D"20050826171447016" numberofattachments=3D"0"
> >>>>> numberofauthors=3D"0" releasegrades=3D"false" scaled_maxgradepoint=
=3D"0"
> >>>>> submissiontype=3D"3" title=3D"Foreign Titl
> >>>>>
> >>>>> - Note that in the "bad record" that the data is truncated at the
> >>>>> point where the original field data was "Foreign Titl=E9"
> >>>>> - The "instructions" and "instructions-html" data values are being
> >>>>> BASE64 encoded and thus are not vulnerable to this error.
> >>>>> - The "title" data is stored as-entered by the user.
> >>>>> - The data from the entire "New Assignment" form is being
> >>>>> serialized into XML string and then stored in the database.
> >>>>> - Upon retrieval of the data for display (as when refreshing the
> >>>>> screen immediately after submission), the catalina.out log file
> >>>>> shows the error and the new Assignment does not display in the
> >>>>> list
> >>>>> of Assignments. There is no warning to the user.
> >>>>> - The error is: "WARN: readDocumentFromString:
> >>>>> org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: XML document structures must start
> >>>>> and end within the same entity." and "[Fatal Error] :8:67: XML
> >>>>> document structures must start and end within the same entity."
> >>>>> - The character set for the MySQL table is UTF-8 and we are using
> >>>>> MySQL connector 3.1.
> >>>>>
> >>>>> Some additional comments:
> >>>>>
> >>>>> - Some of the data in the XML file is automatically pulled from
> >>>>> Sakai. Some of this auto-generated data stored in the "property"
> >>>>> element is repeated in the parent "content" element, albeit in an
> >>>>> encoded fashion. Compare, for example,
> >>>>> datecreated=3D"20050826171605824" with <property enc=3D"BASE64"
> >>>>> name=3D"DAV:creationdate" value=3D"MjAwNTA4MjYxNzE2MDU4MjQ=3D
> >>>>> "/> .
> >>>>>
> >>>>> - Some user-entered data within the "content" element is encoded
> >>>>> but other user-entered data also within the "content" element is
> >>>>> not encoded. Compare, for example,
> >>>>> instructions=3D"SMOpcsOpIGlzIGEgbsOpdyBzdHJpbmcu
> >>>>> " with title=3D"Foreign Title"
> >>>>>
> >>>>> Best regards, and we hope this helps,
> >>>>>
> >>>>> Jim
> >>>>>
> >>>>>
> >>>>> On Sep 6, 2005, at 3:19 AM, Torben Bruun wrote:
> >>>>>
> >>>>>
> >>>>>
> >>>>>> Hi,
> >>>>>>
> >>>>>> We're running Sakai 2.0.1 on Debian Linux with MySQL. We're
> >>>>>> having
> >>>>>> problems with Danish letters - for instance if trying to add a
> >>>>>> resource containing danish letters in the URl or in the name of
> >>>>>> resource.
> >>>>>>
> >>>>>> MySQL database is created using
> >>>>>>
> >>>>>> create database sakai default character set utf8;
> >>>>>>
> >>>>>> show variables in mysql gives
> >>>>>>
> >>>>>> |
> >>>>>> | character_set_client            | utf8 |
> >>>>>> | character_set_connection        | utf8 |
> >>>>>> | character_set_database          | utf8 |
> >>>>>> | character_set_results           | utf8 |
> >>>>>> | character_set_server            | utf8 |
> >>>>>> | character_set_system            | utf8 |
> >>>>>> | character_sets_dir              | /usr/share/mysql/charsets/ |
> >>>>>> | collation_connection            | utf8_general_ci |
> >>>>>> | collation_database              | utf8_general_ci |
> >>>>>> | collation_server                | utf8_general_ci
> >>>>>>
> >>>>>>
> >>>>>>
> >>>>>> We've applied fix for SAK-1688 conserning using setBytes instead
> >>>>>> of setCharacters.
> >>>>>>
> >>>>>> In Tomcat server.xml we've added
> >>>>>>
> >>>>>> <Connector port=3D"443" maxHttpHeaderSize=3D"8192"
> >>>>>> URIEncoding=3D"UTF-8" ......
> >>>>>>
> >>>>>> We're running Apache in front of Tomcat. Apache is set to default
> >>>>>> character set utf-8.
> >>>>>>
> >>>>>>
> >>>>>> Does anyone have an idea about , why we still get problems with
> >>>>>> danish characters ?
> >>>>>>
> >>>>>>
> >>>>>> kind regards
> >>>>>>
> >>>>>> Torben Bruun

Luke

One  point - Sakai does not know the user's password...

- Glenn

X-Content-Type-Message-Body: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII
Archived-At: <http://permalink.gmane.org/gmane.comp.cms.sakai.devel/66>
body:
An email password feature (even if it had to email a newly generated password) might actually facilitate first time logins for SIS-Sakai integrations that aren't pre-populating the password in Sakai accounts.  This seems to be my predicament.   I'm using Stephen Githen's excellent Web services to perform SIS-Sakai integration and I'm using it to populate all of the important SIS data except the student's SIS password which is available in the SIS only as a hash. I can't populate Sakai created accounts with an SIS password using SakaiScript.addnewuser because the password parameter in SakaiScript.addnewuser, as far as I can tell, is only designed to accept a non-hashed version of the SIS password.    

I can still get first time users logged into Sakai by having them authenticate through our portal and then running the SakaiPortalLogin Web service.  But with an email password feature students wouldn't have to go through the portal the first time they log in -- they could get a generated password through the e-mail feature.

Alternatively, maybe Stephen's SakaiScript.addNewUser could store the SIS hashed password directly....rather than hashing it again (which is what I'm guessing Sakai does although maybe I'm totally off-base here).  

Cheers,

Luke

>>> "Glenn R. Golden" <ggolden@umich.edu> 12/13/05 7:18 PM >>>
One  point - Sakai does not know the user's password...

- Glenn

Glenn R. Golden
Sakai Framework Architect
University Of Michigan
ggolden@umich.edu

body:
The other 'gotcha' here is if you are using a CAS login like we are, the 
password isn't controlled by Sakai, nor is any user data stored in the 
local user database.  Our user information is stored in an external 
database.

Cheryl

body:
I guess it pays to read the sakai_properties.doc assiduously. I didn't
know that this feature existed although I see now that it's documented.

Quick question:

If I set:

notifyNewUserEmail=true 

and then use SakaiScript.addnewUser to add new accounts -- will Sakai
send an email to the email address specified in the new account?

Cheers,

Luke




>>> Cheryl Wogahn <cheryl.wogahn@yale.edu> 12/14/05 8:05 AM >>>
Thanks Zhen, this is exactly what I was looking for.  :)

Cheryl

Zhen Qian wrote:

> When one adds a guest user as site participant in Worksite Setup, if  
> the guest user is unknown, it gets added into Sakai with a random  
> password.
>
> There is a setting in sakai.properties, notifyNewUserEmail, to  
> control sending notification email. If the setting is true or  
> missing, an email with the random password will be sent to the guest  
> user. He can then use this password to login for the first time.
>
> Maybe we should add this feature into Admin's Users tool, so that  
> notification email will be sent when an guest account is added there.
>
> - Zhen
>
>
> On Dec 14, 2005, at 9:39 AM, Dave Ross wrote:
>
>> The discussion is irrelevant for any externally provided users, but
>> I'd like this feature to support our guest accounts (which are local
>> sakai accounts).
>>
>> -Dave
>>
>> On 12/14/05, Cheryl Wogahn <cheryl.wogahn@yale.edu> wrote:
>>
>>> The other 'gotcha' here is if you are using a CAS login like we  
>>> are, the
>>> password isn't controlled by Sakai, nor is any user data stored in 
the
>>> local user database.  Our user information is stored in an external
>>> database.
>>>
>>> Cheryl
>>>
>>> Luke FERNANDEZ wrote:
>>>
>>>> An email password feature (even if it had to email a newly  
>>>> generated password) might actually facilitate first time logins  
>>>> for SIS-Sakai integrations that aren't pre-populating the  password

>>>> in Sakai accounts.  This seems to be my predicament.    I'm using 
>>>> Stephen Githen's excellent Web services to perform SIS- Sakai 
>>>> integration and I'm using it to populate all of the  important SIS 
>>>> data except the student's SIS password which is  available in the 
>>>> SIS only as a hash. I can't populate Sakai  created accounts with 
>>>> an SIS password using  SakaiScript.addnewuser because the password 
>>>> parameter in  SakaiScript.addnewuser, as far as I can tell, is only

>>>> designed to  accept a non-hashed version of the SIS password.
>>>>
>>>> I can still get first time users logged into Sakai by having them  
>>>> authenticate through our portal and then running the  
>>>> SakaiPortalLogin Web service.  But with an email password feature  
>>>> students wouldn't have to go through the portal the first time  
>>>> they log in -- they could get a generated password through the e- 
>>>> mail feature.
>>>>
>>>> Alternatively, maybe Stephen's SakaiScript.addNewUser could store  
>>>> the SIS hashed password directly....rather than hashing it again  
>>>> (which is what I'm guessing Sakai does although maybe I'm totally  
>>>> off-base here).
>>>>
>>>> Cheers,
>>>>
>>>> Luke
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>>>> "Glenn R. Golden" <ggolden@umich.edu> 12/13/05 7:18 PM >>>
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>
>>>> One  point - Sakai does not know the user's password...
>>>>
>>>> - Glenn
>>>>
>>>> Glenn R. Golden
>>>> Sakai Framework Architect
>>>> University Of Michigan
>>>> ggolden@umich.edu
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> On Dec 13, 2005, at 6:23 PM, William Chang wrote:
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>> Hi all,
>>>>>
>>>>> I am wondering if Sakai developers considering to implement  
>>>>> "password
>>>>> forgotten" feature like it in many other sites, e.g. Yahoo groups.
>>>>> When
>>>>> the user click on the "Password forgotten" link, Sakai will send a
>>>>> copy
>>>>> of the user's password to this user's email account. This feature
>>>>> prove
>>>>> to be helpful tool for Sakai/sites administrators. It will be so  
>>>>> much
>>>>> easier to administering a site.
>>>>>
>>>>> Anyone have any ideas where I may find some sample codes if I  
>>>>> want to
>>>>> try to code myself?
>>>>>
>>>>> Thanks,
>>>>> William Chang

body:
2005/12/7, Jon Higham <j.higham@hull.ac.uk>:
>
> Sorry, how do I check that the dav path is mapped via the apache/tomcat?


I don't know that this is your issue, but just to answer this specific
question: it will be configured in apache's conf directory somewhere, either
in httpd.conf, or in mod_jk.conf (preferred).  You'll need settings that
look something like:

JkMount /* ajp13
#JkMount  /portal/* ajp13
#JkMount /dav/* ajp13
#JkMount /access/* ajp13

That first line is just for handing everything from Apache to Tomcat,
including dav.  The commented ones are for doing crazy things like trying to
hand only certain things to Tomcat, and have Apache handle the rest - like
we did.

~Clay



>
[see attachment: "message0.html", size: 1174 bytes]

body:
Yea! This was the problem. Many thanks for pointing this out.

- Beth

On Dec 14, 2005, at 1:47 AM, M Nakamura wrote:

> It looks like the url@javax.sql.BaseDataSource directive in sample
> sakai.properties has problem.
>
> The original line
> url@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=3Djdbc:mysql://127.0.0.1:3306/sakai?=20
> useUnicode=3Dtrue&characterEncoding=3DUTF-8
> should be
> url@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=3Djdbc:mysql://127.0.0.1:3306/sakai?=20
> useUnicode=3Dtrue&characterEncoding=3DUTF-8
>
> Note '&'.
>
> M Nakamura
>
> 2005/12/13, Beth Kirschner <bkirschn@umich.edu>:
>> The unicode string is corrupted within the mysql database. Here's the
>> nitty-gritty on what I've been able to discover so far:
>>
>> 1. When
>> org.sakaiproject.component.app.syllabus.SyllabusDataImpl.setTitle()
>> is called from the JSF code (i.e. immediately after input from the
>> form), the unicode is correct
>> 2. But this same setTitle() method is next invoked from hibernate,
>> and this time it is garbage:
>>
>> http-8080-Processor24[1] dump title
>> title =3D "??"
>> http-8080-Processor24[1] where
>> [1]
>> org.sakaiproject.component.app.syllabus.SyllabusDataImpl.setTitle
>> (SyllabusDataImpl.java:91)
>> [2] org.sakaiproject.component.app.syllabus.SyllabusDataImpl$
>> $BulkBeanByCGLIB$$a2df78fc.setPropertyValues (null)
>> [3]
>> net.sf.hibernate.persister.AbstractEntityPersister.setPropertyValues
>> (AbstractEntityPersister.java:215)
>> .
>> .
>> .
>>
>> - Beth
>>
>> On Dec 13, 2005, at 3:42 PM, fribeiro@ufp.pt wrote:
>>
>>>
>>> Beth,
>>>
>>> Could you check how the string looks like inside MySQL? I've found
>>> several
>>> places where character encoding is not preserved, but none at
>>> database level;
>>> Assuming that there's a utf setting everywhere (tomcat connectors,
>>> db, apache,
>>> file system).
>>>
>>> There are several places where strings, titles and resource names
>>> are encoded,
>>> and in some places the encoding may behave as if it was only ascii;
>>> just a
>>> guess, from what I've found in 1.0 and 2.0. The strings are already
>>> messed
>>> when they reach the database. In 1.0 there was one vm template
>>> doing an
>>> unecessary encoding when rendering.
>>>
>>> Why only with a database and not with in-memory? there could be
>>> some place where
>>> encoding of ', " and other nasty db characters takes place, and
>>> only ascii
>>> characters are respected. So, hibernate could have something to do
>>> with that,
>>> or more likely the db storage manager. Alternatively, something
>>> goes wrong
>>> when sakai fetches the information out of the db and does the
>>> necessary
>>> encodings.
>>>
>>> I hope that helps; that's the direction we are investigating right
>>> now.
>>> Feliz
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>> Quoting Beth Kirschner <bkirschn@umich.edu>:
>>>
>>>> I'm looking into problems reported with the UTF-8 characters in
>>>> Syllabus (and Samingo), which I've reproduced in both Sakai 2.0.1/
>>>> mysql and Sakai 2.1/mysql. The problem does not exist with =20
>>>> HySqlDb. I
>>>> have my suspicions that the problem has something to do with
>>>> hibernate, but I haven't had the time to completely debug the
>>>> problem. UTF-8 Characters entered into the Syllbus (e.g. title) are
>>>> rendered at question marks ("??") after the changes have been saved
>>>> in MySql. Has anyone else duplicated this problem and/or have any
>>>> insight into it's cause?
>>>>
>>>> I noticed that JIRA SAK-116  reports this problem is fixed with
>>>> Oracle by applying the self-described kludge of r3807, but this =20
>>>> patch
>>>> does not affect the problem with MySql.
>>>>
>>>> I've included in this message a thread regarding other UTF-8 =20
>>>> problems
>>>> in 2.0.1/mysql that appear to have been resolved in Sakai 2.1. In
>>>> case these problems have a common cause, does anyone know what was
>>>> done to resolve the problems mentioned below in Mike's email?
>>>>
>>>> Thanks,
>>>> - Beth
>>>>
>>>> On Oct 22, 2005, at 9:37 PM, Mike Osterman wrote:
>>>>
>>>>> Hi Mike,
>>>>>
>>>>> I still haven't chased down all of the Unicode gremlins in my
>>>>> installation. They definitely seem related to MySQL, as the same
>>>>> codebase works flawlessly when using the default HSQL dB.
>>>>>
>>>>> The steps I've taken to attempt to remedy the problem are:
>>>>> * Ensuring that Tomcat server.xml is configured for UTF-8 on all
>>>>> ports
>>>>> * Updated to the latest version of the 3.1.x MySQL connector
>>>>> * Updated to the latest version of the 4.x MySQL server for Linux
>>>>> (MySQL.com pre-built RPM for RHEL3)
>>>>> * Exported all my tables, recreated the database with the correct
>>>>> default charset, and then reimported the tables.
>>>>>
>>>>> UTF-8 works in many places, but the few I've found that don't and
>>>>> are reproducible time after time are:
>>>>> * Admin workspace Pages tool - when attempting to rename Pages =20
>>>>> with
>>>>> accented characters, edits appear to be taking until the site edit
>>>>> is saved (at which point I'm assuming the object in memory is =20
>>>>> saved
>>>>> to MySQL). The renamed pages show up truncated at the unicode
>>>>> character. For example, Informaci=F3n becomes Informaci.
>>>>> * Assignments tool - using unicode characters in attributes of an
>>>>> assignment results in truncated XML in the MySQL database at the
>>>>> location of the first instance of the unicode character. No error
>>>>> is displayed to the end-user, and the only error in =20
>>>>> catalina.out is
>>>>> the resulting SAX XML parser error when redirected from Save to =20
>>>>> the
>>>>> listing of assignments. The assignments are not listed in the
>>>>> general listing. The SAX error is generated for each record with
>>>>> truncated XML during the iteration of the assignment list.
>>>>> * Resources tool - creating a URL resource with accented =20
>>>>> characters
>>>>> results in an error on post. For example, creating a URL item with
>>>>> the title "primer=EA" will result in the message "Alert: The URL
>>>>> title primer=EA has been used." This can be worked around by adding
>>>>> the object with no accented characters, then editing the object =20
>>>>> and
>>>>> setting the proper accented title and updating. We experience no
>>>>> problems with accented characters in titles for file uploads.
>>>>>
>>>>> I've been meaning to hook up a debugger and get to the bottom of
>>>>> this for some time now. Hopefully I can get to it this week.
>>>>>
>>>>> Michael Osterman
>>>>> Developer, Emerging Technology
>>>>> Whitman College
>>>>> ostermmg@whitman.edu
>>>>> 509-527-5419
>>>>>
>>>>>
>>>>> On Oct 20, 2005, at 3:03 PM, Mike De Simone wrote:
>>>>>
>>>>>> I haven't seen any updates in a while to this in any of the
>>>>>> referenced issues: 1688, 2015, 1357.  Does anyone know the state
>>>>>> of this issue currently?
>>>>>>
>>>>>> I am unable to create folders in the resources area with, for
>>>>>> instance, names with Hawaiian characters in their names. Or, more
>>>>>> correctly, I *can* create the folder, but when I try to access =20
>>>>>> it,
>>>>>> I get the 'Alert: The collection does not exist" error.  If I =20
>>>>>> look
>>>>>> in the database, the characters in question appear to have been
>>>>>> converted to question marks.
>>>>>>
>>>>>> I am using mysql connector 3.1.10, and have the tomcat URI
>>>>>> encoding set up (going through Apache, which has the
>>>>>> AddDefaultCharset UTF-8 directive set).
>>>>>>
>>>>>>
>>>>>> -----------------
>>>>>> Mike De Simone
>>>>>> Director of Client Support
>>>>>> The rSmart Group
>>>>>> 602-840-7300 x106
>>>>>> icq: 161896611
>>>>>>
>>>>>>
>>>>>> -----Original Message-----
>>>>>> From: Mike Osterman [mailto:ostermmg@whitman.edu]
>>>>>> Sent: Saturday, September 17, 2005 9:47 AM
>>>>>> To: sakai-dev
>>>>>> Cc: sakai-dev
>>>>>> Subject: Re: UTF-8 problem on Sakai 2.0.1 with MySQL
>>>>>>
>>>>>> James,
>>>>>>
>>>>>> I can verify this identical behavior with the correct 3.1.x
>>>>>> connector. Assignment XML is truncated in the database and the
>>>>>> assignment is not listed. I get log errors as the assigment list
>>>>>> iterates through the record set and hits each "bad" record.
>>>>>>
>>>>>> We also have intermittent problems with the Resources tool as =20
>>>>>> well
>>>>>> when using Unicode characters in the title, though I haven't seem
>>>>>> system-wide instability with the tool as a result.
>>>>>>
>>>>>> I have anecdotal evidence from pilot testers that creating the
>>>>>> resource with non-Unicode characters first, then editing and =20
>>>>>> adding
>>>>>> the Unicode characters at that point, it works. I have yet to
>>>>>> verify
>>>>>> this behavior myself.
>>>>>>
>>>>>> Michael Osterman
>>>>>> Developer, Emerging Technology
>>>>>> Whitman College
>>>>>> ostermmg@whitman.edu
>>>>>> 509-527-5419
>>>>>>
>>>>>>
>>>>>> On Sep 13, 2005, at 11:27 AM, James Williamson wrote:
>>>>>>
>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Hi folks,
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> We looked into this problem a bit and filed an issue report in
>>>>>>> Jira
>>>>>>> (SAK-2015). Below are our notes on this issue.
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Discovered in Assignments and Resources
>>>>>>> Manifestation - Assignments:
>>>>>>> - If a user creates an assignment with a Unicode character in =20
>>>>>>> the
>>>>>>> Title field, the assignment does not show up in the list of
>>>>>>> assignments
>>>>>>> - The catalina.out log reveals a XML parsing error.
>>>>>>> - The MySQL database field contains an incomplete XML file that
>>>>>>> ends at the point where the Unicode character was found.
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Manifestation - Resources:
>>>>>>> - If a file upload contains a foreign character in the file =20
>>>>>>> name,
>>>>>>> the Resources tool may become unstable throughout the system
>>>>>>> and be
>>>>>>> unavailable to all sites.
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Comments
>>>>>>> - When the form used by the "New Assignment" page is =20
>>>>>>> processed, it
>>>>>>> generates an entire XML file and stores it in the database.
>>>>>>> - Examples are from the from assignment_content table. Other
>>>>>>> tables
>>>>>>> tables may be affected as well.
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Example good record:
>>>>>>> <?xml version=3D"1.0" encoding=3D"UTF-8"?>
>>>>>>> <content allowattach=3D"true"
>>>>>>> context=3D"b32cfe66-9ecc-4cba-0043-1e0df90222c1"
>>>>>>> datecreated=3D"20050826171605824" groupproject=3D"true"
>>>>>>> honorpledge=3D"1"
>>>>>>> id=3D"54293ba9-f85d-4d17-80ca-bbdd837754aa" indivgraded=3D"false"
>>>>>>> instructions=3D"SMOpcsOpIGlzIGEgbsOpdyBzdHJpbmcu
>>>>>>> "
>>>>>>> instructions-html=3D"SMOpcsOpIGlzIGEgbsOpdyBzdHJpbmcu
>>>>>>> "
>>>>>>> lastmod=3D"20050826171605824" numberofattachments=3D"0"
>>>>>>> numberofauthors=3D"0" releasegrades=3D"false" =20
>>>>>>> scaled_maxgradepoint=3D"0"
>>>>>>> submissiontype=3D"3" title=3D"Foreign Title" typeofgrade=3D"1">
>>>>>>> <properties>
>>>>>>> <property enc=3D"BASE64" name=3D"CHEF:creator" value=3D"YWRtaW4=3D
>>>>>>> "/>
>>>>>>> <property enc=3D"BASE64" name=3D"CHEF:modifiedby" value=3D"YWRtaW4=
=3D
>>>>>>> "/>
>>>>>>> <property enc=3D"BASE64" name=3D"DAV:getlastmodified"
>>>>>>> value=3D"MjAwNTA4MjYxNzE2MDgxMzU=3D
>>>>>>> "/>
>>>>>>> <property enc=3D"BASE64" name=3D"DAV:creationdate"
>>>>>>> value=3D"MjAwNTA4MjYxNzE2MDU4MjQ=3D
>>>>>>> "/>
>>>>>>> </properties>
>>>>>>> </content>
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Example bad record:
>>>>>>> <?xml version=3D"1.0" encoding=3D"UTF-8"?>
>>>>>>> <content allowattach=3D"true"
>>>>>>> context=3D"b32cfe66-9ecc-4cba-0043-1e0df90222c1"
>>>>>>> datecreated=3D"20050826171447016" groupproject=3D"true"
>>>>>>> honorpledge=3D"1"
>>>>>>> id=3D"ac84f7f7-e5a2-47aa-0090-eb72fe7b073b" indivgraded=3D"false"
>>>>>>> instructions=3D"VGhpcyBpcyBhIGZvcmVpZ24tbMO4w7hraW5nIHDDqmPDvGNlIG=
=20
>>>>>>> 9m
>>>>>>> IH
>>>>>>> TD
>>>>>>> qXh0Lg=3D=3D
>>>>>>> "
>>>>>>> instructions-
>>>>>>> html=3D"VGhpcyBpcyBhIGZvcmVpZ24tbMO4w7hraW5nIHDDqmPDvGNlIG9mIHTDqX=
=20
>>>>>>> h0
>>>>>>> Lg
>>>>>>> =3D=3D
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>
>>>>>> "
>>>>>>
>>>>>>> lastmod=3D"20050826171447016" numberofattachments=3D"0"
>>>>>>> numberofauthors=3D"0" releasegrades=3D"false" =20
>>>>>>> scaled_maxgradepoint=3D"0"
>>>>>>> submissiontype=3D"3" title=3D"Foreign Titl
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> - Note that in the "bad record" that the data is truncated at =20
>>>>>>> the
>>>>>>> point where the original field data was "Foreign Titl=E9"
>>>>>>> - The "instructions" and "instructions-html" data values are =20
>>>>>>> being
>>>>>>> BASE64 encoded and thus are not vulnerable to this error.
>>>>>>> - The "title" data is stored as-entered by the user.
>>>>>>> - The data from the entire "New Assignment" form is being
>>>>>>> serialized into XML string and then stored in the database.
>>>>>>> - Upon retrieval of the data for display (as when refreshing the
>>>>>>> screen immediately after submission), the catalina.out log file
>>>>>>> shows the error and the new Assignment does not display in the
>>>>>>> list
>>>>>>> of Assignments. There is no warning to the user.
>>>>>>> - The error is: "WARN: readDocumentFromString:
>>>>>>> org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: XML document structures must =20
>>>>>>> start
>>>>>>> and end within the same entity." and "[Fatal Error] :8:67: XML
>>>>>>> document structures must start and end within the same entity."
>>>>>>> - The character set for the MySQL table is UTF-8 and we are =20
>>>>>>> using
>>>>>>> MySQL connector 3.1.
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Some additional comments:
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> - Some of the data in the XML file is automatically pulled from
>>>>>>> Sakai. Some of this auto-generated data stored in the "property"
>>>>>>> element is repeated in the parent "content" element, albeit =20
>>>>>>> in an
>>>>>>> encoded fashion. Compare, for example,
>>>>>>> datecreated=3D"20050826171605824" with <property enc=3D"BASE64"
>>>>>>> name=3D"DAV:creationdate" value=3D"MjAwNTA4MjYxNzE2MDU4MjQ=3D
>>>>>>> "/> .
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> - Some user-entered data within the "content" element is encoded
>>>>>>> but other user-entered data also within the "content" element is
>>>>>>> not encoded. Compare, for example,
>>>>>>> instructions=3D"SMOpcsOpIGlzIGEgbsOpdyBzdHJpbmcu
>>>>>>> " with title=3D"Foreign Title"
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Best regards, and we hope this helps,
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Jim
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> On Sep 6, 2005, at 3:19 AM, Torben Bruun wrote:
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> Hi,
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> We're running Sakai 2.0.1 on Debian Linux with MySQL. We're
>>>>>>>> having
>>>>>>>> problems with Danish letters - for instance if trying to add a
>>>>>>>> resource containing danish letters in the URl or in the name of
>>>>>>>> resource.
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> MySQL database is created using
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> create database sakai default character set utf8;
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> show variables in mysql gives
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> |
>>>>>>>> | character_set_client            | utf8 |
>>>>>>>> | character_set_connection        | utf8 |
>>>>>>>> | character_set_database          | utf8 |
>>>>>>>> | character_set_results           | utf8 |
>>>>>>>> | character_set_server            | utf8 |
>>>>>>>> | character_set_system            | utf8 |
>>>>>>>> | character_sets_dir              | /usr/share/mysql/=20
>>>>>>>> charsets/ |
>>>>>>>> | collation_connection            | utf8_general_ci |
>>>>>>>> | collation_database              | utf8_general_ci |
>>>>>>>> | collation_server                | utf8_general_ci
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> We've applied fix for SAK-1688 conserning using setBytes =20
>>>>>>>> instead
>>>>>>>> of setCharacters.
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> In Tomcat server.xml we've added
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> <Connector port=3D"443" maxHttpHeaderSize=3D"8192"
>>>>>>>> URIEncoding=3D"UTF-8" ......
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> We're running Apache in front of Tomcat. Apache is set to =20
>>>>>>>> default
>>>>>>>> character set utf-8.
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> Does anyone have an idea about , why we still get problems with
>>>>>>>> danish characters ?
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> kind regards
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> Torben Bruun
