body:
Any "password forgotten" feature would be implementation and local policy
dependent.  Perhaps Sakai should have a simple interface and example using
the internal database, and leave it to local installations to implement
one according to their local desires and policies.  I think it should be
separate from the authentication interfaces, since it really doesn't have
anything to do with authentication (it has to do with communicating with a
backend service which happens to do authentication).

The implementation for SSO could be simply to refer them to whatever
mechanisms the local SSO provider has in place...

yuji
----






On Wed, 14 Dec 2005, Cheryl Wogahn wrote:

> The other 'gotcha' here is if you are using a CAS login like we are, the
> password isn't controlled by Sakai, nor is any user data stored in the
> local user database.  Our user information is stored in an external
> database.
>
> Cheryl
>
> Luke FERNANDEZ wrote:
>
> >An email password feature (even if it had to email a newly generated password) might actually facilitate first time logins for SIS-Sakai integrations that aren't pre-populating the password in Sakai accounts.  This seems to be my predicament.   I'm using Stephen Githen's excellent Web services to perform SIS-Sakai integration and I'm using it to populate all of the important SIS data except the student's SIS password which is available in the SIS only as a hash. I can't populate Sakai created accounts with an SIS password using SakaiScript.addnewuser because the password parameter in SakaiScript.addnewuser, as far as I can tell, is only designed to accept a non-hashed version of the SIS password.
> >
> >I can still get first time users logged into Sakai by having them authenticate through our portal and then running the SakaiPortalLogin Web service.  But with an email password feature students wouldn't have to go through the portal the first time they log in -- they could get a generated password through the e-mail feature.
> >
> >Alternatively, maybe Stephen's SakaiScript.addNewUser could store the SIS hashed password directly....rather than hashing it again (which is what I'm guessing Sakai does although maybe I'm totally off-base here).
> >
> >Cheers,
> >
> >Luke
> >
> >
> >
> >>>>"Glenn R. Golden" <ggolden@umich.edu> 12/13/05 7:18 PM >>>
> >>>>
> >>>>
> >One  point - Sakai does not know the user's password...
> >
> >- Glenn
> >
> >Glenn R. Golden
> >Sakai Framework Architect
> >University Of Michigan
> >ggolden@umich.edu
> >
> >
> >On Dec 13, 2005, at 6:23 PM, William Chang wrote:
> >
> >
> >
> >>Hi all,
> >>
> >>I am wondering if Sakai developers considering to implement "password
> >>forgotten" feature like it in many other sites, e.g. Yahoo groups.
> >>When
> >>the user click on the "Password forgotten" link, Sakai will send a
> >>copy
> >>of the user's password to this user's email account. This feature
> >>prove
> >>to be helpful tool for Sakai/sites administrators. It will be so much
> >>easier to administering a site.
> >>
> >>Anyone have any ideas where I may find some sample codes if I want to
> >>try to code myself?
> >>
> >>Thanks,
> >>William Chang
> >>

body:
The discussion is irrelevant for any externally provided users, but
I'd like this feature to support our guest accounts (which are local
sakai accounts).

-Dave

On 12/14/05, Cheryl Wogahn <cheryl.wogahn@yale.edu> wrote:
> The other 'gotcha' here is if you are using a CAS login like we are, the
> password isn't controlled by Sakai, nor is any user data stored in the
> local user database.  Our user information is stored in an external
> database.
>
> Cheryl
>
> Luke FERNANDEZ wrote:
>
> >An email password feature (even if it had to email a newly generated password) might actually facilitate first time logins for SIS-Sakai integrations that aren't pre-populating the password in Sakai accounts.  This seems to be my predicament.   I'm using Stephen Githen's excellent Web services to perform SIS-Sakai integration and I'm using it to populate all of the important SIS data except the student's SIS password which is available in the SIS only as a hash. I can't populate Sakai created accounts with an SIS password using SakaiScript.addnewuser because the password parameter in SakaiScript.addnewuser, as far as I can tell, is only designed to accept a non-hashed version of the SIS password.
> >
> >I can still get first time users logged into Sakai by having them authenticate through our portal and then running the SakaiPortalLogin Web service.  But with an email password feature students wouldn't have to go through the portal the first time they log in -- they could get a generated password through the e-mail feature.
> >
> >Alternatively, maybe Stephen's SakaiScript.addNewUser could store the SIS hashed password directly....rather than hashing it again (which is what I'm guessing Sakai does although maybe I'm totally off-base here).
> >
> >Cheers,
> >
> >Luke
> >
> >
> >
> >>>>"Glenn R. Golden" <ggolden@umich.edu> 12/13/05 7:18 PM >>>
> >>>>
> >>>>
> >One  point - Sakai does not know the user's password...
> >
> >- Glenn
> >
> >Glenn R. Golden
> >Sakai Framework Architect
> >University Of Michigan
> >ggolden@umich.edu
> >
> >
> >On Dec 13, 2005, at 6:23 PM, William Chang wrote:
> >
> >
> >
> >>Hi all,
> >>
> >>I am wondering if Sakai developers considering to implement "password
> >>forgotten" feature like it in many other sites, e.g. Yahoo groups.
> >>When
> >>the user click on the "Password forgotten" link, Sakai will send a
> >>copy
> >>of the user's password to this user's email account. This feature
> >>prove
> >>to be helpful tool for Sakai/sites administrators. It will be so much
> >>easier to administering a site.
> >>
> >>Anyone have any ideas where I may find some sample codes if I want to
> >>try to code myself?
> >>
> >>Thanks,
> >>William Chang
> >>
> >>----------------------
> >>This automatic notification message was sent by Sakai Collab
> >>(http://collab.sakaiproject.org/portal) from the Sakai Development
> >>site.
> >>You can modify how you receive notifications at My Workspace >
> >>Preferences.
> >>
> >>
> >>

> >You can modify how you receive notifications at My Workspace > Preferences.

Hi,

Have anyone successfully built a tool in Sakai 2.1 using MyFaces 1.1.1? 
I found that Sakai only supports MyFaces 1.0.9 which is a quite buggy 
version of some JSF components.

Would it be a bug if Sakai only works fine with MyFaces 1.1.1?  Should I 
file it in Jira?

Ken

body:
Hi,

This was a good start (good detective work!), but it did not clear up =20
all our problems with this issue.

I found that this line was incorrect in my sakai.properties file, but =20
upon correcting it, restarting Sakai, and re-uploading the file, I =20
still have troubles.

I uploaded a MS Word doc called "F=F8r=E9ign Ch=E0r=E0ct=EAr T=EBst.doc" in=
to =20
resources. It uploads fine and does not kill Sakai (as in the past). =20
However, upon downloading the file, the name has been changed to "ign =20
Cha9ra9cte_r TeAst.doc".

The attached screenshot shows how the file upload appears correctly =20
in the display, but the record in the XML field of my MySQL db =20
content_resource table confirms this mangling:

On Dec 13, 2005, at 10:47 PM, M Nakamura wrote:

> It looks like the url@javax.sql.BaseDataSource directive in sample
> sakai.properties has problem.
>
> The original line
> url@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=3Djdbc:mysql://127.0.0.1:3306/sakai?=20
> useUnicode=3Dtrue&characterEncoding=3DUTF-8
> should be
> url@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=3Djdbc:mysql://127.0.0.1:3306/sakai?=20
> useUnicode=3Dtrue&characterEncoding=3DUTF-8
>
> Note '&'.
>
> M Nakamura
>
> 2005/12/13, Beth Kirschner <bkirschn@umich.edu>:
>> The unicode string is corrupted within the mysql database. Here's the
>> nitty-gritty on what I've been able to discover so far:
>>
>> 1. When
>> org.sakaiproject.component.app.syllabus.SyllabusDataImpl.setTitle()
>> is called from the JSF code (i.e. immediately after input from the
>> form), the unicode is correct
>> 2. But this same setTitle() method is next invoked from hibernate,
>> and this time it is garbage:
>>
>> http-8080-Processor24[1] dump title
>> title =3D "??"
>> http-8080-Processor24[1] where
>> [1]
>> org.sakaiproject.component.app.syllabus.SyllabusDataImpl.setTitle
>> (SyllabusDataImpl.java:91)
>> [2] org.sakaiproject.component.app.syllabus.SyllabusDataImpl$
>> $BulkBeanByCGLIB$$a2df78fc.setPropertyValues (null)
>> [3]
>> net.sf.hibernate.persister.AbstractEntityPersister.setPropertyValues
>> (AbstractEntityPersister.java:215)
>> .
>> .
>> .
>>
>> - Beth
>>
>> On Dec 13, 2005, at 3:42 PM, fribeiro@ufp.pt wrote:
>>
>>>
>>> Beth,
>>>
>>> Could you check how the string looks like inside MySQL? I've found
>>> several
>>> places where character encoding is not preserved, but none at
>>> database level;
>>> Assuming that there's a utf setting everywhere (tomcat connectors,
>>> db, apache,
>>> file system).
>>>
>>> There are several places where strings, titles and resource names
>>> are encoded,
>>> and in some places the encoding may behave as if it was only ascii;
>>> just a
>>> guess, from what I've found in 1.0 and 2.0. The strings are already
>>> messed
>>> when they reach the database. In 1.0 there was one vm template
>>> doing an
>>> unecessary encoding when rendering.
>>>
>>> Why only with a database and not with in-memory? there could be
>>> some place where
>>> encoding of ', " and other nasty db characters takes place, and
>>> only ascii
>>> characters are respected. So, hibernate could have something to do
>>> with that,
>>> or more likely the db storage manager. Alternatively, something
>>> goes wrong
>>> when sakai fetches the information out of the db and does the
>>> necessary
>>> encodings.
>>>
>>> I hope that helps; that's the direction we are investigating right
>>> now.
>>> Feliz
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>> Quoting Beth Kirschner <bkirschn@umich.edu>:
>>>
>>>> I'm looking into problems reported with the UTF-8 characters in
>>>> Syllabus (and Samingo), which I've reproduced in both Sakai 2.0.1/
>>>> mysql and Sakai 2.1/mysql. The problem does not exist with =20
>>>> HySqlDb. I
>>>> have my suspicions that the problem has something to do with
>>>> hibernate, but I haven't had the time to completely debug the
>>>> problem. UTF-8 Characters entered into the Syllbus (e.g. title) are
>>>> rendered at question marks ("??") after the changes have been saved
>>>> in MySql. Has anyone else duplicated this problem and/or have any
>>>> insight into it's cause?
>>>>
>>>> I noticed that JIRA SAK-116  reports this problem is fixed with
>>>> Oracle by applying the self-described kludge of r3807, but this =20
>>>> patch
>>>> does not affect the problem with MySql.
>>>>
>>>> I've included in this message a thread regarding other UTF-8 =20
>>>> problems
>>>> in 2.0.1/mysql that appear to have been resolved in Sakai 2.1. In
>>>> case these problems have a common cause, does anyone know what was
>>>> done to resolve the problems mentioned below in Mike's email?
>>>>
>>>> Thanks,
>>>> - Beth
>>>>
>>>> On Oct 22, 2005, at 9:37 PM, Mike Osterman wrote:
>>>>
>>>>> Hi Mike,
>>>>>
>>>>> I still haven't chased down all of the Unicode gremlins in my
>>>>> installation. They definitely seem related to MySQL, as the same
>>>>> codebase works flawlessly when using the default HSQL dB.
>>>>>
>>>>> The steps I've taken to attempt to remedy the problem are:
>>>>> * Ensuring that Tomcat server.xml is configured for UTF-8 on all
>>>>> ports
>>>>> * Updated to the latest version of the 3.1.x MySQL connector
>>>>> * Updated to the latest version of the 4.x MySQL server for Linux
>>>>> (MySQL.com pre-built RPM for RHEL3)
>>>>> * Exported all my tables, recreated the database with the correct
>>>>> default charset, and then reimported the tables.
>>>>>
>>>>> UTF-8 works in many places, but the few I've found that don't and
>>>>> are reproducible time after time are:
>>>>> * Admin workspace Pages tool - when attempting to rename Pages =20
>>>>> with
>>>>> accented characters, edits appear to be taking until the site edit
>>>>> is saved (at which point I'm assuming the object in memory is =20
>>>>> saved
>>>>> to MySQL). The renamed pages show up truncated at the unicode
>>>>> character. For example, Informaci=F3n becomes Informaci.
>>>>> * Assignments tool - using unicode characters in attributes of an
>>>>> assignment results in truncated XML in the MySQL database at the
>>>>> location of the first instance of the unicode character. No error
>>>>> is displayed to the end-user, and the only error in =20
>>>>> catalina.out is
>>>>> the resulting SAX XML parser error when redirected from Save to =20
>>>>> the
>>>>> listing of assignments. The assignments are not listed in the
>>>>> general listing. The SAX error is generated for each record with
>>>>> truncated XML during the iteration of the assignment list.
>>>>> * Resources tool - creating a URL resource with accented =20
>>>>> characters
>>>>> results in an error on post. For example, creating a URL item with
>>>>> the title "primer=EA" will result in the message "Alert: The URL
>>>>> title primer=EA has been used." This can be worked around by adding
>>>>> the object with no accented characters, then editing the object =20
>>>>> and
>>>>> setting the proper accented title and updating. We experience no
>>>>> problems with accented characters in titles for file uploads.
>>>>>
>>>>> I've been meaning to hook up a debugger and get to the bottom of
>>>>> this for some time now. Hopefully I can get to it this week.
>>>>>
>>>>> Michael Osterman
>>>>> Developer, Emerging Technology
>>>>> Whitman College
>>>>> ostermmg@whitman.edu
>>>>> 509-527-5419
>>>>>
>>>>>
>>>>> On Oct 20, 2005, at 3:03 PM, Mike De Simone wrote:
>>>>>
>>>>>> I haven't seen any updates in a while to this in any of the
>>>>>> referenced issues: 1688, 2015, 1357.  Does anyone know the state
>>>>>> of this issue currently?
>>>>>>
>>>>>> I am unable to create folders in the resources area with, for
>>>>>> instance, names with Hawaiian characters in their names. Or, more
>>>>>> correctly, I *can* create the folder, but when I try to access =20
>>>>>> it,
>>>>>> I get the 'Alert: The collection does not exist" error.  If I =20
>>>>>> look
>>>>>> in the database, the characters in question appear to have been
>>>>>> converted to question marks.
>>>>>>
>>>>>> I am using mysql connector 3.1.10, and have the tomcat URI
>>>>>> encoding set up (going through Apache, which has the
>>>>>> AddDefaultCharset UTF-8 directive set).
>>>>>>
>>>>>>
>>>>>> -----------------
>>>>>> Mike De Simone
>>>>>> Director of Client Support
>>>>>> The rSmart Group
>>>>>> 602-840-7300 x106
>>>>>> icq: 161896611
>>>>>>
>>>>>>
>>>>>> -----Original Message-----
>>>>>> From: Mike Osterman [mailto:ostermmg@whitman.edu]
>>>>>> Sent: Saturday, September 17, 2005 9:47 AM
>>>>>> To: sakai-dev
>>>>>> Cc: sakai-dev
>>>>>> Subject: Re: UTF-8 problem on Sakai 2.0.1 with MySQL
>>>>>>
>>>>>> James,
>>>>>>
>>>>>> I can verify this identical behavior with the correct 3.1.x
>>>>>> connector. Assignment XML is truncated in the database and the
>>>>>> assignment is not listed. I get log errors as the assigment list
>>>>>> iterates through the record set and hits each "bad" record.
>>>>>>
>>>>>> We also have intermittent problems with the Resources tool as =20
>>>>>> well
>>>>>> when using Unicode characters in the title, though I haven't seem
>>>>>> system-wide instability with the tool as a result.
>>>>>>
>>>>>> I have anecdotal evidence from pilot testers that creating the
>>>>>> resource with non-Unicode characters first, then editing and =20
>>>>>> adding
>>>>>> the Unicode characters at that point, it works. I have yet to
>>>>>> verify
>>>>>> this behavior myself.
>>>>>>
>>>>>> Michael Osterman
>>>>>> Developer, Emerging Technology
>>>>>> Whitman College
>>>>>> ostermmg@whitman.edu
>>>>>> 509-527-5419
>>>>>>
>>>>>>
>>>>>> On Sep 13, 2005, at 11:27 AM, James Williamson wrote:
>>>>>>
>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Hi folks,
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> We looked into this problem a bit and filed an issue report in
>>>>>>> Jira
>>>>>>> (SAK-2015). Below are our notes on this issue.
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Discovered in Assignments and Resources
>>>>>>> Manifestation - Assignments:
>>>>>>> - If a user creates an assignment with a Unicode character in =20
>>>>>>> the
>>>>>>> Title field, the assignment does not show up in the list of
>>>>>>> assignments
>>>>>>> - The catalina.out log reveals a XML parsing error.
>>>>>>> - The MySQL database field contains an incomplete XML file that
>>>>>>> ends at the point where the Unicode character was found.
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Manifestation - Resources:
>>>>>>> - If a file upload contains a foreign character in the file =20
>>>>>>> name,
>>>>>>> the Resources tool may become unstable throughout the system
>>>>>>> and be
>>>>>>> unavailable to all sites.
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Comments
>>>>>>> - When the form used by the "New Assignment" page is =20
>>>>>>> processed, it
>>>>>>> generates an entire XML file and stores it in the database.
>>>>>>> - Examples are from the from assignment_content table. Other
>>>>>>> tables
>>>>>>> tables may be affected as well.
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Example good record:
>>>>>>> <?xml version=3D"1.0" encoding=3D"UTF-8"?>
>>>>>>> <content allowattach=3D"true"
>>>>>>> context=3D"b32cfe66-9ecc-4cba-0043-1e0df90222c1"
>>>>>>> datecreated=3D"20050826171605824" groupproject=3D"true"
>>>>>>> honorpledge=3D"1"
>>>>>>> id=3D"54293ba9-f85d-4d17-80ca-bbdd837754aa" indivgraded=3D"false"
>>>>>>> instructions=3D"SMOpcsOpIGlzIGEgbsOpdyBzdHJpbmcu
>>>>>>> "
>>>>>>> instructions-html=3D"SMOpcsOpIGlzIGEgbsOpdyBzdHJpbmcu
>>>>>>> "
>>>>>>> lastmod=3D"20050826171605824" numberofattachments=3D"0"
>>>>>>> numberofauthors=3D"0" releasegrades=3D"false" =20
>>>>>>> scaled_maxgradepoint=3D"0"
>>>>>>> submissiontype=3D"3" title=3D"Foreign Title" typeofgrade=3D"1">
>>>>>>> <properties>
>>>>>>> <property enc=3D"BASE64" name=3D"CHEF:creator" value=3D"YWRtaW4=3D
>>>>>>> "/>
>>>>>>> <property enc=3D"BASE64" name=3D"CHEF:modifiedby" value=3D"YWRtaW4=
=3D
>>>>>>> "/>
>>>>>>> <property enc=3D"BASE64" name=3D"DAV:getlastmodified"
>>>>>>> value=3D"MjAwNTA4MjYxNzE2MDgxMzU=3D
>>>>>>> "/>
>>>>>>> <property enc=3D"BASE64" name=3D"DAV:creationdate"
>>>>>>> value=3D"MjAwNTA4MjYxNzE2MDU4MjQ=3D
>>>>>>> "/>
>>>>>>> </properties>
>>>>>>> </content>
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Example bad record:
>>>>>>> <?xml version=3D"1.0" encoding=3D"UTF-8"?>
>>>>>>> <content allowattach=3D"true"
>>>>>>> context=3D"b32cfe66-9ecc-4cba-0043-1e0df90222c1"
>>>>>>> datecreated=3D"20050826171447016" groupproject=3D"true"
>>>>>>> honorpledge=3D"1"
>>>>>>> id=3D"ac84f7f7-e5a2-47aa-0090-eb72fe7b073b" indivgraded=3D"false"
>>>>>>> instructions=3D"VGhpcyBpcyBhIGZvcmVpZ24tbMO4w7hraW5nIHDDqmPDvGNlIG=
=20
>>>>>>> 9m
>>>>>>> IH
>>>>>>> TD
>>>>>>> qXh0Lg=3D=3D
>>>>>>> "
>>>>>>> instructions-
>>>>>>> html=3D"VGhpcyBpcyBhIGZvcmVpZ24tbMO4w7hraW5nIHDDqmPDvGNlIG9mIHTDqX=
=20
>>>>>>> h0
>>>>>>> Lg
>>>>>>> =3D=3D
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>
>>>>>> "
>>>>>>
>>>>>>> lastmod=3D"20050826171447016" numberofattachments=3D"0"
>>>>>>> numberofauthors=3D"0" releasegrades=3D"false" =20
>>>>>>> scaled_maxgradepoint=3D"0"
>>>>>>> submissiontype=3D"3" title=3D"Foreign Titl
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> - Note that in the "bad record" that the data is truncated at =20
>>>>>>> the
>>>>>>> point where the original field data was "Foreign Titl=E9"
>>>>>>> - The "instructions" and "instructions-html" data values are =20
>>>>>>> being
>>>>>>> BASE64 encoded and thus are not vulnerable to this error.
>>>>>>> - The "title" data is stored as-entered by the user.
>>>>>>> - The data from the entire "New Assignment" form is being
>>>>>>> serialized into XML string and then stored in the database.
>>>>>>> - Upon retrieval of the data for display (as when refreshing the
>>>>>>> screen immediately after submission), the catalina.out log file
>>>>>>> shows the error and the new Assignment does not display in the
>>>>>>> list
>>>>>>> of Assignments. There is no warning to the user.
>>>>>>> - The error is: "WARN: readDocumentFromString:
>>>>>>> org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: XML document structures must =20
>>>>>>> start
>>>>>>> and end within the same entity." and "[Fatal Error] :8:67: XML
>>>>>>> document structures must start and end within the same entity."
>>>>>>> - The character set for the MySQL table is UTF-8 and we are =20
>>>>>>> using
>>>>>>> MySQL connector 3.1.
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Some additional comments:
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> - Some of the data in the XML file is automatically pulled from
>>>>>>> Sakai. Some of this auto-generated data stored in the "property"
>>>>>>> element is repeated in the parent "content" element, albeit =20
>>>>>>> in an
>>>>>>> encoded fashion. Compare, for example,
>>>>>>> datecreated=3D"20050826171605824" with <property enc=3D"BASE64"
>>>>>>> name=3D"DAV:creationdate" value=3D"MjAwNTA4MjYxNzE2MDU4MjQ=3D
>>>>>>> "/> .
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> - Some user-entered data within the "content" element is encoded
>>>>>>> but other user-entered data also within the "content" element is
>>>>>>> not encoded. Compare, for example,
>>>>>>> instructions=3D"SMOpcsOpIGlzIGEgbsOpdyBzdHJpbmcu
>>>>>>> " with title=3D"Foreign Title"
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Best regards, and we hope this helps,
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Jim
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> On Sep 6, 2005, at 3:19 AM, Torben Bruun wrote:
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> Hi,
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> We're running Sakai 2.0.1 on Debian Linux with MySQL. We're
>>>>>>>> having
>>>>>>>> problems with Danish letters - for instance if trying to add a
>>>>>>>> resource containing danish letters in the URl or in the name of
>>>>>>>> resource.
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> MySQL database is created using
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> create database sakai default character set utf8;
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> show variables in mysql gives
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> |
>>>>>>>> | character_set_client            | utf8 |
>>>>>>>> | character_set_connection        | utf8 |
>>>>>>>> | character_set_database          | utf8 |
>>>>>>>> | character_set_results           | utf8 |
>>>>>>>> | character_set_server            | utf8 |
>>>>>>>> | character_set_system            | utf8 |
>>>>>>>> | character_sets_dir              | /usr/share/mysql/=20
>>>>>>>> charsets/ |
>>>>>>>> | collation_connection            | utf8_general_ci |
>>>>>>>> | collation_database              | utf8_general_ci |
>>>>>>>> | collation_server                | utf8_general_ci
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> We've applied fix for SAK-1688 conserning using setBytes =20
>>>>>>>> instead
>>>>>>>> of setCharacters.
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> In Tomcat server.xml we've added
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> <Connector port=3D"443" maxHttpHeaderSize=3D"8192"
>>>>>>>> URIEncoding=3D"UTF-8" ......
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> We're running Apache in front of Tomcat. Apache is set to =20
>>>>>>>> default
>>>>>>>> character set utf-8.
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> Does anyone have an idea about , why we still get problems with
>>>>>>>> danish characters ?
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> kind regards
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> Torben Bruun

body:
When one adds a guest user as site participant in Worksite Setup, if  
the guest user is unknown, it gets added into Sakai with a random  
password.

There is a setting in sakai.properties, notifyNewUserEmail, to  
control sending notification email. If the setting is true or  
missing, an email with the random password will be sent to the guest  
user. He can then use this password to login for the first time.

Maybe we should add this feature into Admin's Users tool, so that  
notification email will be sent when an guest account is added there.

- Zhen


On Dec 14, 2005, at 9:39 AM, Dave Ross wrote:

> The discussion is irrelevant for any externally provided users, but
> I'd like this feature to support our guest accounts (which are local
> sakai accounts).
>
> -Dave
>
> On 12/14/05, Cheryl Wogahn <cheryl.wogahn@yale.edu> wrote:
>> The other 'gotcha' here is if you are using a CAS login like we  
>> are, the
>> password isn't controlled by Sakai, nor is any user data stored in  
>> the
>> local user database.  Our user information is stored in an external
>> database.
>>
>> Cheryl
>>
>> Luke FERNANDEZ wrote:
>>
>>> An email password feature (even if it had to email a newly  
>>> generated password) might actually facilitate first time logins  
>>> for SIS-Sakai integrations that aren't pre-populating the  
>>> password in Sakai accounts.  This seems to be my predicament.    
>>> I'm using Stephen Githen's excellent Web services to perform SIS- 
>>> Sakai integration and I'm using it to populate all of the  
>>> important SIS data except the student's SIS password which is  
>>> available in the SIS only as a hash. I can't populate Sakai  
>>> created accounts with an SIS password using  
>>> SakaiScript.addnewuser because the password parameter in  
>>> SakaiScript.addnewuser, as far as I can tell, is only designed to  
>>> accept a non-hashed version of the SIS password.
>>>
>>> I can still get first time users logged into Sakai by having them  
>>> authenticate through our portal and then running the  
>>> SakaiPortalLogin Web service.  But with an email password feature  
>>> students wouldn't have to go through the portal the first time  
>>> they log in -- they could get a generated password through the e- 
>>> mail feature.
>>>
>>> Alternatively, maybe Stephen's SakaiScript.addNewUser could store  
>>> the SIS hashed password directly....rather than hashing it again  
>>> (which is what I'm guessing Sakai does although maybe I'm totally  
>>> off-base here).
>>>
>>> Cheers,
>>>
>>> Luke
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>>>>> "Glenn R. Golden" <ggolden@umich.edu> 12/13/05 7:18 PM >>>
>>>>>>
>>>>>>
>>> One  point - Sakai does not know the user's password...
>>>
>>> - Glenn
>>>
>>> Glenn R. Golden
>>> Sakai Framework Architect
>>> University Of Michigan
>>> ggolden@umich.edu
>>>
>>>
>>> On Dec 13, 2005, at 6:23 PM, William Chang wrote:
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>>> Hi all,
>>>>
>>>> I am wondering if Sakai developers considering to implement  
>>>> "password
>>>> forgotten" feature like it in many other sites, e.g. Yahoo groups.
>>>> When
>>>> the user click on the "Password forgotten" link, Sakai will send a
>>>> copy
>>>> of the user's password to this user's email account. This feature
>>>> prove
>>>> to be helpful tool for Sakai/sites administrators. It will be so  
>>>> much
>>>> easier to administering a site.
>>>>
>>>> Anyone have any ideas where I may find some sample codes if I  
>>>> want to
>>>> try to code myself?
>>>>
>>>> Thanks,
>>>> William Chang

body:
I think it would also be useful to have an auto-generated password 
emailed to new guest accounts when someone uses the 'Add Participant' 
and adds a guest account.  Right now, there is no password set and an 
admin has to set one and then send it to the new user.  Seems that 
feature is still 'half' developed?

Cheryl

Dave Ross wrote:

>The discussion is irrelevant for any externally provided users, but
>I'd like this feature to support our guest accounts (which are local
>sakai accounts).
>
>-Dave
>
>On 12/14/05, Cheryl Wogahn <cheryl.wogahn@yale.edu> wrote:
>  
>
>>The other 'gotcha' here is if you are using a CAS login like we are, the
>>password isn't controlled by Sakai, nor is any user data stored in the
>>local user database.  Our user information is stored in an external
>>database.
>>
>>Cheryl
>>
>>Luke FERNANDEZ wrote:
>>
>>    
>>
>>>An email password feature (even if it had to email a newly generated password) might actually facilitate first time logins for SIS-Sakai integrations that aren't pre-populating the password in Sakai accounts.  This seems to be my predicament.   I'm using Stephen Githen's excellent Web services to perform SIS-Sakai integration and I'm using it to populate all of the important SIS data except the student's SIS password which is available in the SIS only as a hash. I can't populate Sakai created accounts with an SIS password using SakaiScript.addnewuser because the password parameter in SakaiScript.addnewuser, as far as I can tell, is only designed to accept a non-hashed version of the SIS password.
>>>
>>>I can still get first time users logged into Sakai by having them authenticate through our portal and then running the SakaiPortalLogin Web service.  But with an email password feature students wouldn't have to go through the portal the first time they log in -- they could get a generated password through the e-mail feature.
>>>
>>>Alternatively, maybe Stephen's SakaiScript.addNewUser could store the SIS hashed password directly....rather than hashing it again (which is what I'm guessing Sakai does although maybe I'm totally off-base here).
>>>
>>>Cheers,
>>>
>>>Luke
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>>      
>>>
>>>>>>"Glenn R. Golden" <ggolden@umich.edu> 12/13/05 7:18 PM >>>
>>>>>>
>>>>>>
>>>>>>            
>>>>>>
>>>One  point - Sakai does not know the user's password...
>>>
>>>- Glenn
>>>
>>>Glenn R. Golden
>>>Sakai Framework Architect
>>>University Of Michigan
>>>ggolden@umich.edu
>>>
>>>
>>>On Dec 13, 2005, at 6:23 PM, William Chang wrote:
>>>

>>>>forgotten" feature like it in many other sites, e.g. Yahoo groups.

>>>>copy
>>>>of the user's password to this user's email account. This feature
>>>>prove
>>>>to be helpful tool for Sakai/sites administrators. It will be so much
>>>>easier to administering a site.
>>>>
>>>>Anyone have any ideas where I may find some sample codes if I want to

body:
Thanks Zhen, this is exactly what I was looking for.  :)

Cheryl

Zhen Qian wrote:

> When one adds a guest user as site participant in Worksite Setup, if  
> the guest user is unknown, it gets added into Sakai with a random  
> password.
>
> There is a setting in sakai.properties, notifyNewUserEmail, to  
> control sending notification email. If the setting is true or  
> missing, an email with the random password will be sent to the guest  
> user. He can then use this password to login for the first time.
>
> Maybe we should add this feature into Admin's Users tool, so that  
> notification email will be sent when an guest account is added there.
>
> - Zhen
>
>
> On Dec 14, 2005, at 9:39 AM, Dave Ross wrote:
>
>> The discussion is irrelevant for any externally provided users, but
>> I'd like this feature to support our guest accounts (which are local
>> sakai accounts).
>>
>> -Dave
>>
>> On 12/14/05, Cheryl Wogahn <cheryl.wogahn@yale.edu> wrote:
>>
>>> The other 'gotcha' here is if you are using a CAS login like we  
>>> are, the
>>> password isn't controlled by Sakai, nor is any user data stored in  the
>>> local user database.  Our user information is stored in an external
>>> database.
>>>
>>> Cheryl
>>>
>>> Luke FERNANDEZ wrote:
>>>
>>>> An email password feature (even if it had to email a newly  
>>>> generated password) might actually facilitate first time logins  
>>>> for SIS-Sakai integrations that aren't pre-populating the  password 
>>>> in Sakai accounts.  This seems to be my predicament.    I'm using 
>>>> Stephen Githen's excellent Web services to perform SIS- Sakai 
>>>> integration and I'm using it to populate all of the  important SIS 
>>>> data except the student's SIS password which is  available in the 
>>>> SIS only as a hash. I can't populate Sakai  created accounts with 
>>>> an SIS password using  SakaiScript.addnewuser because the password 
>>>> parameter in  SakaiScript.addnewuser, as far as I can tell, is only 
>>>> designed to  accept a non-hashed version of the SIS password.
>>>>
>>>> I can still get first time users logged into Sakai by having them  
>>>> authenticate through our portal and then running the  
>>>> SakaiPortalLogin Web service.  But with an email password feature  
>>>> students wouldn't have to go through the portal the first time  
>>>> they log in -- they could get a generated password through the e- 
>>>> mail feature.
>>>>
>>>> Alternatively, maybe Stephen's SakaiScript.addNewUser could store  
>>>> the SIS hashed password directly....rather than hashing it again  
>>>> (which is what I'm guessing Sakai does although maybe I'm totally  
>>>> off-base here).
>>>>
>>>> Cheers,
>>>>
>>>> Luke
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>>>> "Glenn R. Golden" <ggolden@umich.edu> 12/13/05 7:18 PM >>>
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>
>>>> One  point - Sakai does not know the user's password...
>>>>
>>>> - Glenn
>>>>
>>>> Glenn R. Golden
>>>> Sakai Framework Architect
>>>> University Of Michigan
>>>> ggolden@umich.edu
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> On Dec 13, 2005, at 6:23 PM, William Chang wrote:
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>> Hi all,
>>>>>
>>>>> I am wondering if Sakai developers considering to implement  
>>>>> "password
>>>>> forgotten" feature like it in many other sites, e.g. Yahoo groups.
>>>>> When
>>>>> the user click on the "Password forgotten" link, Sakai will send a
>>>>> copy
>>>>> of the user's password to this user's email account. This feature
>>>>> prove
>>>>> to be helpful tool for Sakai/sites administrators. It will be so  
>>>>> much
>>>>> easier to administering a site.
>>>>>
>>>>> Anyone have any ideas where I may find some sample codes if I  
>>>>> want to
>>>>> try to code myself?
>>>>>
>>>>> Thanks,
>>>>> William Chang
>>>>>
>>>>> ----------------------
>>>>> This automatic notification message was sent by Sakai Collab
>>>>> (http://collab.sakaiproject.org/portal) from the Sakai Development
>>>>> site.
>>>>> You can modify how you receive notifications at My Workspace >
>>>>> Preferences.
>>>>>
>>>>>
>>>>>
>>>>

>>>> (http://collab.sakaiproject.org/portal) from the Sakai  Development 
>>>> site.
>>>> You can modify how you receive notifications at My Workspace >

body:
Yes, and the worksite setup feature works great for us... our only
problem is when a guest user forgets their password: it requires
administrator involvement to reset the password and it would be nice
if this could be a self-service feature of the gateway.

I'm willing to take a stab at writing a tool to do this but I think
Rutgers or someone else may have already done so.

-Dave

On 12/14/05, Zhen Qian <zqian@umich.edu> wrote:
> When one adds a guest user as site participant in Worksite Setup, if

>

> notification email will be sent when an guest account is added there.
>

>

> >>> important SIS data except the student's SIS password which is

> >>> SakaiScript.addnewuser because the password parameter in

> >>> accept a non-hashed version of the SIS password.
> >>>
> >>> I can still get first time users logged into Sakai by having them

> >>> SakaiPortalLogin Web service.  But with an email password feature

> >>>

body:
I am using Firefox 1.5, and I have also tried it in IE 6. I managed to get
the Sakai Properties doc by opening it directly in Acrobat, but nothing has
worked for the Config doc. Sometimes in Firefox and always in IE, I get a
"Copyright Restriction Download Warning", but clicking on "I Agree" does
nothing. Since that is apparently designed as a popup, I also disabled popup
blocking, to no avail.

I had no problems with the non-pdf links on the page.

Cary Gordon
University of North Texas
The Cherry Hill Company

From: John Leasia [mailto:jleasia@umich.edu] 
Sent: Tuesday, December 13, 2005 5:16 PM
To: Cary Gordon
Cc: 'sakai-dev'

I'll send it to you in a separate email. Are you able to get at any docs in
the Sakai Development Resources, or is it just this one causing problems?
What browser are you using? I was able to get at the doc via the URL below,
so would like to track down what the problem might be.
John

	charset="US-ASCII"
Archived-At: <http://permalink.gmane.org/gmane.comp.cms.sakai.devel/93>
body:
It appears that with Windows installations you should manage the JVM
settings via the Tomcat UI in the systray as opposed to the JAVA_OPTS
environment setting.

In two separate installs the JAVA_OPTS settings appeared to have no
effect on the memory errors no matter how much I adjusted the settings
up or down. Once I added the values to the Java tab on the Tomcat GUI,
restarted Tomcat problems disappeared.

-Dan 

-----Original Message-----
From: khomotso@gmail.com [mailto:khomotso@gmail.com] On Behalf Of Clay
Fenlason
Sent: Monday, December 12, 2005 3:31 PM
To: sakai-dev
Subject: Re: Memory error with 2.1

Windows installations can be complicated by whether they're installed as
a service or not, and I think it was Luke Fernandez who noted that he
had trouble getting suggested JAVA_OPTS settings to work if he set them
as an environment variable rather than through the Tomcat properties
GUI.  As Dave notes, this does sound like a permanent generation
problem.

Our Windows install documentation is however admittedly weak, and could
use more input from those people actually working with it out there.  If
some clear resolution of this can be achieved, a comment somewhere in:
http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/confluence/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=885
1

... would be much appreciated.

~Clay

2005/12/10, Cotton, Dan <dgcotton@ucdavis.edu>:
>
> I keep getting this memory error after a clean boot and clean install 
> of
> 2.1 on Windows 2003 server. I have tried various settings as suggested

> with the JVM values. I get these errors after about 5-10 clicks on 
> links after a clean start. Page will tend to be blank in body, I then 
> look at STD log and see this error.  The server I am running on has
2GB memory.
> Any ideas?
>

body:
I won't be able to answer this question. It all depends on the  
SakaiScript implementation of addNewUser.

Steve?

- Zhen
On Dec 14, 2005, at 10:49 AM, Luke FERNANDEZ wrote:

> I guess it pays to read the sakai_properties.doc assiduously. I didn't
> know that this feature existed although I see now that it's  
> documented.
>
> Quick question:
>
> If I set:
>
> notifyNewUserEmail=true
>
> and then use SakaiScript.addnewUser to add new accounts -- will Sakai
> send an email to the email address specified in the new account?
>
> Cheers,
>
> Luke
>
>
>
>
>>>> Cheryl Wogahn <cheryl.wogahn@yale.edu> 12/14/05 8:05 AM >>>
> Thanks Zhen, this is exactly what I was looking for.  :)
>
> Cheryl
>
> Zhen Qian wrote:
>
>> When one adds a guest user as site participant in Worksite Setup, if
>> the guest user is unknown, it gets added into Sakai with a random
>> password.
>>
>> There is a setting in sakai.properties, notifyNewUserEmail, to
>> control sending notification email. If the setting is true or
>> missing, an email with the random password will be sent to the guest
>> user. He can then use this password to login for the first time.
>>
>> Maybe we should add this feature into Admin's Users tool, so that
>> notification email will be sent when an guest account is added there.
>>
>> - Zhen
>>
>>
>> On Dec 14, 2005, at 9:39 AM, Dave Ross wrote:
>>
>>> The discussion is irrelevant for any externally provided users, but
>>> I'd like this feature to support our guest accounts (which are local
>>> sakai accounts).
>>>
>>> -Dave
>>>
>>> On 12/14/05, Cheryl Wogahn <cheryl.wogahn@yale.edu> wrote:
>>>
>>>> The other 'gotcha' here is if you are using a CAS login like we
>>>> are, the
>>>> password isn't controlled by Sakai, nor is any user data stored in
> the
>>>> local user database.  Our user information is stored in an external
>>>> database.
>>>>
>>>> Cheryl
>>>>
>>>> Luke FERNANDEZ wrote:
>>>>
>>>>> An email password feature (even if it had to email a newly
>>>>> generated password) might actually facilitate first time logins
>>>>> for SIS-Sakai integrations that aren't pre-populating the   
>>>>> password
>
>>>>> in Sakai accounts.  This seems to be my predicament.    I'm using
>>>>> Stephen Githen's excellent Web services to perform SIS- Sakai
>>>>> integration and I'm using it to populate all of the  important SIS
>>>>> data except the student's SIS password which is  available in the
>>>>> SIS only as a hash. I can't populate Sakai  created accounts with
>>>>> an SIS password using  SakaiScript.addnewuser because the password
>>>>> parameter in  SakaiScript.addnewuser, as far as I can tell, is  
>>>>> only
>
>>>>> designed to  accept a non-hashed version of the SIS password.
>>>>>
>>>>> I can still get first time users logged into Sakai by having them
>>>>> authenticate through our portal and then running the
>>>>> SakaiPortalLogin Web service.  But with an email password feature
>>>>> students wouldn't have to go through the portal the first time
>>>>> they log in -- they could get a generated password through the e-
>>>>> mail feature.
>>>>>
>>>>> Alternatively, maybe Stephen's SakaiScript.addNewUser could store
>>>>> the SIS hashed password directly....rather than hashing it again
>>>>> (which is what I'm guessing Sakai does although maybe I'm totally
>>>>> off-base here).
>>>>>
>>>>> Cheers,
>>>>>
>>>>> Luke
>>>>>
>>>>>
>>>>>
>>>>>>>> "Glenn R. Golden" <ggolden@umich.edu> 12/13/05 7:18 PM >>>
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>
>>>>> One  point - Sakai does not know the user's password...
>>>>>
>>>>> - Glenn
>>>>>
>>>>> Glenn R. Golden
>>>>> Sakai Framework Architect
>>>>> University Of Michigan
>>>>> ggolden@umich.edu
>>>>>
>>>>>
>>>>> On Dec 13, 2005, at 6:23 PM, William Chang wrote:
>>>>>
>>>>>
>>>>>
>>>>>> Hi all,
>>>>>>
>>>>>> I am wondering if Sakai developers considering to implement
>>>>>> "password
>>>>>> forgotten" feature like it in many other sites, e.g. Yahoo  
>>>>>> groups.
>>>>>> When
>>>>>> the user click on the "Password forgotten" link, Sakai will  
>>>>>> send a
>>>>>> copy
>>>>>> of the user's password to this user's email account. This feature
>>>>>> prove
>>>>>> to be helpful tool for Sakai/sites administrators. It will be so
>>>>>> much
>>>>>> easier to administering a site.
>>>>>>
>>>>>> Anyone have any ideas where I may find some sample codes if I
>>>>>> want to
>>>>>> try to code myself?
>>>>>>
>>>>>> Thanks,
>>>>>> William Chang
>>>>>>

body:
Charles Severance wrote:

> I thought that someone did this already...  Rutgers?  Yale?  Merced?

Yes. Rutgers did this for 2.0 because "Our help desk has no way to 
identify guests. Since guests are identified by email address, the 
only practical approach is to use an email exchange. Create a "change 
my password" button. It mails a magic token that logins in the guest 
and lets him change his password."

It works pretty well.

More details are at:

http://rulink.rutgers.edu/sakai

Someone from Rutgers will have to give you the details on the current 
status of the code. In the meantime, I think we should consider this 
for inclusion in the main code base, with a configurable on/off 
setting in sakai.properties.

Seth

body:
There is certainly more than one way to implement this, but the method I
have seen more widely implemented involves sending a generated URL
containing a token in an email to the user (using their registered email
address). The user clicks the link and comes back to a "change password"
page in the system with "new password" and "confirm new password".

This is (IMHO) a far more secure means of dealing with forgotten passwords,
as no passwords are visible and the "reset password" URL is single-use only.

Of course, with more widespread adoption of single sign on, the emphasis
changes somewhat...

Raad

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Raad Al-Rawi

CARET, University of Cambridge
1st Floor, 16 Mill Lane, Cambridge CB2 1SB

Tel: +44 (0)1223 765395    Fax: +44 (0)1223 765505
Web: http://www.caret.cam.ac.uk


> -----Original Message-----
> From: William Chang [mailto:wchang@dri.edu]
> Sent: 13 December 2005 23:23
> To: sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org
> Subject: Password forgotten feature
> 
> 
> Hi all,
> 
> I am wondering if Sakai developers considering to implement "password
> forgotten" feature like it in many other sites, e.g. Yahoo groups. When
> the user click on the "Password forgotten" link, Sakai will send a copy
> of the user's password to this user's email account. This feature prove
> to be helpful tool for Sakai/sites administrators. It will be so much
> easier to administering a site.
> 
> Anyone have any ideas where I may find some sample codes if I want to
> try to code myself?
> 
> Thanks,
> William Chang

body:
I'm only running Sakai 2.1 at the moment. I mentioned that I had had 2.0.1
on the same server because I suspect something in 2.1 rather than the
server. Sorry for the confusion. I can also webdav with
http://sakai-stable.mit.edu:8030/portal, so I don't think the problem is
with my PC. I don't think it is a problem with usernames either, as I have
the same user on my PC as on Sakai 2.1.

My installation of 2.1 is now using MySQL. I had been using Oracle but had a
few other problems which using MySQL has cured, no more locks, but not
webdav.

I'd be grateful if anyone can suggest anything else to try. Has anyone else
had rpoblems with 2.1 and webdav?



-----Original Message-----
From: Feliz Gouveia [mailto:fribeiro@ufp.pt] 
Sent: 07 December 2005 15:41
To: Jon Higham
Subject: Re: Sakai 2.1 webdav



Jon,

You mentioned having two sakai installations in the same server? running at
the same time?

Do you see something unsual in the $TOMCAT_HOME/logs/catalina.out logs?

The locking behavior seems unsual, although it should not interfere with
webdav.

I'm sorry but I can't remember anything else to try...
Feliz


Jon Higham wrote:
> Sorry, how do I check that the dav path is mapped via the 
> apache/tomcat? There is a webdav folder in $TOMCAT_HOME/webapps.
> 
> The sites are published, but there is some unusual locking. If I try 
> to delete a file or folder in Site Resources, Sakai first refuses 
> then, if I try again, tells me it is locked and an entry appears the 
> SAKAI_LOCKS oracle db table.
> 
> Thanks.
> 
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Feliz Gouveia [mailto:fribeiro@ufp.pt]
> Sent: 07 December 2005 13:32
> To: Jon Higham
> Cc: 'sakai-dev'
> Subject: Re: Sakai 2.1 webdav
> 
> 
> 
> so it should be the server. I would check:
> 
> - that the dav path is mapped via apache/tomcat;
> - that the sakai site you're accessing is 'published;
> - that no other session is locking your folder.
> 
> If there was a tomcat restart, some locks may remain; I would check 
> the locks table, the location, and the session table.
> 
> Other possibility is that someone left an 'edit' resource space 
> without 'cancel' or 'ok'.
> 
> hope it helps.
> Feliz
> 
> Jon Higham wrote:
> 
>>Thanks. I've tried with, and without the port number, but it makes no
>>difference.
>>
>>I could, however, connect to http://sakai-stable.mit.edu:8030/portal,
>>so that rules something out.
>>
>>Is it likely to be Sakai or the Oracle Db at fault. I'm also having
>>problems deleting anything on the Site Resources tool (everything 
>>claims to be locked by another user even though there aren't any, 
>>although I can change the name of files and folders) and am wondering 
>>if this could be related.
>>
>>
>>
>>-----Original Message-----
>>From: fribeiro@ufp.pt [mailto:fribeiro@ufp.pt]
>>Sent: 06 December 2005 22:20
>>To: Jon Higham
>>Cc: 'sakai-dev'
>>Subject: RE: Sakai 2.1 webdav
>>
>>
>>
>>check 'internet options' in IE; I use 'detect proxy automatically' but
>>if that hasn't changed it is probably not the problem. MS Webfolders, 
>>or webdav, uses the IE settings, except one: it always sends url 
>>encoded with the client locale, regardless of the IE settings.
>>
>>Did you try adding the port number?
>>
>>Try to webdav one of the Sakai installations, for example
>>http://sakai-stable.mit.edu:8030/portal
>>to rule out problems with your client. If it works, it is probably a 
>>server side issue.
>>
>>Hope something helps. Feliz
>>
>>
>>
>>
>>Quoting Jon Higham <j.higham@hull.ac.uk>:
>>
>>
>>
>>>Thanks for that, but no luck. I have tried running wbfldrs.msi and I 
>>>have the same PC and Sakai username.
>>>
>>>I'm not sure what you suggest with the proxy. At Hull a proxy is 
>>>required for external internet access, but that hasn't changed during 
>>>the changeover from sakai 2.0.1 to 2.1. What should I be looking for?
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>>-----Original Message-----
>>>From: Feliz Gouveia [mailto:fribeiro@ufp.pt]
>>>Sent: 06 December 2005 14:42
>>>To: Jon Higham; sakai-dev
>>>Subject: Re: Sakai 2.1 webdav
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>>Jon,
>>>
>>>I had the same problem; this is what I found, I'm not sure it applies 
>>>to your case, but...:
>>>
>>>- running wbfldrs.msi reinstalls drivers that were changed by, eg, MS 
>>>Office; it seems xp has two different ways of working with webdav;
>>>
>>>- if your local account has not the same username as the sakai 
>>>account you may run into problems; one solution is to add the port 
>>>number to the dav url, eg, localhost:8080/dav/group/...do you use the 
>>>same account in your two sakai versions?
>>>
>>>- check the proxy definitions in Internet Explorer (which commands 
>>>the http communication, even if you're not using it);
>>>
>>>- if the three above do not work, check if the dav servlet is sending 
>>>the last-modififed header in the GET method; this should give you a 
>>>different error (about request headers);
>>>
>>>- I assume you don't have international characters in your path, this 
>>>can be the cause of similar problems.
>>>
>>>Hope it helps,
>>>Feliz
>>>
>>>
>>>Jon Higham wrote:
>>>
>>>
>>>>I'm having problems connecting to Sakai 2.1 via webdav. I was able 
>>>>to connect to 2.0.1 after running the Windows XP wbfldrs.msi fix. 
>>>>Both versions of Sakai and their Oracle databases are on the same 
>>>>server, but with Sakai 2.1 I get the "The folder you entered does 
>>>>not appear to be valid" error message when I try to connect in 
>>>>Windows XP's My Network Places.
>>>>

>Yes. Rutgers did this for 2.0 because "Our help desk has no way to 
>identify guests. Since guests are identified by email address, the 
>only practical approach is to use an email exchange. Create a "change 
>my password" button. It mails a magic token that logins in the guest 
>and lets him change his password."

>

>
>Someone from Rutgers will have to give you the details on the current 
>status of the code. In the meantime, I think we should consider this 
>for inclusion in the main code base, with a configurable on/off 
>setting in sakai.properties.
>

body:
The feature that "notifyNewUserEmail" controls is in the worksite  
setup tool, not the UserDirectoryService.  So it's unlikely that  
SakaiScript that talks to the UserDirectoryService would invoke this  
feature.

Might be a nice idea to move the feature from the tool to the  
service, though.

- Glenn

Glenn R. Golden
Sakai Framework Architect
University Of Michigan
ggolden@umich.edu


On Dec 14, 2005, at 10:49 AM, Luke FERNANDEZ wrote:

> I guess it pays to read the sakai_properties.doc assiduously. I didn't
> know that this feature existed although I see now that it's  
> documented.
>
> Quick question:
>
> If I set:
>
> notifyNewUserEmail=true
>
> and then use SakaiScript.addnewUser to add new accounts -- will Sakai
> send an email to the email address specified in the new account?
>
> Cheers,
>
> Luke
>
>
>
>
>>>> Cheryl Wogahn <cheryl.wogahn@yale.edu> 12/14/05 8:05 AM >>>
> Thanks Zhen, this is exactly what I was looking for.  :)
>
> Cheryl
>
> Zhen Qian wrote:
>
>> When one adds a guest user as site participant in Worksite Setup, if
>> the guest user is unknown, it gets added into Sakai with a random
>> password.
>>
>> There is a setting in sakai.properties, notifyNewUserEmail, to
>> control sending notification email. If the setting is true or
>> missing, an email with the random password will be sent to the guest
>> user. He can then use this password to login for the first time.
>>
>> Maybe we should add this feature into Admin's Users tool, so that
>> notification email will be sent when an guest account is added there.
>>
>> - Zhen
>>
>>
>> On Dec 14, 2005, at 9:39 AM, Dave Ross wrote:
>>
>>> The discussion is irrelevant for any externally provided users, but
>>> I'd like this feature to support our guest accounts (which are local
>>> sakai accounts).
>>>
>>> -Dave
>>>
>>> On 12/14/05, Cheryl Wogahn <cheryl.wogahn@yale.edu> wrote:
>>>
>>>> The other 'gotcha' here is if you are using a CAS login like we
>>>> are, the
>>>> password isn't controlled by Sakai, nor is any user data stored in
> the
>>>> local user database.  Our user information is stored in an external
>>>> database.
>>>>
>>>> Cheryl
>>>>
>>>> Luke FERNANDEZ wrote:
>>>>
>>>>> An email password feature (even if it had to email a newly
>>>>> generated password) might actually facilitate first time logins
>>>>> for SIS-Sakai integrations that aren't pre-populating the   
>>>>> password
>
>>>>> in Sakai accounts.  This seems to be my predicament.    I'm using
>>>>> Stephen Githen's excellent Web services to perform SIS- Sakai
>>>>> integration and I'm using it to populate all of the  important SIS
>>>>> data except the student's SIS password which is  available in the
>>>>> SIS only as a hash. I can't populate Sakai  created accounts with
>>>>> an SIS password using  SakaiScript.addnewuser because the password
>>>>> parameter in  SakaiScript.addnewuser, as far as I can tell, is  
>>>>> only
>
>>>>> designed to  accept a non-hashed version of the SIS password.
>>>>>
>>>>> I can still get first time users logged into Sakai by having them
>>>>> authenticate through our portal and then running the
>>>>> SakaiPortalLogin Web service.  But with an email password feature
>>>>> students wouldn't have to go through the portal the first time
>>>>> they log in -- they could get a generated password through the e-
>>>>> mail feature.
>>>>>
>>>>> Alternatively, maybe Stephen's SakaiScript.addNewUser could store
>>>>> the SIS hashed password directly....rather than hashing it again
>>>>> (which is what I'm guessing Sakai does although maybe I'm totally
>>>>> off-base here).
>>>>>
>>>>> Cheers,
>>>>>
>>>>> Luke
>>>>>
>>>>>
>>>>>
>>>>>>>> "Glenn R. Golden" <ggolden@umich.edu> 12/13/05 7:18 PM >>>
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>
>>>>> One  point - Sakai does not know the user's password...
>>>>>
>>>>> - Glenn
>>>>>
>>>>> Glenn R. Golden
>>>>> Sakai Framework Architect
>>>>> University Of Michigan
>>>>> ggolden@umich.edu
>>>>>
>>>>>
>>>>> On Dec 13, 2005, at 6:23 PM, William Chang wrote:
>>>>>
>>>>>
>>>>>
>>>>>> Hi all,
>>>>>>
>>>>>> I am wondering if Sakai developers considering to implement
>>>>>> "password
>>>>>> forgotten" feature like it in many other sites, e.g. Yahoo  
>>>>>> groups.
>>>>>> When
>>>>>> the user click on the "Password forgotten" link, Sakai will  
>>>>>> send a
>>>>>> copy
>>>>>> of the user's password to this user's email account. This feature
>>>>>> prove
>>>>>> to be helpful tool for Sakai/sites administrators. It will be so
>>>>>> much
>>>>>> easier to administering a site.

body:
To Charles and Sakai Collab Group:

I designed a Telemedicine course (for an Instructor at UCDHS) and uploaded it on Sakai via the 'Resources' tab.  The course was built on MS Producer realizing that  'Melete' Course Builder is not able to handle a bundle of different files to enable the seamless loading of the course.  The problem with putting it on the 'Resources' directory is that when a user (learner) logs in, all the other subfiles also appear within the same window making it necessary for the user to scroll through multiple files just to find the major course file.  At its current condition this method is cumbersome and would prefer that a user simply goes to a Module or Course tab and be able to click the Telemedicine course, with the course loading instantly (without subfiles appearing which by the way at its current state could be moved, deleted or modified by anyone having access).

Any suggestions?  Is there another tool I can use?  Does sakai have this capability built in already which I'm unaware of?  Thanks and I appreciate your help.

Lorna


Maria Lorna A. Kunnath, Ed.D. 
Analyst/Programmer/Trainer  
CRISP/INFORMATICS, UCDMC
2921 Stockton Blvd., Sacramento CA 95718 USA 
916-703-9127 CELL 530-902-7546

(Personal Homepage  Owner/Consultant, MLAK EduSoln)



---------------------------------

body:
By Sakai 2.2 (summer), Melete should be integrated with Resources and it
will resolve your dilemma. In the meantime, another option may be to use the
Melete version with the Sferyx editor. A newer version of Sferyx, released
in early fall, supports WebDav. Something you might consider... 

Vivie

--
Vivian 'Vivie' Sinou

Foothill College

body:
Never mind, then.  Since the Apache question came up, I'd guessed you were
using Apache's basic web server and connecting it to Tomcat for the
application serving, but now it sounds like you're just going to Tomcat
directly, and not putting an additional web server in front.

It doesn't help that Tomcat changed its directory naming scheme with
5.5.12to include Apache in the title.  Sorry to help confuse things
further.
mod_jk is a red herring for your problem.

~Clay

2005/12/14, Jon Higham <j.higham@hull.ac.uk>:
>
>
> Thanks, but I'm now more confused than before. I don't appear to have
> either
> conf file, and as far as I can see never have although I did have webdav
> working with sakai 2.0.1. I have used a fresh Tomcat for Sakai 2.1,
> however,
> the conf directory for 2.1 looks pretty much the same as 2.0.1. The only
> thing from Apache I've ever installed was Tomcat 5.5.9 and a Sakai plugin
> for it, and web searches for mod_jk.conf mentions communications between
> Apache and Tomcat and that it be placed in Apache/conf directory, whereas
> I
> only have a jakarta-tomcat-5.5.9/conf.
>
> Should I have this file, or have downloaded it, or do I need to download
> it?
> Sorry, I don't know what to do next.
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: khomotso@gmail.com [mailto:khomotso@gmail.com] On Behalf Of Clay
> Fenlason
> Sent: 14 December 2005 13:50
> To: sakai-dev
> Subject: Re: Sakai 2.1 webdav
>
>
> 2005/12/7, Jon Higham <j.higham@hull.ac.uk>:
> >
> > Sorry, how do I check that the dav path is mapped via the
> > apache/tomcat?
>
>
> I don't know that this is your issue, but just to answer this specific
> question: it will be configured in apache's conf directory somewhere,
> either
> in httpd.conf, or in mod_jk.conf (preferred).  You'll need settings that
> look something like:
>
> JkMount /* ajp13
> #JkMount  /portal/* ajp13
> #JkMount /dav/* ajp13
> #JkMount /access/* ajp13
>
> That first line is just for handing everything from Apache to Tomcat,
> including dav.  The commented ones are for doing crazy things like trying
> to
> hand only certain things to Tomcat, and have Apache handle the rest - like
> we did.
>
> ~Clay
>
>
>
> >
> [see attachment: "message0.html", size: 1174 bytes]
>
>

>
> message0.html
>

body:
I have 2 questions:
1. Is anyone could explain what this error message means?
2. Why there are many different places have sakai.properties file? One is 
under tomcat\sakai\, one is under docs\, one is under demo\ and there are 
2 sakai.properties file under kernel config.
Which sakai.properties file is maven really executable and really take 
a look?

Clay
Thank you for your response. Yes, we removed placeholder.properties file 
and moved all the content in the placeholder.properties into 
sakai.properties.Unfortunatly we still got the same error. 

Thanks
Grace




Grace Wang/IS/UNL/UNEBR 
12/13/2005 04:54 PM

To
sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org
cc

Subject
Error to run Sakai 2.1 with MySQL





Hello, Everyone
It is nice to see most of you in Austin during the Sakai conference. It 
was a wonderful and successful conference.
Well, we encountered a problem to upgrade to Sakai2.1from v2.0.1. 

The procedure we did:
1. Renamed sakai-src as "sakai-src-bak".
2, DLL sakai2.1 source as sakai-src.
3. Remove .maven/repository.
4. Did "maven clean"
5. Built successful
6. start tomcat, we got this error:
(should mention 2 things: 
-   we use MySQL database and as suggested, using mysql-connector 
v3.1.12 instead of v3.1.11
-   we manually modified 
"defaultTransactionIsolationString@javax.sql.BaseDataSource = 
TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED"  )

body:
Hi, Zhen

Actually we tried all mysql-connector-java-3.1.10-bin.jar, 3.1.11 and 
3.1.12. None of them worked. 

Do you know what the error message means? What did it complain about?

We also checked all sakai.properties file and ensured all setting with 
MySQL instead of HSQL.

Any thoughts?

Thanks
Grace




Zhen Qian <zqian@umich.edu> 
12/14/2005 03:02 PM

To
Grace Wang <gwang3@unlnotes.unl.edu>
cc
Clay Fenlason <clayf@bu.edu>, sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org
Subject
Re: Error to run Sakai 2.1 with MySQL






Grace,

I used your setting "
defaultTransactionIsolationString@javax.sql.BaseDataSource 
= TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED" with mysql-connector-java-3.1.10-bin.jar 
instead of 3.1.12. And I don't have the error messages.

Is there a reason to use 3.1.12 instead of 3.1.10? I know 3.1.10 has been 
working for a while.

Thanks,

- Zhen
On Dec 14, 2005, at 2:47 PM, Grace Wang wrote:

I have 2 questions:
1. Is anyone could explain what this error message means?
2. Why there are many different places have sakai.properties file? One is 
under tomcat\sakai\, one is under docs\, one is under demo\ and there are 
2 sakai.properties file under kernel config.
Which sakai.properties file is maven really executable and really take 
a look?

Clay
Thank you for your response. Yes, we removed placeholder.properties file 
and moved all the content in the placeholder.properties into 
sakai.properties.Unfortunatly we still got the same error. 

Thanks
Grace

body:
Hi, Zhen

I added "
jdbc.defaultTransactionIsolation=java.sql.Connection.TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED" 
in the sakai.properties, still got the same error.

Any other solutions?

Thanks
Grace





Zhen Qian <zqian@umich.edu> 
12/14/2005 03:32 PM

To
Grace Wang <gwang3@unlnotes.unl.edu>
cc
Clay Fenlason <clayf@bu.edu>, sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org
Subject
Re: Error to run Sakai 2.1 with MySQL






Well,  it was complaining about property 
'defaultTransactionIsolationString' of javax.sql.BaseDataSource is not 
writable or has a invalid setter method.
However, according to definition of the bean,


<!-- Use TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED for MySQL -->
<!-- DO NOT SET for Oracle (the default TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED is 
fine, and setting it causes performance problems) -->
<!-- Up to and including 1.7.1, HSQLDB supports only 
Connection.TRANSACTION_READ_UNCOMMITTED. -->
<property name="defaultTransactionIsolationString">
<value>TRANSACTION_READ_UNCOMMITTED</value>
</property>

defaultTransactionIsolationString should have a proper setter and getter, 
and TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED should be a proper value.

I used to use 
"jdbc.defaultTransactionIsolation=java.sql.Connection.TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED" 
in my sakai.properties, and it still works.

Thanks,

- Zhen

On Dec 14, 2005, at 4:18 PM, Grace Wang wrote:


Hi, Zhen 

Actually we tried all mysql-connector-java-3.1.10-bin.jar, 3.1.11 and 
3.1.12. None of them worked. 

Do you know what the error message means? What did it complain about? 

We also checked all sakai.properties file and ensured all setting with 
MySQL instead of HSQL. 

Any thoughts? 

Thanks 
Grace 



Zhen Qian <zqian@umich.edu> 
12/14/2005 03:02 PM 


To
Grace Wang <gwang3@unlnotes.unl.edu> 
cc
Clay Fenlason <clayf@bu.edu>, sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org 
Subject
Re: Error to run Sakai 2.1 with MySQL








Grace, 

I used your setting "
defaultTransactionIsolationString@javax.sql.BaseDataSource 
= TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED" with mysql-connector-java-3.1.10-bin.jar 
instead of 3.1.12. And I don't have the error messages. 

Is there a reason to use 3.1.12 instead of 3.1.10? I know 3.1.10 has been 
working for a while. 

Thanks, 

- Zhen 
On Dec 14, 2005, at 2:47 PM, Grace Wang wrote: 

I have 2 questions: 
1. Is anyone could explain what this error message means? 
2. Why there are many different places have sakai.properties file? One is  

under tomcat\sakai\, one is under docs\, one is under demo\ and there are  

2 sakai.properties file under kernel config. 
Which sakai.properties file is maven really executable and really take  
a look? 

Clay 
Thank you for your response. Yes, we removed placeholder.properties file  
and moved all the content in the placeholder.properties into  
sakai.properties.Unfortunatly we still got the same error.  

Thanks 
Grace 




Grace Wang/IS/UNL/UNEBR  
12/13/2005 04:54 PM 

To 
sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org 
cc 

Subject 
Error to run Sakai 2.1 with MySQL 





Hello, Everyone 
It is nice to see most of you in Austin during the Sakai conference. It  
was a wonderful and successful conference. 
Well, we encountered a problem to upgrade to Sakai2.1from v2.0.1.

1. Renamed sakai-src as "sakai-src-bak".

5. Built successful 
6. start tomcat, we got this error: 
(should mention 2 things:

v3.1.12 instead of v3.1.11 
-   we manually modified  
"defaultTransactionIsolationString@javax.sql.BaseDataSource =  
TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED"  )

subject: sakai 2.2 schedule - high level
headers:
From news@gmane.org Tue Mar 04 03:33:20 2003
From: Charles Severance <csev@umich.edu>
Subject: Sakai 2.2 Schedule - High level
Date: Wed, 14 Dec 2005 16:22:23 -0500
Lines: 34
Message-ID: <FBB2AFBA-4FCE-49B5-B8E8-BF5E640EE6E5@umich.edu>
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII; delsp=yes; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-From: postmaster@collab.sakaiproject.org Wed Dec 14 22:29:24 2005
Return-path: <postmaster@collab.sakaiproject.org>

	by ciao.gmane.org with esmtp (Exim 4.43)

          by mahimahi.ds.itd.umich.edu (JAMES SMTP Server 2.1.3) with SMTP ID 349
          for <sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org>;
          Wed, 14 Dec 2005 16:22:27 -0500 (EST)
Received: from playinggod.mr.itd.umich.edu (ns-map.ds.itd.umich.edu [141.211.253.192])
	by mahimahi.ds.itd.umich.edu (Postfix) with ESMTP id 7518214023
	for <sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org>; Wed, 14 Dec 2005 16:22:27 -0500 (EST)
Received: from [192.168.1.49] ([65.199.96.2])
	by playinggod.mr.itd.umich.edu (smtp) with SMTP id jBELMPnZ018314
	for <sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org>; Wed, 14 Dec 2005 16:22:26 -0500
X-Content-Type-Outer-Envelope: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII; delsp=yes; format=flowed
To: sakai-dev <sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org>
X-Mailer: Apple Mail (2.746.2)
X-Content-Type-Message-Body: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII; delsp=yes; format=flowed
Archived-At: <http://permalink.gmane.org/gmane.comp.cms.sakai.devel/99>
body:
The Sakai 2.2. schedule is really very approximate at this point, but  
here is a rough plan of timing.

The OSP project is expecting to do a release of Sakai+OSP sometime in  
the Feb-Mar timeframe.  We hope that this uses the Sakai maintenance  
branch rather than requiring a full release of Sakai.

If the OSP release goes to plan, the next Sakai release will be the  
2.2 release and is roughly targetted for code-freeze May 15 and  
Delivery July 15.

These dates may change as new issues come up, but the high level view  
is that we have 5-6 months until the next signficant Sakai release.

For tool developers and Sakai deployers the 2.2 release will be  
evolutionary rather than revolutionary.  The "difference" will be on  
the order of the difference between 2.0 and 2.1.  Some things will  
change but we will avoid anything that would require major rewrites  
of your tools, services, web service code, or providers.

For those Fall deployers who need lots of time, we hope to be nearly  
feature and schema frozen by May 15 - you will be able to take a tag  
of Sakai at that time to begin your 2.2 work.

As always - this is always subject to change based on how things go  
in the community and as issues come up.

/Chuck

----------------------

body:
Well,  it was complaining about property  
'defaultTransactionIsolationString' of javax.sql.BaseDataSource is  
not writable or has a invalid setter method.
However, according to definition of the bean,


<!-- Use TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED for MySQL -->
<!-- DO NOT SET for Oracle (the default  
TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED is fine, and setting it causes performance  
problems) -->
<!-- Up to and including 1.7.1, HSQLDB supports only  
Connection.TRANSACTION_READ_UNCOMMITTED. -->
<property name="defaultTransactionIsolationString">
<value>TRANSACTION_READ_UNCOMMITTED</value>
</property>

defaultTransactionIsolationString should have a proper setter and  
getter, and TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED should be a proper value.

I used to use  
"jdbc.defaultTransactionIsolation=java.sql.Connection.TRANSACTION_READ_C 
OMMITTED" in my sakai.properties, and it still works.

Thanks,

- Zhen

>
> We also checked all sakai.properties file and ensured all setting  
> with MySQL instead of HSQL.
>
> Any thoughts?
>
> Thanks
> Grace
>
>

body:
Zhen Qian wrote:

> I used to use 
> "jdbc.defaultTransactionIsolation=java.sql.Connection.TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED" 
> in my sakai.properties, and it still works.

Are you sure? According to Glenn's late-November message announcing 
this change:

"Note this is different from prior versions:

jdbc.defaultTransactionIsolation=java.sql.Connection.TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED

This old value will NO LONGER WORK."

This is change is tracked in SAK-2909 for those following at home.

Seth

body:
Thanks, but I'm now more confused than before. I don't appear to have either
conf file, and as far as I can see never have although I did have webdav
working with sakai 2.0.1. I have used a fresh Tomcat for Sakai 2.1, however,
the conf directory for 2.1 looks pretty much the same as 2.0.1. The only
thing from Apache I've ever installed was Tomcat 5.5.9 and a Sakai plugin
for it, and web searches for mod_jk.conf mentions communications between
Apache and Tomcat and that it be placed in Apache/conf directory, whereas I
only have a jakarta-tomcat-5.5.9/conf. 

Should I have this file, or have downloaded it, or do I need to download it?
Sorry, I don't know what to do next.


-----Original Message-----
From: khomotso@gmail.com [mailto:khomotso@gmail.com] On Behalf Of Clay
Fenlason
Sent: 14 December 2005 13:50
To: sakai-dev
Subject: Re: Sakai 2.1 webdav


2005/12/7, Jon Higham <j.higham@hull.ac.uk>:
>
> Sorry, how do I check that the dav path is mapped via the 
> apache/tomcat?


I don't know that this is your issue, but just to answer this specific
question: it will be configured in apache's conf directory somewhere, either
in httpd.conf, or in mod_jk.conf (preferred).  You'll need settings that
look something like:

JkMount /* ajp13
#JkMount  /portal/* ajp13
#JkMount /dav/* ajp13
#JkMount /access/* ajp13

That first line is just for handing everything from Apache to Tomcat,
including dav.  The commented ones are for doing crazy things like trying to
hand only certain things to Tomcat, and have Apache handle the rest - like
we did.

~Clay



>

body:
Is there a high-level view of how community requirements and practices will
inform the priorities for this release, or does the evolutionary emphasis
mean that it's pretty much locked and loaded, as an extension of 2.1 work?

~Clay

---------- Forwarded message ----------
From: Charles Severance <csev@umich.edu>
Date: 14 d=E9c. 2005 16:22
Subject: Sakai 2.2 Schedule - High level
To: sakai-dev <sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org>

The Sakai 2.2. schedule is really very approximate at this point, but
here is a rough plan of timing.

The OSP project is expecting to do a release of Sakai+OSP sometime in
the Feb-Mar timeframe.  We hope that this uses the Sakai maintenance
branch rather than requiring a full release of Sakai.

If the OSP release goes to plan, the next Sakai release will be the
2.2 release and is roughly targetted for code-freeze May 15 and
Delivery July 15.

These dates may change as new issues come up, but the high level view
is that we have 5-6 months until the next signficant Sakai release.

For tool developers and Sakai deployers the 2.2 release will be
evolutionary rather than revolutionary.  The "difference" will be on
the order of the difference between 2.0 and 2.1.  Some things will
change but we will avoid anything that would require major rewrites
of your tools, services, web service code, or providers.

For those Fall deployers who need lots of time, we hope to be nearly
feature and schema frozen by May 15 - you will be able to take a tag
of Sakai at that time to begin your 2.2 work.

As always - this is always subject to change based on how things go
in the community and as issues come up.

/Chuck

body:
It's one of those things that has been planned but haven't had time to 
get it setup. The sakaiproject.org webmaster has the Contact Us form 
setup on sakaiproject.org. We could use that in the meantime I suppose. 
It goes to several people (Anthony, me, Mary Miles I think) but there 
isn't a good way to know who is actually handling something (which means 
there can be multiple responses to the same request). So, we were going 
to use some as yet undecided on trouble ticket system. 

Something for the SF staff to setup I suppose as it was thought they 
would be the ones fielding collab questions.

John

Seth Theriault wrote:

> John Leasia wrote:
>
>> Mark Norton and Anthony Whyte have been handling that, and me 
>> sometimes when asked by them.
>
>
> May I suggest that a support aliases or two be set up for this kind of 
> thing? Something like collab-help@sakaiproject.org that reflects out 
> to a set of the right people?
>
> It would be a lot easier that remembering to send mail to Glenn about 
> your account and one of the above three for sites.
>
> Seth

body:
I think the problem here is shown in this error message (see below) -  
note the class it is attempting to set.  This is not correct, since  
for Sakai 2.1 we use a different DataSource class.  I'm not sure how  
you have ended up with this situation; perhaps from customizations to  
the kernel's sakai.properties, perhaps a bad mixing of 2.0 and 2.1  
runtime artifacts.

The file in sakai/kernel/db-components/src/webapp/WEB-INF/ 
components.xml is where the DataSource is declared in Sakai.  It  
reads like this:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE beans PUBLIC "-//SPRING//DTD BEAN//EN" "http:// 
www.springkernel.org/dtd/spring-beans.dtd">

<beans>

<!-- Base DataSource for all pooled database connections -->
<!-- See http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/dbcp/configuration.html  
-->
<bean id="javax.sql.BaseDataSource" abstract="true"
class="org.apache.commons.dbcp.SakaiBasicDataSource"
destroy-method="close">

Note the class is a Sakai one, SakaiBasicDataSource, not the Apache  
one, BasicDataSource.  Somehow in your runtime, the older definition  
still seems to be in play - otherwise the error message would have read:

'defaultTransactionIsolationString' of bean class  
[org.apache.commons.dbcp. SakaiBasicDataSource]: Bean...

I recommend the following.  Install a clean new Tomcat, so you have  
no chance of having some Sakai 2.0 jars or wars lying around.  Make  
sure you are using completely unmodified Sakai source.  Clean your  
maven repo (again).  Build, deploy, and put in place your  
sakai.properties with your proper MySQL settings, etc.

At this point, there's no way you can get a message like below.
- Glenn

Glenn R. Golden
Sakai Framework Architect
University Of Michigan
ggolden@umich.edu


On Dec 14, 2005, at 5:01 PM, Grace Wang wrote:

> 'defaultTransactionIsolationString' of bean class
> [org.apache.commons.dbcp.BasicDataSource]: Bean property
> 'defaultTransactionIsolationString' is not writable or has an invalid
> setter method: Does the parameter type of the setter match the return

[see attachment: "message0.html", size: 6264 bytes]


Attachments:

message0.html
http://collab.sakaiproject.org/access/content/attachment/c8d349f2-bddd-4952-804b-d74db8d3c257/message0.html

body:
Hi,

Could someone point me to any document's or discussions about strategies 
for breaking up stovepipe's, from a reusable UI perspective.  This is in 
reference to the part of the architecture overview where there is a 
slide of Announcements, Samigo, Melete, etc, and Dr. Chuck talks about 
being able to embed Samigo stuff inside Melete. etc. etc.

Is this going to involve something along the lines of various Sakai 
Services that will let me fetch a premade instantiated JSF Component 
that I can programmatically add to a JSF page?

Thanks,
Steve

----------------------

body:
Steven - there is not a simple cookbook for this - if there were, we  
would just do it.

There is work going on right now between OSP and the Resources tool  
improving the use of helpers.  The EntityProducer API is the start of  
the stovepipe breaking but has a long way to go.

This is pretty complex stuff and will take a while to figure out, let  
alone write.

/Chuck

body:
Seth Theriault writes:
> May I suggest that a support aliases or two be set up for this kind of 
> thing? Something like collab-help@sakaiproject.org that reflects out 
> to a set of the right people?

Yes please.

> It would be a lot easier that remembering to send mail to Glenn about 
> your account and one of the above three for sites.

Thanks for the tip.  I wanted to find out whom I should e-mail about
my collab account and haven't been able to discover this from collab
itself, www.sakaiproject.org, Sakaipedia, or the Indiana Knowledge
Base.

A note on https://www.indiana.edu/~sakaikb/display.cgi?docid=apjk
suggests "you can use the Sakai site's Contact us link on the left at:
http://www.sakaiproject.org/" but when I went to that web form it
wasn't clear what category to select for the message.  (Do I select
"Technical-User Support", "WebSite", or something else?  Or does it
even matter - do the messages all go to the same person/people?)  I
was put off by the list of categories, but if one were added for
issues relating to collab, I would be happy to use the web form.

-- 
Richard Walker                         Richard.Walker@anu.edu.au
Scholarly Technology Services          Phone: (02) 6125 3785
The Australian National University     Intl: +61 2 6125 3785
Canberra, ACT 0200, Australia          Fax:  +61 2 6125 5526
