body:
I want to give some students larger resources section quotas than
others, and would like to remove the resources section from some 'My
Workspaces' entirely.

Is it possible to remove the 'My Workspace' from some accounts?
Is it possible to create or modify 'My Workspace' accounts to have
different quotas?

I have a lot of accounts, and would like some automated way of doing
this - is it possible in sakaiscript?

Thanks to everyone in sakai-dev for all there help. Hope you all have a
great Christmas and New Year.

Cheers,

Paul

----------------------

That is all up to IU in the short term.

Subject: Changes to Sakai's handling of "unavailable" resources
Date: Thu, 22 Dec 2005 12:39:17 -0500 (EST)
Lines: 39
Message-ID: <2367499.1135273300495.JavaMail.tomcat5@mahimahi.ds.itd.umich.edu>

Received: from mahimahi.ds.itd.umich.edu ([127.0.0.1])
          by mahimahi.ds.itd.umich.edu (JAMES SMTP Server 2.1.3) with SMTP ID 106
          for <sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org>;
          Thu, 22 Dec 2005 12:39:18 -0500 (EST)
Received: from mirth.cc.columbia.edu (ns-map.ds.itd.umich.edu [141.211.253.192])
	by mahimahi.ds.itd.umich.edu (Postfix) with ESMTP id 74E7914023
	for <sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org>; Thu, 22 Dec 2005 12:39:18 -0500 (EST)
Received: by mirth.cc.columbia.edu (Postfix, from userid 501)
	id 300CB84894E; Thu, 22 Dec 2005 12:39:17 -0500 (EST)
Received: from localhost (localhost [127.0.0.1])
	by mirth.cc.columbia.edu (Postfix) with ESMTP id DC3AB84894A
	for <sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org>; Thu, 22 Dec 2005 12:39:17 -0500 (EST)
X-X-Sender: slt@mirth.cc.columbia.edu
To: sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org
X-Content-Type-Outer-Envelope: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII; format=flowed
X-Content-Type-Message-Body: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII; format=flowed
Archived-At: <http://permalink.gmane.org/gmane.comp.cms.sakai.devel/263>
body:
Hi everyone,

I'd like to call everyone's attention to the following JIRA item:

http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/jira/browse/SAK-3093

The changes to "fix" this issue have been checked into both the trunk 
and the 2.1/production/maintenance branch.

To summarize the report, in 2.1.0 and earlier versions with content 
stored on a file system, when a user tries to revise or delete a 
resource that has become "unavailable" to Sakai, Sakai refuses to 
delete the resource and displays an alert instead. Sakai makes no 
distinction between transient unavailability of the file system and a 
more permanent unavailability, for example if a file has been 
quarantined after a virus scan. A real-world use case has been 
reported by Indiana University.

The solution put in place is the following:

"We will revise Resources so a site maintainer can delete entries when 
the resource content body cannot be accessed in the server's file 
system. When that happens, it should be logged.

"This fix should allow deletion of a resource to proceed even in case 
of an error trying to access a resource body in the filesystem. The 
error will be logged with a warning that there may be an orphaned 
resource body."

I came across this JIRA issue accidentally, so I thought people should 
be aware of this change as it may have local implications.

Seth

----------------------

I'm not an IU person, but I was asking about this earlier myself.  The last
word I got from Lance was a Dec. 29 release, but as Chuck mentions, not a
part of a Sakai bundle in the near term.

If you want to play around with the code, you can find it in subversion:
https://source.sakaiproject.org/svn/branches/forums-dev/

If you'd like to help test current functionality without worrying about the
code, it's on nightly2:
http://nightly2.sakaiproject.org/

It's now among the tools you can report Jira issues for.

~Clay

X-Content-Type-Outer-Envelope: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1; format=flowed

Archived-At: <http://permalink.gmane.org/gmane.comp.cms.sakai.devel/247>
body:
Beckett Paul Mr (ITCS) s167 wrote:
> Is it possible to extend the sakai automatic logout period (I can't see
> anything relevant in Glenn's Sakai.properties guide). If so how?
>   
If you mean session timeout:

# sessions expire if nothing happens in this many seconds (1 hour)
inactiveInterval@org.sakaiproject.api.kernel.session.SessionManager=3600

Cheers
Stephen

-- 
Stephen Marquard, Learning Technologies Co-ordinator

body:
John Leasia wrote:
> I thought you might be able to create a !user.<accounttype> template 
> site, then edit the site's resources tool and up the quota, and 
> everyone with that account type would then get that new quota, but it 
> didn't seem to work when I tried.
The crude way of getting !user.* template changes to propagate is to 
delete all the individual my workspace sites in the db (usual warnings 
apply). SQL code for doing this was posted to sakai-dev a while ago (by 
Cheryl Woghan initially I think). This is the mysql version (the only 
copy we kept):

-- optional: drop all user myWorkspaces, so they get new ones (with new stuff)
delete from SAKAI_SITE_USER where site_id like '~%' and site_id != '~admin';
delete from SAKAI_SITE_TOOL_PROPERTY where site_id like '~%' and site_id != '~admin';
delete from SAKAI_SITE_TOOL where site_id like '~%' and site_id != '~admin';
delete from SAKAI_SITE_PAGE where site_id like '~%' and site_id != '~admin';
delete from SAKAI_SITE where site_id like '~%' and site_id != '~admin';

Users will then get new My Workspaces from the template when they login 
again.

Cheers
Stephen

-- 
Stephen Marquard, Learning Technologies Co-ordinator
Centre for Educational Technology, University of Cape Town

>> Is it possible to remove the 'My Workspace' from some accounts?

to access rather than maintain...

Stephen

body:
I would like to mothball the SEPP Development Group.  I would propose  
the following:

- Reroute the sepp-devel@collab.sakaiproject.org alias/mail to sakai- 
dev for upwards compatibility

- Make membership "public" for SEPP Development so anyone can join

- Mark the SEPP Development site as Archive-Only and redirect people  
to Sakai Development

A quick check suggests that there is about one thread per month on  
the group.  I think that its existence is confusing to folks.

Comments?

/Chuck

body:
I think it makes sense to retire this one, Chuck.  The Sakai Dev site 
completely supercedes it, so having two sites is very confusing.  
Keeping around for archival purposes is good.  Is there a way to migrate 
content (resources and email archives, bascially) from one site to 
other?  If so, we could move content and delete the whole site.

- Mark Norton

Charles Severance wrote:

> I would like to mothball the SEPP Development Group.  I would propose

> to Sakai Development

> A quick check suggests that there is about one thread per month on  
> the group.  I think that its existence is confusing to folks.

	for <sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org>; Thu, 22 Dec 2005 17:46:51 -0500 (EST)
X-X-Sender: slt@mirth.cc.columbia.edu
To: sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org
X-Content-Type-Outer-Envelope: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII; format=flowed
X-Content-Type-Message-Body: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII; format=flowed
Archived-At: <http://permalink.gmane.org/gmane.comp.cms.sakai.devel/278>
body:
Hi everyone,

While modifying the stock Kerberos provider to do some caching (to 
alleviate any load that DAV logins might put on a KDC), I have been 
taking a closer look at the DAV servlet's behavior.

For 2.1, a change was made to force re-authentication for every DAV 
request. This wasn't being done before, but should have been for 
security reasons. A side effect of this change seems to be that the 
Sakai logs begin to fill with the following lines:

WARN: addSession: already have a session (2005-12-22 17:29:05,096 
http-9090-Processor25_org.sakaiproject.component.adaptor.UsageSessionServiceAdaptor)

after the user re-authenticates for DAV.

I think I have tracked this down to the login() call in:

legacy/util/src/java/org/sakaiproject/util/LoginUtil.java

which is called in:

legacy/dav/src/java/org/sakaiproject/dav/DavServlet.java

In this case, login() never checks for an existing session, but just 
tries to create a new one. This is producing the WARN message in the 
logs.

I did some poking around and came across assureSession() in:

kernel/request/src/java/org/sakaiproject/util/RequestFilter.java

where there is some checking done, etc. It's a "protected" thing so I 
am assuming it's local to the RequestFilter.

I am thinking that DavServlet needs to be using calling something like 
assureSession() instead of login(). Or perhaps login() could be made a 
bit smarter? Ideas anyone?

For completeness, this particular issue isn't specifically reported in 
JIRA, but one open item has the same error message with slightly 
different circumstances:

http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/jira/browse/SAK-2548

Seth

----------------------

You can modify how you receive notifications at My Workspace > Preferences.

information (name, e-mail) exists elsewhere.  Then it is all

body:
Thomas Amsler wrote:
> Hello,
> 
> Which code base are you guys using in production?  The choices are to 
> run the maintenance branch or release tag code.  It seems a bit easier 
> to just use the maintenance branch code base to get frequent updates, 
> but then they may not be QAed until a release tag is created. Any 
> comments and or recommendations on this best practices issue?

UCT will also be deploying 2.1.x (maintenance branch) for our 1 Feb 06 release, 
which will probably be before 2.1.1 is released.

There are enough changes since 2.1.0 to make the small additional risk of 
running a non-fully-QA'ed version worthwhile. In doing so, we're assuming 
(hoping?!) that the branch management of 2.1.x will be relatively conservative 
and not introduce any changes that could lead to significant instability.

Cheers
Stephen

-- 
Stephen Marquard

Centre for Higher Education Development, University of Cape Town

It seems reasonable to me, though it would be nice to have a 
continuously-updated document (on Confluence perhaps) which summarises

Stephen

body:
Hi folks,

As the Sakai Community begins to find our collective way, I would =20
like to call your attention to what I hope you will find to be an =20
interesting and relevant dissertation from Martin Aspeli of the =20
London School of Economics:

http://dissertation.martinaspeli.net/

Plone has been brought up in the Sakai community before (such as =20
during the licensing discussions), and this study of the Plone =20
project touches on every aspect we think about on a daily basis with =20
Sakai. Aspeli hopes his paper will, "not only assist researchers in =20
better understanding the interaction between the various aspects of a =20
mature open source project, but also help practitioners of open =20
source reflect upon their own processes."

Here is the abstract:

"Many perspectives have been offered in the academic literature to =20
explain the phenomenon of open source software development. =20
Unfortunately, most studies fail to adequately account for the depth =20
and social complexity of the communities found at the heart of mature =20
open source projects. Through an in-depth interpretive case study of =20
Plone, a vibrant open source project, as well as an evaluation of the =20
existing literature on open source, a model of a mature open source =20
project is proposed. The model incorporates concepts such as the =20
project=92s life cycle, community-of-practice, culture, and business- =20
and end-user orientation. Limitations to this model are acknowledged, =20
and avenues for future research to improve theoretical accounts of =20
the social dynamics of open source communities are suggested."

Best regards for the holiday,

Jim


*************************
James Williamson
Manager, Teaching Enhancement Center
UCLA Office of Instructional Development
160A Powell Library
jwjwj@ucla.edu
310-794-9381

body:
I have been playing with Charon's gallery mode in 2.1 and frankly I  
don't like it very well.    I mostly think that these problems are  
almost "bugs" just because we had not tested a lot of scenarios with  
gallery mode.  All of  my playing with Desktop presentation leads me  
to test gallery mode out a lot.

I am about to smack it around but wanted to get some input to make  
sure that I am doing the right thing and to make sure that no one has  
hacked around these problems and I don't want to break anyone's  
current use of gallery mode.

If you are using gallery (like Merced) in iFrame / Single Signon or  
using it with session based launching (like my JSR-168 portlet) there  
should be no changes - these two scenarios work fine already.

Others have talked about these problems here - I am reviewing them  
and then will go do something about them unless someone tells me  
otherwise.  I will put in JIRAs if we like all this so as to document  
the Who, What, Why of this.  I would like to put this into the  
maintenance branch as well so it makes 2.1.1.  Hence the "wide"  
distribution of the question.

- Logout in gallery mode is broken - it sends you to full portal mode

- Logout in gallery mode is a dumb idea anyways - gallery lives in  
some other portal or display context and that is where logout should  
happen

Proposal: Kill logout in gallery mode.  If we really need it, make it  
optional and when we bring it back make it work so that when you  
logout and log back in you are *STILL* in gallery mode - I will jsut  
comment it out with a note rather than removing it.

- There seems to be no clean way to force login when coming into  
gallery mode - Since it is a variant of portal if you are anonymous  
you see the public gallery with no way of "moving forward" except to  
create  a new account - whoop-dee-doo.

Proposal A: Force login for gallery mode all the time

Proposal B: Make sure that we have a URL that can force login if we  
like.  I think that   /portal/login?url=/portal/gallery should do it  
- but it does not work.

I lean towards Proposal B because I like flexibility :)

Thoughts / Comments (pro of con).

/Chuck

body:
Seasons greetings!

No time to elaborate, but I agree with all this.  I had logged some jira
issues related to this already last week.

http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/jira/browse/SAK-3118
http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/jira/browse/SAK-3119
http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/jira/browse/SAK-3120

The issues are to the extent that I has abandoned gallery mode completely
for portal integration.

Again, I would like to help (after the holidays).

yuji
----

body:
Kyong,

We are using NFS here at IU to mount a NetAppliance NAS device.  L

________________________________

Lance Speelmon
Acting Manager Online Development
Indiana University


-----Original Message-----
From: Kyong Kim [mailto:kimkyong@fhda.edu] 
Sent: Monday, December 19, 2005 7:53 PM
To: sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org
Subject: AFS vs NFS

We're in the process of using setting up a file server to store 
resources content for sakai for our app servers on RHEL 3.
It appears that majority of you are using AFS.
Is anyone using NFS? Also, is there a reason to use AFS over NFS?
We would prefer to err on the side of caution and use something that 
is tried and true.
Has anyone observed any issues with either one?
Any help will be much appreciated.
Kyong

body:
Hi All,


I'm busy testing our providers here and noticed the following behaviour.
If you:

1) Create a course site with a roster that has no students in it yet.
2) add students to the roster (as would happen if a site was set-up
before the start of the year)

the cache of the authzgroup (realm) only seems to be updated if:
a) a user logs in  or
b) if you go to the admin realms tool and save the realm


This means that the roster tool can display some widely inaccurate
information about the course. Now have I made a mistake somewhere in my
provider or is this expected behaviour?

David
-- 
"It remains that, from the same principles, I now demonstrate the frame
of the System of the World." - Newton "Pricipia Mathematica"

[see attachment: "dhorwitz.vcf", size: 468 bytes]


Attachments:

dhorwitz.vcf
http://collab.sakaiproject.org/access/content/attachment/11349769-a8be-445d-004a-c2d983179f5e/dhorwitz.vcf

Vivie,
Sorry for not replying earlier.  Stanford has a mandatory 2-week shutdown
so most of us have been out of the office since Dec 19th.

Are there any exceptions thrown in the log when the blank screen happened?
Can you send us the log?  Also, can you send us the import xml file so we
can try to reproduce your problem locally?

thanks,
Lydia



Quoting Vivian 'Vivie' Sinou <SinouVivian@foothill.edu>:

> After importing a test in Samigo (Sakai 2.1), we receive a blank window.

> import goes through all the steps, it seems, but it returns a blank
> screen,

body:
Jan,

Your Apache needs to be able to handle the HTTP requests for Tomcat  
so it can intercept and use mod_cas to protect the container login  
URL.  Have you heard of mod_jk?  You can use it as a connector module  
to turn Apache into a proxy for Tomcat.  Apache will answer all HTTP  
requests and make calls back to Tomcat when a Sakai URL needs to be  
handled.

Or you could try the servlet filter method described in the  
confluence doc and do your CAS check in tomcat instead of apache.

Andrew

On Dec 28, 2005, at 4:07 PM, Jan Kulmann wrote:

> I'm trying to CASify Sakai 2.1, but for me a few thinks are not  
> really clear at the moment.
>
> I've done the steps in http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/confluence/ 
> display/ENTR/CASifying+Sakai for CAS via an Apache module.
>
> I have
> - a CAS Server (which does nothing else than verfifying that a  
> username matches a password),
> - a Tomcat with Sakai 2.1 (Port 8080) and
> - an Apache HTTPD Server (Port 80) with mod_cas

body:
I'm trying to CASify Sakai 2.1, but for me a few thinks are not really 
clear at the moment.

I've done the steps in 
http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/confluence/display/ENTR/CASifying+Sakai for 
CAS via an Apache module.

I have
- a CAS Server (which does nothing else than verfifying that a username 
matches a password),
- a Tomcat with Sakai 2.1 (Port 8080) and
- an Apache HTTPD Server (Port 80) with mod_cas

How does the Apache know about how to redirect to Tomcat? I have 
something like this in my httpd.conf:

LoadModule cas_module           modules/mod_cas.so

CASLoginURL http://somehost:8080/cas/login
CASHost somehost
CASValidate /cas/validate
CASLocalCacheInsecure On
CASAuthenticateOnly On
CASTrustedCerts /usr/local/apache2/verisignserverca.pem
CASDebug On

CASLocalCacheFile /home/www/cas_cache
CASLocalCacheSize 1000
CASLocalCacheTimeout 7200

<Location "/cas-protected/">
AuthType CAS
AuthName "CAS"
require valid-user
</Location>

This is very close to what is described in confluence except that I used 
a location different from "/sakai-login/container". Apache and Tomcat 
aren't on the some hardware (but they can if they have to). If I try 
http://apache_host/cas-protected/ I'll get a redirect to my CAS server, 
can login and get a ticket. This is as expected. But how can I redirect 
from Apache via CAS to my Sakai?

My Tomcat's server.xml looks like (with tomcatAuthentication="false"):

<!-- Define an AJP 1.3 Connector on port 8009 -->
<Connector port="8009"
enableLookups="false" redirectPort="8443"
tomcatAuthentication="false" URIEncoding="UTF-8"
protocol="AJP/1.3" />

and I have

top.login = false
container.login = true

in sakai.properties.

I think there are some steps missing in confluence or is it just me?

Thanks for help!
Jan

-- 
Jan Kulmann
Universitaet Bremen
Zentrum fuer Multimedia in der Lehre ZMML
Stud.IP Team
https://elearning.uni-bremen.de

----------------------

You can modify how you receive notifications at My Workspace > Preferences.

body:
Thanks to all who answered me!

Now I'm using CASfilter inside Tomcat. The "damn" https requirement 
forced me to set up an SSL-Tomcat for CAS. When clicking the login link 
it'll redirect me to my CAS server, but after submitting user 
credentials, I got this exception in catalina.out:

WARN:  (2005-12-29 12:16:42,662 
http-8180-Processor24_org.sakaiproject.util.RequestFilter)
javax.servlet.ServletException: 
sun.security.validator.ValidatorException: PKIX path building failed: 
sun.security.provider.certpath.SunCertPathBuilderException: unable to 
find valid certification path to requested target
at 
edu.yale.its.tp.cas.client.filter.CASFilter.getAuthenticatedUser(CASFilter.java:254)
at 
edu.yale.its.tp.cas.client.filter.CASFilter.doFilter(CASFilter.java:184)
at 
org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:202)
at 
org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:173)
at 
org.sakaiproject.util.RequestFilter.doFilter(RequestFilter.java:535)
at 
org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:202)
at 
org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:173)
at 
org.apache.catalina.core.StandardWrapperValve.invoke(StandardWrapperValve.java:213)
at 
org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContextValve.invoke(StandardContextValve.java:178)
at 
org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHostValve.invoke(StandardHostValve.java:126)
at 
org.apache.catalina.valves.ErrorReportValve.invoke(ErrorReportValve.java:105)
at 
org.apache.catalina.core.StandardEngineValve.invoke(StandardEngineValve.java:107)
at 
org.apache.catalina.connector.CoyoteAdapter.service(CoyoteAdapter.java:148)
at 
org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Processor.process(Http11Processor.java:856)
at 
org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol$Http11ConnectionHandler.processConnection(Http11Protocol.java:744)
at 
org.apache.tomcat.util.net.PoolTcpEndpoint.processSocket(PoolTcpEndpoint.java:527)
at 
org.apache.tomcat.util.net.LeaderFollowerWorkerThread.runIt(LeaderFollowerWorkerThread.java:80)
at 
org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.ThreadPool$ControlRunnable.run(ThreadPool.java:684)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:595)

Seems to be some pki path problem, but how do I fix it?
BTW: I have a "normal" key built with

$JAVA_HOME/bin/keytool -genkey -alias tomcat -keyalg RSA

Thanks
Jan

Andrew Poland wrote:

> Jan,
> 
> Your Apache needs to be able to handle the HTTP requests for Tomcat  so 
> it can intercept and use mod_cas to protect the container login  URL.  
> Have you heard of mod_jk?  You can use it as a connector module  to turn 
> Apache into a proxy for Tomcat.  Apache will answer all HTTP  requests 
> and make calls back to Tomcat when a Sakai URL needs to be  handled.
> 
> Or you could try the servlet filter method described in the  confluence 
> doc and do your CAS check in tomcat instead of apache.
> 
> Andrew

-- 
Jan Kulmann
Universitaet Bremen
Zentrum fuer Multimedia in der Lehre ZMML
Stud.IP Team
https://elearning.uni-bremen.de

body:
I took a few minutes and modified the BasicNewsService to use the ROME
syndication api... the news tool seems to accept more rss urls and now
ATOM as well, but I've only done limited testing. You'll need to
manually add rome-0.7.jar to your maven repo.

Chuck, I haven't looked at the license for ROME in detail but here's the site:

https://rome.dev.java.net/

-Dave

body:
We are releasing Message Center into production tomorrow morning with this
tag:

https://source.sakaiproject.org/svn/tags/messagecenter_m1/



For those of you that want an early release, this is the one to go with.  We
will continue to provide tags as we add functionality and run through QA.  I
would not recommend working with HEAD unless you are really brave; use the
tags!  :-)



Happy New Year!  L



_____  

Lance Speelmon

Acting Manager Online Development

Indiana University

body:
Hi all,

I was trying to setup our sakai installation to restrict the creation of 
course sites by the instructors - allowing only prohect sites. 
Apparently, the only solution was to edit the sakai.sitesetup.xml file 
like this:
<!-- <configuration name="siteTypes" value="course,project" /> -->
<configuration name="siteTypes" value="project" />
However, after this change, it is impossible to create any site in 
"Worksite Setup" - nothing happens after clicking on "New". Is this a 
bug? Anyone with similar problems?

I also notice that an exception is periodicaly thrown to the logs about 
a (inexistent) missing "chef_permissions-Main.vm" file:
INFO: sakai.vm: Exception reading vm template: 
/vm/helper/chef_permissions-Main.vm 
org.apache.velocity.exception.ResourceNotFoundException: Unable to find 
resource '/vm/helper/chef_permissions-Main.vm' (2005-12-28 22:55:32,501 
TP-Processor10_org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.[Catalina].[localhost].[/sakai-legacy-tools])

And this is because only a 
"/sakai-legacy-tools/vm/helper/chef_permissions.vm" file exists. Is this 
a bug? Does anyone has a similar exception in the logs?

Thank you!
Greetings,
Nuno Fernandes.

body:
Hi Folks,

what is the status of Twin Peaks for Sakai 2.1? I'd like to rewrite my 
html parser class (it's not srw, only simple html). How do I integrate 
my own local digital library in 2.1? I think I din't find a way to place 
my old classes...

The "old" way was to create a new folder and put MyLibQuery.java, 
MyLibResponse.java and MyLibResult.java into it and add some information 
to searchsource.xml.

Thanks
Jan

-- 
Jan Kulmann
Universitaet Bremen
Zentrum fuer Multimedia in der Lehre ZMML
Stud.IP Team
https://elearning.uni-bremen.de

body:
Happy New Year's Eve for folks west of Italy and Happy New Years Day  
to folks east of Italy.

I have just finished an Apple/Cocoa Desktop similar to my  JSR-168   
and Visual Basic Desktop widgets.  It uses web services to log in (is  
possible) and retrieves sites and pages.

I attach the software (ZIP), Source code (tar) and a few screenshots.

The software supports both systems with and without web services.  If  
the system supports web services, the system retrieves sites and  
pages and displays them tree style.  If the Sakai Host does not  
support web services, they just act like glorified bookmarks.

The todo list includes deleting sites, renaming, them, actually  
storing things in properties between executions and storing  
credentials in KeyChain.

For now, It is fun :)

/Chuck

P.S. for the few I shared this with earlier - this is a new version  
01.zip file - it should actually work

body:
Hi all,

Everytime an user tries to update their profile a 
StaleObjectStateException is thrown and the changes are not reflected....

WARN: An operation failed due to stale data (2006-01-02 11:06:58,791 
TP-Processor11_net.sf.hibernate.StaleObjectStateException) 
net.sf.hibernate.StaleObjectStateException: Row was updated or deleted 
by another transaction (or unsaved-value mapping was incorrect) for 
org.sakaiproject.component.common.edu.person.SakaiPersonImpl instance 
with identifier: 4680

Is there anyone having the same behavior?

Thanks,
Nuno Fernandes.

body:
I have managed to get the script files changed to eliminate errors when
running the script to upfate the db from 1.5.1 to 2.0. I am now stuck on
getting from 2.0 to 2.1.

I am trying to run the upgrade script located in the source files for
2.1. I am running MYSql 4.1 on a windows box. I am running the upgrade
script via the command line.

Here is where I am stuck:

This line is in the script from Sakai:

ALTER TABLE SAKAI_SITE_GROUP
ADD  ( FOREIGN KEY (SITE_ID) REFERENCES SAKAI_SITE );

It fails with this error:
ERROR 1005 (HY000) at line 32: Can't create table
'.\sakai\#sql-350_8.frm' (errno: 150)

Which, according to MYSql web site, 1005 (ER_CANT_CREATE_TABLE) 

Cannot create table. If the error message string refers to errno 150,
table creation failed because a foreign key constraint was not correctly
formed. 



Now If I use the GUI tool for MYSQL and manually try to make the change
that this line wants, the GUI tool produces this sql statement:

ALTER TABLE `sakai`.`sakai_site_group` ADD CONSTRAINT
`FK_sakai_site_group_1` FOREIGN KEY `FK_sakai_site_group_1` (`SITE_ID`)
REFERENCES `sakai_site` (`SITE_ID`)
ON DELETE RESTRICT
ON UPDATE RESTRICT;		

If I run this it works. I don't want to modify all the upgrade scripts,
shouldn't have to. What am I missing?

-Dan





-----Original Message-----
From: Andrew Poland [mailto:ajpoland@iupui.edu] 
Sent: Tuesday, December 20, 2005 11:44 AM
To: Cotton, Dan
Cc: sakai-dev
Subject: Re: Update db 1.5.1 to 2.0

I'm guessing perhaps your client's connection character set and
collation does not match the charset/collation of your database.

use these to change the connection mode:

set NAMES utf8;
set CHARACTER SET utf8;

(http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/charset-connection.html)


Or change the default character set for your database:

ALTER DATABASE database_name DEFAULT CHARACTER SET utf8 COLLATE
utf8_general_ci;



(Make a backup first of course.)

Andrew

On Dec 20, 2005, at 2:16 PM, Cotton, Dan wrote:

> The line generates this error:
>
> Illegal mix of collations (latin1_swedish_ci,COERCIBLE) and
> (utf8_general_ci,IMPLICIT) for operation 'concat'
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Cotton, Dan
> Sent: Tuesday, December 20, 2005 11:12 AM
> To: sakai-dev
> Subject: RE: Update db 1.5.1 to 2.1
>
> This line is currently giving me problems:
>
> update SAKAI_SITE_TOOL set REGISTRATION=concat('sakai',
> substr(REGISTRATION,5)) where UPPER(substr(REGISTRATION,1,4))='CHEF';
>
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Cotton, Dan
> Sent: Tuesday, December 20, 2005 11:04 AM
> To: sakai-dev
> Subject: RE: Update db 1.5.1 to 2.1
>
> Has anyone got this to work? I am removing lines that through errors 
> and keep getting more.
>
> Attached are the scripts I found on the sakai site for the 
> converisons.
>
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Cotton, Dan
> Sent: Tuesday, December 20, 2005 10:42 AM
> To: Charles Severance
> Cc: sakai-dev
> Subject: RE: Update db 1.5.1 to 2.1
>
> Ok, I am running the 1.5 to 2.0 script and get the following error:
>
> ERROR 1267 (HY000) at line 23: Illegal mix of collations
> (latin1_swedish_ci,COERCIBLE) and (utf8_general_ci,IMPLICIT) for 
> operation 'concat'
>
> Can't seem to get past this
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Charles Severance [mailto:csev@umich.edu]
> Sent: Tuesday, December 20, 2005 10:37 AM
> To: Cotton, Dan
> Cc: sakai-dev
> Subject: Re: Update db 1.5.1 to 2.1
>
> Generally the approach is to convert through each intermediate release

> and be careful.
>
> You should do 1.5.1 -> 2.0 and then 2.0 -> 2.1
>
> You should make nice backups at each step and make sure to do a light 
> test with 2.0 during the middle step to make sure it all looks fine.
>
> /Chuck
>
> On Dec 20, 2005, at 1:26 PM, Cotton, Dan wrote:
>
>> Are there any scripts for updating a Sakai 1.5.1 MYSql db to 2.1?
>>
>> -Dan

body:
I am using the one fro the docs\updating folder. Attached is the script
I have from the source.



-----Original Message-----
From: Hans Masing [mailto:hmasing@umich.edu] 
Sent: Tuesday, January 03, 2006 5:57 AM
To: Cotton, Dan
Cc: sakai-dev
Subject: Re: Update db 1.5.1 to 2.0

Are you using the MySql version of the conversion script?  The syntax of
the ALTER TABLE statement looks an awful lot like the Oracle syntax.

- Hans


On Jan 3, 2006, at 12:58 AM, Cotton, Dan wrote:

> I have managed to get the script files changed to eliminate errors 
> when running the script to upfate the db from 1.5.1 to 2.0. I am now 
> stuck on getting from 2.0 to 2.1.
>
> I am trying to run the upgrade script located in the source files for 
> 2.1. I am running MYSql 4.1 on a windows box. I am running the upgrade

> script via the command line.
>
> Here is where I am stuck:
>
> This line is in the script from Sakai:
>
> ALTER TABLE SAKAI_SITE_GROUP
> ADD  ( FOREIGN KEY (SITE_ID) REFERENCES SAKAI_SITE );
>
> It fails with this error:
> ERROR 1005 (HY000) at line 32: Can't create table 
> '.\sakai\#sql-350_8.frm' (errno: 150)
>
> Which, according to MYSql web site, 1005 (ER_CANT_CREATE_TABLE)
>
> Cannot create table. If the error message string refers to errno 150, 
> table creation failed because a foreign key constraint was not 
> correctly formed.
>
>
>
> Now If I use the GUI tool for MYSQL and manually try to make the  
> change
> that this line wants, the GUI tool produces this sql statement:
>
> ALTER TABLE `sakai`.`sakai_site_group` ADD CONSTRAINT
> `FK_sakai_site_group_1` FOREIGN KEY `FK_sakai_site_group_1`  
> (`SITE_ID`)
> REFERENCES `sakai_site` (`SITE_ID`)
> ON DELETE RESTRICT
> ON UPDATE RESTRICT;		
>
> If I run this it works. I don't want to modify all the upgrade  
> scripts,
> shouldn't have to. What am I missing?
>
> -Dan
>
>
>
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Andrew Poland [mailto:ajpoland@iupui.edu]
> Sent: Tuesday, December 20, 2005 11:44 AM
> To: Cotton, Dan
> Cc: sakai-dev
> Subject: Re: Update db 1.5.1 to 2.0
>
> I'm guessing perhaps your client's connection character set and
> collation does not match the charset/collation of your database.
>
> use these to change the connection mode:
>
> set NAMES utf8;
> set CHARACTER SET utf8;
>
> (http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/charset-connection.html)
>
>
> Or change the default character set for your database:
>
> ALTER DATABASE database_name DEFAULT CHARACTER SET utf8 COLLATE
> utf8_general_ci;
>
>
>
> (Make a backup first of course.)
>
> Andrew
>
> On Dec 20, 2005, at 2:16 PM, Cotton, Dan wrote:
>
>> The line generates this error:
>>
>> Illegal mix of collations (latin1_swedish_ci,COERCIBLE) and
>> (utf8_general_ci,IMPLICIT) for operation 'concat'
>>
>> -----Original Message-----
>> From: Cotton, Dan
>> Sent: Tuesday, December 20, 2005 11:12 AM
>> To: sakai-dev
>> Subject: RE: Update db 1.5.1 to 2.1
>>
>> This line is currently giving me problems:
>>
>> update SAKAI_SITE_TOOL set REGISTRATION=concat('sakai',
>> substr(REGISTRATION,5)) where UPPER(substr(REGISTRATION,1,4))='CHEF';
>>
>>
>>
>> -----Original Message-----
>> From: Cotton, Dan
>> Sent: Tuesday, December 20, 2005 11:04 AM
>> To: sakai-dev
>> Subject: RE: Update db 1.5.1 to 2.1
>>
>> Has anyone got this to work? I am removing lines that through errors
>> and keep getting more.
>>
>> Attached are the scripts I found on the sakai site for the
>> converisons.
>>
>>
>>
>> -----Original Message-----
>> From: Cotton, Dan
>> Sent: Tuesday, December 20, 2005 10:42 AM
>> To: Charles Severance
>> Cc: sakai-dev
>> Subject: RE: Update db 1.5.1 to 2.1
>>
>> Ok, I am running the 1.5 to 2.0 script and get the following error:
>>
>> ERROR 1267 (HY000) at line 23: Illegal mix of collations
>> (latin1_swedish_ci,COERCIBLE) and (utf8_general_ci,IMPLICIT) for
>> operation 'concat'
>>
>> Can't seem to get past this
>>
>> -----Original Message-----
>> From: Charles Severance [mailto:csev@umich.edu]
>> Sent: Tuesday, December 20, 2005 10:37 AM
>> To: Cotton, Dan
>> Cc: sakai-dev
>> Subject: Re: Update db 1.5.1 to 2.1
>>
>> Generally the approach is to convert through each intermediate  
>> release
>
>> and be careful.
>>
>> You should do 1.5.1 -> 2.0 and then 2.0 -> 2.1
>>
>> You should make nice backups at each step and make sure to do a light
>> test with 2.0 during the middle step to make sure it all looks fine.
>>
>> /Chuck
>>
>> On Dec 20, 2005, at 1:26 PM, Cotton, Dan wrote:
>>
>>> Are there any scripts for updating a Sakai 1.5.1 MYSql db to 2.1?
>>>
>>> -Dan
>>>

body:
Good morning!  Many of you have inquired recently about the permissions
within Message Center, so this message is intended to answer many of those
questions.

The default permissions for Message Center, that will be carried through to
the default settings template and every forum/topic for every site, should
be set within Realms for your university's specific site types and the
associated roles.  

In the near future, users will have the ability to change the permissions
per site, forum and/or topic, but at the present time we have locked down
the settings so that users may not change the default permissions.

Please let me know if you have any questions.

Thank you,

Kristol

Kristol Hancock
Oncourse - Indiana University
317.278.6047
khancock@iu.edu

body:
Aaron -

No, there is no bug. We are running Melete with Sakai 2.1 with no issues. I
just tested the htmlarea version, just to be sure all is fine there, too, as
we don't use that version here, and John Leasia's helper.doc got uploaded
beautifully. See attached. It must be some (mis)configuration on your end. I
assume you have downloaded the Melete version for 2.1. Only one of my
developers is here at the moment, Murthy, and he is working around the clock
on various critical production issues - classes start next Monday. He will
not be able to get back to you right away, but he will. 

Thanks for your patience. 

Vivie

PS. Writing to sakai-dev, etudes-dev@foothill.edu, or melete@foothill.edu
works. Typically, you'll get a response from us on the same day. 

--
Vivian 'Vivie' Sinou
Dean, Learning Technology & Innovations
Foothill College

> 
> I attached the screen with the error. Anyone have any idea? 
> Should I report this in JIRA (there does not seem to be a 
> component for Melete)?
> -AZ
>

Archived-At: <http://permalink.gmane.org/gmane.comp.cms.sakai.devel/308>
body:
Aaron,

I have come across this issue at some point and it turned out that I  
missed some of the required setup steps. Thins to look for:

- Make sure that /var/melete, /var/meleteDocs, and /var/uploads have  
r/w permissions for the sakai/tomcat user
- Make sure that you recursively copy the content of melete-2.1/var/ 
melete to /var/melete
- Make sure that you copied the meleteDocs.xml to $CATALINA_HOME/conf/ 
Catalina/localhost/

Also, how big was the file that you tried to upload?

Best,

Thomas Amsler
Programmer
IET Mediaworks, UC Davis
tpamsler@ucdavis.edu
tamsler@cal.berkeley.edu
W: (530) 754-5198
M: (916) 803-2226



On Jan 3, 2006, at 8:08 AM, Zeckoski, Aaron wrote:

> We are having a problem in melete with uploading file attachments. The
> problem occurs when using the sakai 2.1.0 tag version of the code. We
> are getting the following error regardless of how small or large the
> file we try to attach to a section is:
> Unable to upload file. Please try again....
> Note: You cannot upload files that are larger than 2MB.
>
> I attached the screen with the error. Anyone have any idea? Should I
> report this in JIRA (there does not seem to be a component for  
> Melete)?
> -AZ
>
> --
> Aaron Zeckoski (aaronz@vt.edu)
> Lead Developer - Learning Technologies - Virginia Tech

body:
Is anyone running Samigo with Sakai 2.1 (MySQL)? We are experiencing a
strange (blocker!) situation where there is NO default template in any of
our course sites - new or existing - for the Instructor role (though all
perms are checked). Only Sakai admin has access to the default template. I
understand that there were improvements in the default template in 2.1
(flexibility in editing), so one should be there, right?

Have we overlooked something or is there a known issue? Any tips would be
greatly appreciated. 

Thanks,

Vivie

--
Vivian 'Vivie' Sinou
Dean, Learning Technology & Innovations
Foothill College

body:
We are having a problem in melete with uploading file attachments. The
problem occurs when using the sakai 2.1.0 tag version of the code. We
are getting the following error regardless of how small or large the
file we try to attach to a section is:
Unable to upload file. Please try again....
Note: You cannot upload files that are larger than 2MB.

I attached the screen with the error. Anyone have any idea? Should I
report this in JIRA (there does not seem to be a component for Melete)?
-AZ

--
Aaron Zeckoski (aaronz@vt.edu)
Lead Developer - Learning Technologies - Virginia Tech

Archived-At: <http://permalink.gmane.org/gmane.comp.cms.sakai.devel/311>
body:
Hi,
I have lately been noticing some performance problems with Sakai 2.1 on 
my dev/test machine. When I click on any of the tools there is a 30 -  
40 seconds delay before the page is rendered.

The performance is especially bad on the Section Info tool. Many of our 
courses contain 14 - 20 sections. The Section Info takes more than a 
minute to render the page that contains the Section information for 
these 14-20 sections.

My dev/test machine is  a Fedora  Linux Desktop with 1 GB of memory and 
has only one instance of the Tomcat running. I am using apache tomcat 
5.5.12.
My JAVA_OPTS setting is "-Xms256m -Xmx512m".

I did a top on my system and did not notice any significant CPU usage 
due to Sakai.  The values for %CPU was 0.7 and %MEM was 43.5.

Has anybody else noticed similar problems with Sakai 2.1 ?

I would be happy to give more details , if required about the hardware 
configurations and software being used.

Regards,
Vishwak
UC Merced

body:
Hi Vishwak,
I have not seen this behavior, but I would be interested to hear more 
details, or hear from others experiencing this problem.

I know that UC Merced was thinking about making some small modifications 
to the Section Info tool (such as exposing the SectionManager API in the 
Sakai component manager).  Do you experience this performance problem on 
a vanilla Sakai, or only on a modified version?

Thanks,
Josh

Vishwak Rajgopalan wrote:

> Hi,
> I have lately been noticing some performance problems with Sakai 2.1 
> on my dev/test machine. When I click on any of the tools there is a 30 
> -  40 seconds delay before the page is rendered.
>
> The performance is especially bad on the Section Info tool. Many of 
> our courses contain 14 - 20 sections. The Section Info takes more than 
> a minute to render the page that contains the Section information for 
> these 14-20 sections.
>
> My dev/test machine is  a Fedora  Linux Desktop with 1 GB of memory 
> and has only one instance of the Tomcat running. I am using apache 
> tomcat 5.5.12.
> My JAVA_OPTS setting is "-Xms256m -Xmx512m".
>
> I did a top on my system and did not notice any significant CPU usage 
> due to Sakai.  The values for %CPU was 0.7 and %MEM was 43.5.
>
> Has anybody else noticed similar problems with Sakai 2.1 ?
>
> I would be happy to give more details , if required about the hardware 
> configurations and software being used.
>
> Regards,
> Vishwak
> UC Merced
>

body:
At 10:38 AM 1/3/2006, you wrote:
>Is anyone running Samigo with Sakai 2.1 (MySQL)? We are experiencing a
>strange (blocker!) situation where there is NO default template in any of
>our course sites - new or existing - for the Instructor role (though all
>perms are checked). Only Sakai admin has access to the default template. I
>understand that there were improvements in the default template in 2.1
>(flexibility in editing), so one should be there, right?

Hi Vivie,

The default template was removed by design for Sakai 2.1.  We figured that 
since all settings should be viewable/editable by default from now on,  it 
would simplify things for instructors if the default template was 
transparent.   An instructor should only need to deal with templates if she 
or he wants to limit the available settings in created assessments.

Does that make sense? There shouldn't be any loss of functionality at all 
(if there is for you, please let us know!);  the intent of this change just 
to make the user experience less confusing.  Hopefully it won't have the 
opposite effect. :)

Thanks,
Margaret
Stanford QA

----------------------

body:
Thanks, Margaret. 

Peter Knoop and John Leasia shed light into the issue earlier today -
explaining the new behavior and directing me to a Jira issue that mentions
the change in the default template in Samigo 2.1.
http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/jira/browse/SAK-2792.

This is a GREAT change, but it is a major shift, and I just wish the
information was included in the release notes. It would have saved us many
hours of troubleshooting and undue stress. You see, we moved from Samigo
2.0.0 (in our pilot production) all the way to 2.1 and it was hard to know
if it was something we did to lose the all-powerful default template of the
past from our production environment. 

Thank you and your teammates for the change; it will eliminate most of the
faculty support issues with Samigo. 

Best,
Vivie

--
Vivian 'Vivie' Sinou
Dean, Learning Technology & Innovations
Foothill College



> > -----Original Message-----
>  
> > > The default template was removed by design for Sakai 2.1.  
> > We figured
> > > that since all settings should be viewable/editable by 
> default from 
> > > now on,  it would simplify things for instructors if the default 
> > > template was
> > > transparent.   An instructor should only need to deal with 
> > > templates if she
> > > or he wants to limit the available settings in created 
> assessments.
> > > 
> > > Does that make sense? There shouldn't be any loss of
> > functionality at
> > > all (if there is for you, please let us know!);  the 
> intent of this 
> > > change just to make the user experience less confusing.
> > Hopefully it
> > > won't have the opposite effect. :)
> > > 
> > > Thanks,
> > > Margaret
> > > Stanford QA
> > > 
> > >

body:
At 05:23 AM 12/19/2005, Magnus wrote:

>In test and quizzes, one of our teachers have fill in the blanks questions 
>with acceptable variations of the correct answers (like 
>{case1|case2|case3}). When the students has done the test some (not all) 
>student results are doubled compared to the dessignated point.
>
>This behaviour is close: 
>http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/jira/browse/SAK-2683, but it seems as it is 
>the "piped" ( | ) answer key and not the wildcards that somehow is messed 
>up for us...

Hi Magnus,

It sounds as though you may be seeing the same bug we are 
here:  SAK-3005.  We're working on it and will let you know when we have a 
fix.  (If the description in the comments doesn't match what you are 
seeing, can you send me more details?)

Thanks,
Margaret
Stanford QA

body:
yes, we have this; nevertheless the template shows up once I start creating
a quizz and want to change the settings. I'm not sure if it has to do 
with realms.
Feliz

Quoting Vivian 'Vivie' Sinou <SinouVivian@foothill.edu>:

> Is anyone running Samigo with Sakai 2.1 (MySQL)? We are experiencing a
> strange (blocker!) situation where there is NO default template in any of
> our course sites - new or existing - for the Instructor role (though all
> perms are checked). Only Sakai admin has access to the default template. I
> understand that there were improvements in the default template in 2.1
> (flexibility in editing), so one should be there, right?
> 
> Have we overlooked something or is there a known issue? Any tips would be
> greatly appreciated. 
> 
> Thanks,
> 
> Vivie
> 
> --

body:
Stupid question... don't beat me, I can't see the wood for the trees... ;)

I have a project below 
osid/api-impl/src/java/org/sakaiproject/component/osid/repository/

and want to use DomUtils and StringUtils from org.sakaiproject.tool.util.

I added a dependency for sakai-osid-repo-test in osid/api-impl/project.xml:

<dependency>
<groupId>sakaiproject</groupId>
<artifactId>sakai-osid-repo-test</artifactId>
<version>${sakai.version}</version>
</dependency>

but sakai-osid-repo-test-* only exists as war, so maven attempts to 
download some sakai-osid-repo-test-*.jar, which doesn't exist.

Without the dependency maven failed while compiling sources with 
org.sakaiproject.tool.util.*

Any ideas?

Thanks
Jan

PS: sorry for that dumb question, but it's a bit too late for me to see 
the right answer... :)

subject: re: update db 2.0 to 2.1
headers:

body:
Can anyone verify for me that the script in the 2.1 source for db
upgrade is in fact using MYSql syntax please?

-Dan



-----Original Message-----
From: Cotton, Dan 
Sent: Tuesday, January 03, 2006 6:32 AM
To: Hans Masing
Cc: sakai-dev
Subject: RE: Update db 1.5.1 to 2.0

I am using the one fro the docs\updating folder. Attached is the script
I have from the source.



-----Original Message-----
From: Hans Masing [mailto:hmasing@umich.edu]
Sent: Tuesday, January 03, 2006 5:57 AM
To: Cotton, Dan
Cc: sakai-dev
Subject: Re: Update db 1.5.1 to 2.0

Are you using the MySql version of the conversion script?  The syntax of
the ALTER TABLE statement looks an awful lot like the Oracle syntax.

- Hans


On Jan 3, 2006, at 12:58 AM, Cotton, Dan wrote:

> I have managed to get the script files changed to eliminate errors 
> when running the script to upfate the db from 1.5.1 to 2.0. I am now 
> stuck on getting from 2.0 to 2.1.
>
> I am trying to run the upgrade script located in the source files for 
> 2.1. I am running MYSql 4.1 on a windows box. I am running the upgrade

> script via the command line.
>
> Here is where I am stuck:
>
> This line is in the script from Sakai:
>
> ALTER TABLE SAKAI_SITE_GROUP
> ADD  ( FOREIGN KEY (SITE_ID) REFERENCES SAKAI_SITE );
>
> It fails with this error:
> ERROR 1005 (HY000) at line 32: Can't create table 
> '.\sakai\#sql-350_8.frm' (errno: 150)
>
> Which, according to MYSql web site, 1005 (ER_CANT_CREATE_TABLE)
>
> Cannot create table. If the error message string refers to errno 150, 
> table creation failed because a foreign key constraint was not 
> correctly formed.
>
>
>
> Now If I use the GUI tool for MYSQL and manually try to make the 
> change that this line wants, the GUI tool produces this sql statement:
>
> ALTER TABLE `sakai`.`sakai_site_group` ADD CONSTRAINT 
> `FK_sakai_site_group_1` FOREIGN KEY `FK_sakai_site_group_1`
> (`SITE_ID`)
> REFERENCES `sakai_site` (`SITE_ID`)
> ON DELETE RESTRICT
> ON UPDATE RESTRICT;		
>
> If I run this it works. I don't want to modify all the upgrade 
> scripts, shouldn't have to. What am I missing?
>
> -Dan
>
>
>
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Andrew Poland [mailto:ajpoland@iupui.edu]
> Sent: Tuesday, December 20, 2005 11:44 AM
> To: Cotton, Dan
> Cc: sakai-dev
> Subject: Re: Update db 1.5.1 to 2.0
>
> I'm guessing perhaps your client's connection character set and 
> collation does not match the charset/collation of your database.
>
> use these to change the connection mode:
>
> set NAMES utf8;
> set CHARACTER SET utf8;
>
> (http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/charset-connection.html)
>
>
> Or change the default character set for your database:
>
> ALTER DATABASE database_name DEFAULT CHARACTER SET utf8 COLLATE 
> utf8_general_ci;
>
>
>
> (Make a backup first of course.)
>
> Andrew
>
> On Dec 20, 2005, at 2:16 PM, Cotton, Dan wrote:
>
>> The line generates this error:
>>
>> Illegal mix of collations (latin1_swedish_ci,COERCIBLE) and
>> (utf8_general_ci,IMPLICIT) for operation 'concat'
>>
>> -----Original Message-----
>> From: Cotton, Dan
>> Sent: Tuesday, December 20, 2005 11:12 AM
>> To: sakai-dev
>> Subject: RE: Update db 1.5.1 to 2.1
>>
>> This line is currently giving me problems:
>>
>> update SAKAI_SITE_TOOL set REGISTRATION=concat('sakai',
>> substr(REGISTRATION,5)) where UPPER(substr(REGISTRATION,1,4))='CHEF';
>>
>>
>>
>> -----Original Message-----
>> From: Cotton, Dan
>> Sent: Tuesday, December 20, 2005 11:04 AM
>> To: sakai-dev
>> Subject: RE: Update db 1.5.1 to 2.1
>>
>> Has anyone got this to work? I am removing lines that through errors 
>> and keep getting more.
>>
>> Attached are the scripts I found on the sakai site for the 
>> converisons.
>>
>>
>>
>> -----Original Message-----
>> From: Cotton, Dan
>> Sent: Tuesday, December 20, 2005 10:42 AM
>> To: Charles Severance
>> Cc: sakai-dev
>> Subject: RE: Update db 1.5.1 to 2.1
>>
>> Ok, I am running the 1.5 to 2.0 script and get the following error:
>>
>> ERROR 1267 (HY000) at line 23: Illegal mix of collations
>> (latin1_swedish_ci,COERCIBLE) and (utf8_general_ci,IMPLICIT) for 
>> operation 'concat'
>>
>> Can't seem to get past this
>>
>> -----Original Message-----
>> From: Charles Severance [mailto:csev@umich.edu]
>> Sent: Tuesday, December 20, 2005 10:37 AM
>> To: Cotton, Dan
>> Cc: sakai-dev
>> Subject: Re: Update db 1.5.1 to 2.1
>>
>> Generally the approach is to convert through each intermediate 
>> release
>
>> and be careful.
>>
>> You should do 1.5.1 -> 2.0 and then 2.0 -> 2.1
>>
>> You should make nice backups at each step and make sure to do a light

>> test with 2.0 during the middle step to make sure it all looks fine.
>>
>> /Chuck
>>
>> On Dec 20, 2005, at 1:26 PM, Cotton, Dan wrote:
>>
>>> Are there any scripts for updating a Sakai 1.5.1 MYSql db to 2.1?
>>>
>>> -Dan
>>>

body:
Is there a way to restrict the creation of course sites using realms and
permissions while allowing users to create as many project sites as they
want? If not through the realms, is there another way to do it?
Thanks
-AZ

--
Aaron Zeckoski (aaronz@vt.edu)
Lead Developer - Learning Technologies - Virginia Tech

Archived-At: <http://permalink.gmane.org/gmane.comp.cms.sakai.devel/320>
body:
Johan,

We had windows clients hanging in the same configuration as yours; I'm not
sure if it's a proxy in the middle or Apache, but here goes what we found out:

the doPropfind method opens an input stream with 0 bytes to read and blocks:


legacy/dav/src/java/org/sakaiproject/dav/DavServlet.java

after:

DocumentBuilder documentBuilder = getDocumentBuilder();

// Parse the input XML to see what they really want
try {
InputStream is = req.getInputStream();

add:
if(is.available() == 0) throw new Exception("Exception:
Zero bytes");

you have probably to import java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException; 

I hope it helps;

Without Apache this didn't happen.

Feliz

Quoting Johan van den Berg <vdberj@unisa.ac.za>:

> If I try to connect to webdav through apache/ssl/mod_jk, the windows xp
> wizard just hangs, whereas if I try directly to port 8080 on tomcat, it
> works just fine.
> 
> Anyone else see this happening on 2.0.1?
> 
> Also, I checked the code, and it seems as though all error messages are
> just ignored, and never sent back to the client (not even logged at the
> moment), so I hacked the code a bit to return a response.sendError with
> the message, so at least now XP comes back with a error if I try to go
> to an invalid course or invalid user, but still just hangs on a valid
> connection.
> 
> Any help would be appreciated, as we need this to allow our lecturers to
> easily import content from our legacy systems.  I don't really want them
> to go directly to tomcat, because then the webdav documentation that one
> gets on the resources page becomes invalid.
> 
> Kind regards
> Johan van den Berg
> University of South Africa
> 
> ----------------------
> This automatic notification message was sent by Sakai Collab
> (http://collab.sakaiproject.org/portal) from the Sakai Development site.
> You can modify how you receive notifications at My Workspace > Preferences.
> 
>

Archived-At: <http://permalink.gmane.org/gmane.comp.cms.sakai.devel/319>
body:
If I try to connect to webdav through apache/ssl/mod_jk, the windows xp
wizard just hangs, whereas if I try directly to port 8080 on tomcat, it
works just fine.

Anyone else see this happening on 2.0.1?

Also, I checked the code, and it seems as though all error messages are
just ignored, and never sent back to the client (not even logged at the
moment), so I hacked the code a bit to return a response.sendError with
the message, so at least now XP comes back with a error if I try to go
to an invalid course or invalid user, but still just hangs on a valid
connection.

Any help would be appreciated, as we need this to allow our lecturers to
easily import content from our legacy systems.  I don't really want them
to go directly to tomcat, because then the webdav documentation that one
gets on the resources page becomes invalid.

Kind regards
Johan van den Berg
University of South Africa

body:
Jan Kulmann wrote:
> Thanks to all who answered me!
> 
> Now I'm using CASfilter inside Tomcat. The "damn" https requirement 
> forced me to set up an SSL-Tomcat for CAS. When clicking the login link 
> it'll redirect me to my CAS server, but after submitting user 
> credentials, I got this exception in catalina.out:
> 
> WARN:  (2005-12-29 12:16:42,662 
> http-8180-Processor24_org.sakaiproject.util.RequestFilter)
> javax.servlet.ServletException: 
> sun.security.validator.ValidatorException: PKIX path building failed: 
> sun.security.provider.certpath.SunCertPathBuilderException: unable to 
> find valid certification path to requested target
> at 

Best guess I can make is that the certificate the CAS provider is 
producing isn't one that JVM trusts. Looks like you'll need to register 
the certificate into the JVM, using keytool etc. (Don't ask me how! I 
only remember this because of trouble I had with another certificate - 
in the end I registered the bouncycastle provider 'coz it gave me more 
configurable power.)

The thing to google is probably:

sun.security.provider.certpath.SunCertPathBuilderException

HTH

andy

-- 
Andrew Thornton
andrew@caret.cam.ac.uk / andrew@cbcl.co.uk

body:
This is something that's not really explained in the presentation:
The maven goals used by Sakai are only available if the maven sakai  
plugin is available. The plugin is available in two ways:
1) if you run maven against a project.xml file that has the sakai  
plugin as a dependency. See the project.xml file in the top-level  
Sakai source directory for an example of this.
2) if you install the Sakai plugin permanently into your maven  
installation. This is performed with the command maven  
plugin:download -DartifactId=sakai -DgroupId=sakaiproject - 
Dversion=2.1 -Dmaven.repo.remote=http://cvs.sakaiproject.org/maven/

In practical terms, this means that if you run maven in the same  
directory as the top level of the Sakai source code, you won't get  
the 'Goal "sakai:build" does not exist in this project.' error. On  
the other hand, if you just install the Sakai plugin for maven, you  
can run maven in any directory and it will know about all the maven  
sakai goals.

For your reference, here is a list of all the goals in the Sakai  
plugin for maven:
sakai ............................................ clean then build  
then deploy
sakai:build  ................................. compile and package  
the build
sakai:clean ................................. cleanup from prior builds
sakai:clean_build  ..................... clean and then build
sakai:clean_build_deploy  ...... clean then build then deploy
sakai:deploy  ............................. deploy to the local tomcat
sakai:deploy-report  ................. Report on what jars Sakai  
deploys - which
projects  
deploy what to where
sakai:deploy-zip  ...................... deploy to the  
maven.deploy.home and zip a
tomcat  
overlay structure
sakai:undeploy  ....................... remove from the local tomcat

regards,
Zach A. Thomas
Software Engineer
Texas State University
On Jan 4, 2006, at 12:27 AM, Sharrie wrote:

> Hi, the presentation does really help me a lot. It is really a  
> great job:).
> I followed your presentation to build sakai. Everything went  
> smoothly, but when I type
> maven sakai:build...
> it said ,"Goal "sakai:build" does not exist in this project."
> and I checked maven.xml, there are no such goal in it.
> I think maybe I get the wrong version or I should myself write  
> these goals.
>
> If you can send me a copy of this file or just give me some example  
> when you are convienient,
> I should be very appreciated.
>
>
> Best Regards!
> -- 
> Sharrie

body:
Hi Steven

I had a look around, and there is a pretty solid Java Web Service client
generator available from the Apache Axis project, at
http://ws.apache.org/axis . It contains a command line tool which passes a
WSDL file to a class called WSDL2Java, which then generates all the
necessary code.  The Javadoc for that class is here -
http://ws.apache.org/axis/java/apiDocs/org/apache/axis/wsdl/WSDL2Java.html.
I've tried out the latest stable version,
1.3, and it works very well.

The user guide for the WSDL2Java tool is at
http://ws.apache.org/axis/java/user-guide.html#WSDL2JavaBuildingStubsSkeletonsAndDataTypesFromWSDL

It also contains an Ant task to integrate the class building with an Ant
based build process.

So, an hour or so's work and it should be possible to generate client code
for all WSDL files in Sakai!

Hope this helps,

Shane

On 20/12/05, Steven Githens <s-githens@northwestern.edu> wrote:
>
> Hi Shane,
>
> Before I get too far, the OSS disclaimer:
>
> The current status of Web Services for Sakai is pretty standard Open
> Source fare.  Things are taking a while to bake, and even longer for
> them to get documented. Getting involved at this point will definatley
> involve digging through code, as there's nothing remotely close to nice
> MSDNish documentation. This could actually be pretty valuable for a
> senior CS student, but probably not since there are more fun things to
> do during a senior year.
>
> This isn't meant to be excuse, but an honest depiction of the current
> situation.  For the meantime you'll need to roll up your hacking sleeves
> and dig in.
>
> On to the points:
> 1.  I fear that there is not much documentation except my
> O'Reilly-wannabe-freeflowing english, and maybe a few other tidbits
> laying around.  :)
>
> I think Glenn is organizing a documentation project so perhaps something
> will come of that.
>
> There are not a substantial amount of web services yet, and they are
> changing quickly.  It's a relatively new thing inside of Sakai.
> Personally I'm shooting for having it coelecse into a nice framework
> around Sakai 2.2.
>
> 2. These sorts of client-binding API's are definately the subject of
> daydreams. I've started to work on something like this for Python and
> JavaScript because that's what I want to use personally.  We *might*
> have good enough autogenerators eventually to automatically create these
> libraries for other languages, but most likey it will just show up from
> somebody who really wants Java Delegates.
>
> As far as examples, some of this is actually my fault perse, as people
> do send me stuff on occasion and it takes me quite a while to get it
> into subversion, and even then it's not very organized. However, I
> haven't recieved any actual sample clients written in Java. ;)
>
> Everything you point out is pretty important, it just takes a long time
> to get it done.
>
> Discussion on the best way to proceed is always encouraged.  We have a
> web service list on collab too.
>
> -Steve
>
> (who's been awake for a while, so this email may not have flowed well)
>
> Shane O'Sullivan wrote:
>
> >There are two points to this post:
> >
> >1. Web services documentation for Sakai seems to be very lacking
> >2. Web services delegates would be very useful
> >
> >Firstly, I was looking for documentation on what web services are
> available
> >for Sakai, and was unable to find much at all.  Specifically what I was
> >looking for was:
> >- What web services are available?
> >- What are the available methods?
> >- What are the pre and post conditions of these methods?
> >- Are there any example web service clients, specifically in Java?  I've
> >noticed some talk of a VB.NET client called the Sakai Apple Desktop, but
> >can't find much of anything about it. Is the source available?
> >
> >Is there any documentation available that answers these questions?  And
> by
> >documentation, I mean structured documentation, not free-form English. If
> >so, could someone please point me to it.  If not, it would be a very good
> >idea to do some comprehensive documentation on these subjects.  I believe
> >there is a lot of potential for non-browser based clients for Sakai, but
> it
> >is difficult to do anything at all if it is necessary to go searching
> >through the code base for .jws files, and reading source code to write a
> >client.  It should simply be a matter of reading the documentation and
> >writing the code for accessing the Web Services - knowledge of Java
> should
> >not necessarily be a prerequisite.
> >
> >Secondly, I feel it would be very useful to have a set of Web Services
> >delegates for any applications that come as standard with the Sakai
> core.  I
> >understand that using Web Services with Apache Axis is a relatively
> simple
> >procedure, however the code is completely repetitive, and it requires
> Java
> >developers to learn how Apache Axis works (not a bad thing in and of
> itself,
> >but it does take time and might put off some people).  Also, every coder
> >writing Java code to access Sakai web services will write essentially the
> >same thing, albeit with small differences which increase the possibility
> of
> >errors.  I feel it would make more sense to standardise the client-side
> code
> >used to access the web services with some simple Java classes that do all
> >the Web-Service-specific coding.  This will also facilitate the sharing
> of
> >client-side code amongst developers.
> >
> >As a small aside, the main reason I post this is because I tried to
> convince
> >some 4th year Computer Science students to take on a final-year project
> to
> >write a Java-based Sakai Web Service client, but the lack of information
> and
> >the perceived lack of  serious support for non-browser access to Sakai
> put

headers:
From news@gmane.org Tue Mar 04 03:33:20 2003
From: Scott Amerson <sdamerson@ucdavis.edu>
Subject: Can Sakai's manner of storing course content on file system be overridden by a property/variable?
Date: Wed, 4 Jan 2006 11:31:57 -0800
Lines: 83
Message-ID: <7778392.1136403258186.JavaMail.tomcat5@mahimahi.ds.itd.umich.edu>

	boundary="----=_NextPart_000_0057_01C61122.78EE20F0"
X-Mailer: Microsoft Office Outlook 11

body:
Sakai-dev:



I have a couple of questions re: storing course content in the file system:



1.  Where is the inherent path detailed in code (e.g. ContentHostingService,
etc.)?  I am not talking about the ${sakai.home}/content override path, but
the actual YYYY/DDD/HH/id path given below. 



2. Is there a way to override Sakai's inherent pathing?  The below example
is taken from the Confluence page on configuration:



" Files will be stored under each volume in a way so that there are not too
many in any one folder. The folder structure Sakai uses is:

YYYY/DDD/HH/id, where YYYY=year, DDD=day of year, HH=hour of day, and the
1111...=an id-based file name



for example,



2005/070/03/3223479379834-2343



or, using the above root and volumes, it might be:



/usr/local/sakai/content/v2/2005/070/03/3223479379834-2343"





The reason for this override is to utilize our current AFS configuration if
possible. 





Thanks in advance,

Scott





Scott Amerson

Programmer

IET Middleware Team

530.757.8314



[see attachment: "message0.html", size: 6845 bytes]

body:
The tagged 2.1.0 version will never change; that's what a "tag" is  
for.  The fix you want is in the production branch:

https://source.sakaiproject.org/svn/branches/sakai_2-1/

The production branch is a stable as you find it to be.  Various  
folks are using code from the production branch in production (thus  
the name).  Indiana is one.  The purpose of the production branch is  
to have code that is bug-fix better than the 2.1.0 release.

Before you put this or any other code into production, testing is a  
good idea.

- Glenn

Glenn R. Golden
Sakai Framework Architect
University Of Michigan
ggolden@umich.edu


On Jan 4, 2006, at 12:05 PM, Beckett Paul Mr (ITCS) s167 wrote:

> I checked out the tags version of Sakai 2-1-0 yesterday revision 5070

> workspace) I still get the error message "Alert: The user id is
> invalid".
> Perhaps this is due to some misunderstanding on my part about where I
> should download the source from.
> Is the 'tags' release different to the maintenance branch? If so,  
> where
> is the maintenance branch? is it as stable for production use as tags?
>
> Many Thanks,
>
> Paul
>

body:
Glenn R. Golden wrote:

> The code that forms the path is in the content hosting service  
> implementation, either the base or the db version.  If you need to  
> change it, you should be able to extend the class and replace the  
> pathing code with your own version, then register the new code as the  
> content hosting service implementation.
>
> But... don't think that you can change it so that you can "tie in" to  
> an existing set of AFS space that the user already has.  This will  
> not work.  Sakai needs a private file system to store the body bytes  
> of the files in content hosting - this is really a mixed store, with  
> the meta data in the database and the bytes in files in the file  
> system.  This private file system must be private to Sakai; the Sakai  
> servers must have credentials to work in there, and no other process  
> should be creating or deleting files from this private file system.
>
> Specifically, if you have end-user AFS space, this cannot be tied  
> into in Sakai with the content hosting service we currently have.   
> Not to say that it can't be written... problems include proxying the  
> end-user's credentials through the Sakai server to access the data,  
> and synchronizing the meta data in the Sakai database with changes   
> made by other applications to the file area.
>
> - Glenn

I'm still thinking about this for our needs, Scott and Glenn - the key 
looks to be implementing a Hands Off security model. The content must 
remain immune to end-user tinkering.

In our current offering we do this by close setting of the AFS ACLs. 
Members of a course have access to the course AFS space
with the exception of the contained CourseWork managed 'subdirectories.'

The real win for us is in per-course (dept, etc) Quota Management. 
ka-CHING$$$!!


----------------------

Archived-At: <http://permalink.gmane.org/gmane.comp.cms.sakai.devel/339>
body:
The code that forms the path is in the content hosting service  
implementation, either the base or the db version.  If you need to  
change it, you should be able to extend the class and replace the  
pathing code with your own version, then register the new code as the  
content hosting service implementation.

But... don't think that you can change it so that you can "tie in" to  
an existing set of AFS space that the user already has.  This will  
not work.  Sakai needs a private file system to store the body bytes  
of the files in content hosting - this is really a mixed store, with  
the meta data in the database and the bytes in files in the file  
system.  This private file system must be private to Sakai; the Sakai  
servers must have credentials to work in there, and no other process  
should be creating or deleting files from this private file system.

Specifically, if you have end-user AFS space, this cannot be tied  
into in Sakai with the content hosting service we currently have.   
Not to say that it can't be written... problems include proxying the  
end-user's credentials through the Sakai server to access the data,  
and synchronizing the meta data in the Sakai database with changes   
made by other applications to the file area.

- Glenn

Glenn R. Golden
Sakai Framework Architect
University Of Michigan
ggolden@umich.edu


On Jan 4, 2006, at 2:31 PM, Scott Amerson wrote:

> Sakai-dev:
>
>
>
> I have a couple of questions re: storing course content in the file  
> system:
>
>
>
> 1.  Where is the inherent path detailed in code (e.g.  
> ContentHostingService,
> etc.)?  I am not talking about the ${sakai.home}/content override  
> path, but
> the actual YYYY/DDD/HH/id path given below.
>
>
>
> 2. Is there a way to override Sakai's inherent pathing?  The below  
> example
> is taken from the Confluence page on configuration:
>
>
>
> " Files will be stored under each volume in a way so that there are  
> not too
> many in any one folder. The folder structure Sakai uses is:
>
> YYYY/DDD/HH/id, where YYYY=year, DDD=day of year, HH=hour of day,  
> and the
> 1111...=an id-based file name
>
>
>
> for example,
>
>
>
> 2005/070/03/3223479379834-2343
>
>
>
> or, using the above root and volumes, it might be:
>
>
>
> /usr/local/sakai/content/v2/2005/070/03/3223479379834-2343"
>
>
>
>
>
> The reason for this override is to utilize our current AFS  
> configuration if
> possible.
>
>
>
>
>
> Thanks in advance,
>
> Scott

>

On Wed, 2006-01-04 at 10:15 +0000, fribeiro@ufp.pt wrote:
> Johan,
> 
> We had windows clients hanging in the same configuration as yours; I'm not
> sure if it's a proxy in the middle or Apache, but here goes what we found out:
> 
> the doPropfind method opens an input stream with 0 bytes to read and blocks:
> 
> 
> legacy/dav/src/java/org/sakaiproject/dav/DavServlet.java
> 
> after:
> 
> DocumentBuilder documentBuilder = getDocumentBuilder();
> 
> // Parse the input XML to see what they really want
> try {
> InputStream is = req.getInputStream();
> 
> add:
> if(is.available() == 0) throw new Exception("Exception:
> Zero bytes");
> 
> you have probably to import java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException; 
> 
> I hope it helps;
> 
> Without Apache this didn't happen.
> 
> Feliz
> 
> Quoting Johan van den Berg <vdberj@unisa.ac.za>:
> 
> > If I try to connect to webdav through apache/ssl/mod_jk, the windows xp
> > wizard just hangs, whereas if I try directly to port 8080 on tomcat, it
> > works just fine.
> > 
> > Anyone else see this happening on 2.0.1?
> > 
> > Also, I checked the code, and it seems as though all error messages are
> > just ignored, and never sent back to the client (not even logged at the
> > moment), so I hacked the code a bit to return a response.sendError with
> > the message, so at least now XP comes back with a error if I try to go
> > to an invalid course or invalid user, but still just hangs on a valid
> > connection.
> > 
> > Any help would be appreciated, as we need this to allow our lecturers to
> > easily import content from our legacy systems.  I don't really want them
> > to go directly to tomcat, because then the webdav documentation that one
> > gets on the resources page becomes invalid.
> > 
> > Kind regards
> > Johan van den Berg
> > University of South Africa
> >

Archived-At: <http://permalink.gmane.org/gmane.comp.cms.sakai.devel/343>
body:
Hi,

As we are expanding our services at UC Berkeley, we have found that 
adding application servers to our load balanced setup has greatly 
increased the number of opened connection pools to our Oracle DB. From 
our research, we find that each instance of Sakai opens 32 connections 
to Oracle by default (no setting changes) and even if you lower the 
minIdle/maxIdle configurations in sakai.properties, you still get 32 
connections once someone connects to it initially.

If someone can confirm these findings, that would be great. And if 
anyone has any ideas on how to reduce the number of connections without 
affecting Sakai, that would be very helpful as well.

Thanks,

-- 
Kevin Chan

Systems Administrator
Educational Technology Services
University of California, Berkeley

----------------------

Archived-At: <http://permalink.gmane.org/gmane.comp.cms.sakai.devel/340>
body:
I am considering building an online course to deliver SCUBA instruction and am investigating Sakai as a platform for doing so. Before I proceed, I was hoping to get some feedback on whether Sakai is a good fit for the application.

Here are some of our requirements:

1) Deliver multi-media content in the form of Java Applets & QuickTime clips.

2) Create an "audit trail" of time spent on each section and quiz question answers.

3) Create a pool of questions that all test the same concept. This is required since we require 100% Correct answers prior to moving on to the next section of the course. We will continue to test the student until they achieve 100%.

4) Ideally, would like to deliver the same course with unique branding elements depending on the url the course was initially accessed from. In other words, include the logo for a marketing partner that is using the platform to train students.

5) Dynamically register students after they have paid for the class. Currently, we automatically send the student an email with a unique access code (dynamically pulled from a table of pre-made access codes) right after they complete the purchase of the class.

6) Allow the student to come back and "review" the course material after "graduation" whenever they feel like it.

Other than these requirements, I think that our needs are pretty basic.

If you have a moment to respond to this post, I'd really appreciate it.
**********************************************************************************************

Hi Aaaron,

I'm facing the same problem and even tried to accomplish that by editing 
the file "legacy/tools/src/webapp/tools/sakai.sitesetup.xml" like this:
<!-- <configuration name="siteTypes" value="course,project" /> -->

"Worksite Setup"/New (only in "Sites"/New)....
Still searching for a solution...

nuno.

body:
I checked out the tags version of Sakai 2-1-0 yesterday revision 5070
from SVN ( svn co https://source.sakaiproject.org/svn/tags_2-1-0 ),
which still has the same problem: I can't use the at symbol (@) in
usernames. When attempting to create a user (through the admin
workspace) I still get the error message "Alert: The user id is
invalid".
Perhaps this is due to some misunderstanding on my part about where I
should download the source from.
Is the 'tags' release different to the maintenance branch? If so, where
is the maintenance branch? is it as stable for production use as tags?

Many Thanks,

Paul

>-----Original Message-----
>From: Glenn R. Golden [mailto:ggolden@umich.edu] 
>Sent: Friday, December 16, 2005 1:19 PM
>To: Beckett Paul Mr (ITCS) s167
>Cc: sakai-dev
>Subject: Re: Email address as username
>
>This has been fixed and is available in the 2.1 production branch.   
> From the logs:
>
>r4598 | zqian@umich.edu | 2005-12-13 23:17:03 -0500 (Tue, 13 Dec  
>2005) | 5 lines
>
>Fix to SAK-111: WS: Add Participants Error Sometimes on Username(s).
>
>Added a checkUserId() call in Validator to bypass the '@' invalid  
>resource id char problem.
>Change the addUser() in BaseUserDirectory to use checkUserId()  
>instead of checkResourceId().
>Minor fixes in WS to enhance the format of alert/log messages.
>
>- Glenn
>
>Glenn R. Golden
>Sakai Framework Architect
>University Of Michigan
>ggolden@umich.edu
>
>
>On Dec 16, 2005, at 7:18 AM, Beckett Paul Mr (ITCS) s167 wrote:
>
>> In our sakai 2.0.1 installation we were using email 
>addresses as sakai
>> user-names.
>> We've installed a Sakai 2.1.0  system ready for the next 
>semester, but
>> this doesn't seem to allow the at symbol '@' to be used in the  
>> username.
>> Is this a peculiarity of my installation? Can I change it to 
>allow the
>> use of email addresses as usernames again?
>>
>> Cheers,
>>
>> Paul
